issueDTO.title: Missing docstring items for Expression page of API Docs
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

No

### Describe the solution you'd like

The following [Expressions](https://docs.daft.ai/en/stable/api/expressions/) are missing items in the docstring. See also [`expressions.py`](https://github.com/Eventual-Inc/Daft/blob/main/daft/expressions/expressions.py):

- [ ] abs (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] agg_concat (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] agg_list (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] agg_set (parameters)
- [ ] any_value (return, example)
- [ ] approx_count_distinct ((parameters, return)
- [ ] arccos (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] arccosh (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] arcsin (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] arcsinh (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] arctan (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] arctan2 (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] arctanh (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] as_py (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] between (parameters)
- [ ] bitwise_and (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] bitwise_or (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] bitwise_xor (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] bool_and (parameters, return)
- [ ] bool_or (parameters, return)
- [ ] cast (parameters)
- [ ] cbrt (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] ceil (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] clip (return, example)
- [ ] cos (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] cosh (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] cot (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] count (return, example)
- [ ] count_distinct (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] csc (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] degrees (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] deserialize (example)
- [ ] eq_null_safe (example)
- [ ] exp (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] explode (parameters, return)
- [ ] expm1 (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] fill_null (parameters)
- [ ] floor (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] hash (return, example)
- [ ] is_in (parameters)
- [ ] is_null (parameters)
- [ ] ln (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] log (return, example)
- [ ] log10 (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] log1p (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] log2 (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] max (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] mean (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] min (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] minhash (return, example)
- [ ] name (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] negate (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] negative (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] not_null (parameters)
- [ ] radians (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] round (return, example)
- [ ] sec (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] serialize (example)
- [ ] shift_left (return, example)
- [ ] shift_right (return, example)
- [ ] sign (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] signum (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] sin (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] sinh (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] sqrt (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] stddev (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] sum (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] tan (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] tanh (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] to_arrow_expr (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] try_decode (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] try_deserialize (example)
- [ ] try_encode (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] udf (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] url_parse (parameters)
- [ ] struct.get (example)
- [ ] image.crop (example)
- [ ] image.decode (example)
- [ ] image.encode (example)
- [ ] image.resize (example)
- [ ] image.to_mode (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] partition.days (example)
- [ ] partition.hours (example)
- [ ] partition.iceberg_bucket (example)
- [ ] partition.iceberg_truncate (example)
- [ ] partition.months (example)
- [ ] partition.years (example)
- [ ] url.download (example)
- [ ] url.upload (example)
- [ ] visit (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] visit_ (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] visit_alias (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] visit_cast (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] visit_col (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] visit_function (parameters, return, example)
- [ ] visit_lit (parameters, return, example)

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional Context

The docstring format should be:
```
def method(args) -> return:
    """Summary of method

    Args:
        arg1: description

    Returns:
        return1: description

    Raises: title (optional)
         description

    Warning: title (optional)
         description

    Note: title (optional)
         description

    Examples: (make sure this is plural!)
        >>> lines of code
        output

    Tip: title (optional)
         Tip content
    """
```

### Would you like to implement a fix?

No
comments:

Thanks.

@TheOphige I've updated the link to documentation and also added the relevant file! Most of these are only missing examples, but if any docstrings are missing parameters/returns, feel free to add them too. I'll update the issue for which expressions are missing what.

Thanks in advance!

issueDTO.title: VisibleOnScreenEnabler3D editor gizmo behaves differently from other 3D nodes
issueDTO.description:
### Tested versions

- Reproducible in Godot v4.4.beta3

### System information

Godot v4.4.beta3 - Windows 11 (build 22631) - Multi-window, 3 monitors - Vulkan (Forward+) - dedicated NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070 (NVIDIA; 32.0.15.6614) - AMD Ryzen 5 3600 6-Core Processor (12 threads)

### Issue description

- The VisibleOnScreenEnabler3D still has the old points for moving it's likely been forgotten since it's not a commonly used node, but it should receive the new move points that the CSG Shapes and Fog Volume received, so everything behaves in the same way.

### Steps to reproduce

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c5e02b83-94a1-44ca-997f-6add94921698

### Minimal reproduction project (MRP)

n/a
comments:
I can confirm this on 4.5.beta f92f1ce9c07d35b0e3843415bf99a509d3a51add (Linux).

This can be addressed by using the Gizmo3DHelper class in [`visible_on_screen_notifier_3d_gizmo_plugin.cpp`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/editor/scene/3d/gizmos/visible_on_screen_notifier_3d_gizmo_plugin.cpp). See this PR for an example:

- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/89320
Hi, can I work on this issue? Looking for a first time contribution.

issueDTO.title: Add support for Anthropic's DXT standard / format
issueDTO.description:
[Anthropic released](https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/desktop-extensions) their spec for a `.dxt` extension format (also see [their core repo](https://github.com/anthropics/dxt).

It'd be great to see this format supported by `mcp-use`, such that you could just point the API at a `.dxt` file and that'd be enough to install / setup the client with a new MCP server.
comments: Hey @strickvl saw the release! It'd be indeed nice to have here, and it does not look overly complicated, we'll have a stab at it
looks interesting! can I have a shot at this?
@EraKin575  Go for it!

summary.otherNotes: Anthropic released their spec for a .dxt extension format, and it would be great to support this format in mcp-use, allowing users to install/setup the client with a new MCP server by pointing the API at a .dxt file.

issueDTO.title: Calico node check includes false negatives for modern Linux distros
issueDTO.description:
## Expected Behavior
Expect Calico node check to not return an error if the OS supports all the features it needs.

## Current Behavior

calicoctl node checksystem fails ipt_set, xt_icmp, xt_icmp6, and xt_rpfilter checks.

```
# calicoctl node checksystem  
Checking kernel version...
5.4.83-flatcar      OK
Checking kernel modules...
ip_set              OK
ip_tables           OK
ip6_tables          OK
ipt_REJECT          OK
ipt_rpfilter        OK
WARNING: Unable to detect the ipt_set module as Loaded/Builtin module or lsmod
ipt_set             FAIL
nf_conntrack_netlink OK
xt_addrtype         OK
xt_conntrack        OK
WARNING: Unable to detect the xt_icmp module as Loaded/Builtin module or lsmod
xt_icmp             FAIL
WARNING: Unable to detect the xt_icmp6 module as Loaded/Builtin module or lsmod
xt_icmp6            FAIL
xt_ipvs             OK
xt_mark             OK
xt_multiport        OK
WARNING: Unable to detect the xt_rpfilter module as Loaded/Builtin module or lsmod
xt_rpfilter         FAIL
xt_set              OK
xt_u32              OK
System doesn't meet one or more minimum systems requirements to run Calico
```

## Possible Solution
Update node check logic. 
If the "ipt_set" module is built-in (as is the case with Flatcar and likely these other distros too), then "sudo modprobe ipt_set" is a no-op and it does not show up in "lsmod | grep ipt_set"
We believe the checks for "xt_icmp", "xt_icmp6", and "xt_rpfilter" are outdated as those modules don't exist / aren't available in Flatcar, Debian or Fedora.
Alternate methods of testing for the presence of required features should be used, or the tests removed, or at a minimum the summary text changed to indicate that the results do not necessarily mean minimum system requirements are not met. 

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
1. install Calico on latest Flatcar, Ubuntu, Fedora, or Debian
2. run calicoctl noode checksystem 
3. observe output

## Context
Impacted a Flatcar user that was trying to deploy Calico. Has also been reported by kubespray users - see https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kubespray/issues/6289

## Your Environment
* Calico version: 3.16
* Orchestrator version (e.g. kubernetes, mesos, rkt): Kubernetes
* Operating System and version: Flatcar 2605 (also present on Ubuntu 18.04 and others)
comments:
> Alternate methods of testing for the presence of required features should be used, or the tests removed, or at a minimum the summary text changed to indicate that the results do not necessarily mean minimum system requirements are not met.

Yep, I agree with all of this.
@frozenprocess I've seen this one impacting a number of folks recently, if you're interested in giving it a go!

For `ipt_set` I think it would be ok to `PASS` the test if `xt_SET` is present.
```
core@localhost ~ $ modinfo xt_set -F alias       
ip6t_SET
ipt_SET
ip6t_set
ipt_set
xt_SET
core@localhost ~ $ modinfo xt_set -F description
Xtables: IP set match and target module
```

I think it is safe to pass `xt_icmp` and `xt_icmp6` if icmp is present in `ip_tables_matches` file.
```
sudo cat /proc/net/ip_tables_matches | grep icmp
icmp
```
WDYT?
Hi all, FWIW I'm also experiencing this same problem on Suse Enterprise Linux 15.2 (SLES 15.2). Thanks for digging into this, helps to know I can ignore this problem when trying to stand up canal.
I believe @frozenprocess made some good improvements to this for v3.19. I'm going to close this for now, but please report back if this is still an issue once we release v3.19.

                xt_u32                                                  FAIL

                xt_conntrack                                            OK

Also I have xt_set loaded, and ipt_set is still failing....
[root@k8s-test ~]$ lsmod | grep xt_set
xt_set                 16384  4

issueDTO.title: MudAppBar and MudDrawer Breakpoint Inconsistent when using AndXX
issueDTO.description:
### Things to check

- [x] I have searched the **existing issues** for this bug
- [x] To rule out a caching problem I made sure the bug also happens in an **incognito tab**

### Bug type

Component

### Component name

MudAppBar + MudDrawer

### What happened?

When using `AndXX` as the breakpoint for `MudDrawer` the `MudAppBar` overlaps the MudDrawer however when using just `XX` it appears to work as expected

### Expected behavior

The AppBar should be pushed to left of the drawer instead of overlapping it

### Reproduction link

https://try.mudblazor.com/snippet/wYcfOokIzRgzQUhs

### Reproduction steps

1. Create a MudAppBar
2. Create a MudDrawer
3. Set Drawer  Breakpoint="@Breakpoint.SmAndDown"
...


### Relevant log output

```shell

```

### Version (bug)

8.5.1

### Version (working)

_No response_

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Edge

### On which operating systems are you experiencing the issue?

Windows

### Pull Request

- [ ] I would like to do a Pull Request

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments:
I guess the problem is this line:
https://github.com/MudBlazor/MudBlazor/blob/6cdb07acb29101087e6cc24c4b6d169caa7dcbd5/src/MudBlazor/Components/Drawer/MudDrawer.razor.cs#L73
and should be:
```C#
.AddClass($"mud-drawer-overlay-{NormalizeBreakpoint(_breakpointState.Value.ToDescriptionString())}")
```
Tho I don't see explanation why `mud-drawer-open-mini-smanddown-left` and `mud-drawer-open-mini-sm-left` behave differently?

> Its because there is not CSS for `mud-layout mud-drawer-close-mini-smanddown-left`
> 
> The CSS currently for positioning the AppBar in the correct place assumes `.mud-drawer-close-mini-sm-left.mud-drawer-left-clipped-never`
> 
> .mud-drawer-close-mini-sm-left.mud-drawer-left-clipped-never .mud-appbar {
>     margin-left: var(--mud-drawer-width-mini-left);
>     width: calc(100% - var(--mud-drawer-width-mini-left))
> }

Makes sense:
https://github.com/MudBlazor/MudBlazor/blob/9c1992f38695786662612437fa25044b1ef62f24/src/MudBlazor/Styles/layout/_appbar.scss#L129-L131

Apparently only these breakpoints are defined:
https://github.com/MudBlazor/MudBlazor/blob/9c1992f38695786662612437fa25044b1ef62f24/src/MudBlazor/Styles/abstracts/_variables.scss#L5-L10

So I guess the `NormalizeBreakpoint` would be indeed a proper fix to this.

repository.description: Blazor Component Library based on Material Design principles with an emphasis on ease of use and extensibility
repository.name: MudBlazor

summary.main: MudAppBar and MudDrawer Breakpoint Inconsistent when using AndXX
summary.validationOrRequirement: The AppBar should be pushed to left of the drawer instead of overlapping it
summary.attemptedFixes: NormalizeBreakpoint would be a proper fix to this
summary.otherNotes: The problem is in the line https://github.com/MudBlazor/MudBlazor/blob/6cdb07acb29101087e6cc24c4b6d169caa7dcbd5/src/MudBlazor/Components/Drawer/MudDrawer.razor.cs#L73 and should be fixed by adding CSS for mud-layout mud-drawer-close-mini-smanddown-left, and the NormalizeBreakpoint would be a proper fix to this.

issueDTO.title: Broken: Vega chart creation plugin
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**

The Vega chart creation plugin is not properly registered in the main plugin system, making it completely non-functional despite existing in the codebase. The plugin implementation exists at vega.ts:8-52 and is configured in default settings at [[2](#9-1)](settings.json:432-434), but it's missing from the `availablePlugins` registry. This causes:

1. The plugin doesn't appear in Settings ??? Plugins UI
2. The plugin doesn't appear in per-LLM tool selection
3. LLMs cannot call the `vega_chart_creation` function
4. Vega charts are never generated, only raw JSON is returned

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to 'Settings' ??? 'Plugins' 
2. Notice that no "Vega" plugin appears in the list (despite existing in codebase)
3. Go to 'Chat' ??? Select any LLM ??? Settings ??? Plugins Customize
4. Notice that no "Vega" plugin appears in the list here either
5. In any chat, prompt an LLM _either_: A: "Use_ the vega_chart_creation function to create a bar chart" _or_ B:  "Create a Vega chart that displays a bar chart showing monthly sales data for the first 6 months of 2024: January: $45,000, February: $52,000, March: $48,000, April: $61,000, May: $58,000, June: $67,000. Generate a visualization so I can see it rendered inline in the chat and test the interactive features like theme switching, code viewing, and download functionality"
6. See that the LLM returns raw Vega JSON specification instead of calling the plugin function

- Tested with multiple LLM providers: Grok 4, GPT-4.1, Kimi K2, and Claude Sonnet 4 - all exhibit the same behavior. Vega charts are never generated, only raw JSON is returned.

**Expected behavior**
1. IMO, the Vega plugin doesn't need to appear in Witsy's UI under Settings ??? Plugins. It should be enabled by default (same as mermaid diagrams)
2. The plugin should however appear in the per-LLM tool selection interfaces (described in step 3. above, under "To Reproduce")
3. LLMs should be able to call the `vega_chart_creation` function and render the charts
4. The plugin should execute vega.ts:44-50 and generate PNG chart images that get embedded in chat responses

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: macOS Sequoia 15.5
 - Witsy Version: 2.11.2 (1042)

**Additional context**
As far as I can tell, the root cause is that the Vega plugin is not registered in the `availablePlugins` object. While the plugin implementation exists and is actually also referenced in the UI settings component SettingsPlugins.vue:64, it's never actually loaded by the plugin system base.ts:402-455.

I think the fix would be to add `vega: VegaPlugin` to the `availablePlugins` registry along with the appropriate import statement. This would make the plugin available to both the UI system and the LLM loading mechanisms in base.ts:402-455.

This appears to be an incomplete feature integration where the plugin code was implemented but never properly wired into the main plugin architecture.
comments: Vega is not broken. It has never been published. Not a priority right now unless someone wants to contribute 😀

Aha, OK, I see. I am not sure how to do this.

Right now I am trying to develop new "Liquid glass" themes for Witsy. Both for light mode and dark mode. I'm trying to find out how Apple natively implements this through its API, so I can hopefully use that to integrate with the macOS system. However, I must also create fall-back for Windows and other OS. It's a little challenging, especially because I have never done any UI development before - ever 😆

issueDTO.title: Offloading of objects during registration is a difficult to debug trap for inexperienced users
issueDTO.description:
### Discussed in https://github.com/flyteorg/flyte/discussions/4743
Originally posted by **fg91** January 18, 2024 Let us consider an example where 1) the type engine transports an object by offloading it to blob storage (in this case as a pickle file) and 2) where this object is instantiated not in a task but when calling a task in a workflow: ```py from flytekit import task, workflow class Config: """Something that is transported by the Flyte type engine via pickle.""" def __init__(self, a) -> None: self.a = a @task def print_config(config: Config) -> None: print(config) @workflow def wf(): print_config(config=Config(a=5)) ``` This workflow fails with: ```console File ".../flytekit/core/base_task.py", line 626, in dispatch_execute raise type(exc)(msg) from exc Message: Failed to convert inputs of task 'wf.print_config': [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/folders/vz/l684gsw57pndcbm_909n9jp40000gn/T/flyte-e45vhbku/raw/91b6f84917aa22176a7ba5a4f4e71fd5/74a1306209f894ebf0fc720fde719b3b' SYSTEM ERROR! Contact platform administrators. ``` The reason is that during registration, `pyflyte` does not realize that the object needs to be uploaded to blob storage. The user would have to proactively configure the raw data prefix. I would argue that this example is very difficult to understand and debug for users that don't have a clear understanding of Flyte's data model and too "simple" to let users fall into this trap. As a user I would want flytekit to 1) realize that during registration, files need to be offloaded to blob storage and 2) the backend to specify a default raw data prefix during registration unless I configured it explicitly in my flyte config file. --- How could this be fixed? In the `FileAccessProvider`, we need to prevent that [`put_raw_data`](https://github.com/flyteorg/flytekit/blob/6279b817d5df76e651c866c6c5ba7e12a65e12b2/flytekit/core/data_persistence.py#L285) stores offloaded objects locally during registration. * Is there a way to determine from "the flyte context that we are in registration mode"? Then we could at least catch this error and tell users to configure the raw data prefix. * Could `pyflyte` request the `raw_data_prefix` from `flyteadmin` if the user didn't set it explicitly and "make the file access provider aware of it"?
comments: I experience something similar, where I reference a util function via import that doesn???t get injected into the task when executing. My fix was to use fast_register_workflow instead of register_workflow when using FlyteRemote

"Hello 👋, this issue has been inactive for over 90 days. To help maintain a clean and focused backlog,  we'll be marking this issue as stale and will close the issue if we detect no activity in the next 7 days. Thank you for your contribution and understanding! 🙏"
I agree we got rid of it in v2

summary.attemptedFixes: Preventing `put_raw_data` from storing offloaded objects locally during registration. Also, determining from the flyte context whether we are in registration mode to catch the error and inform users to configure the raw data prefix.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to a difficult to debug trap for inexperienced users where offloading of objects during registration is a challenging task. The issue is also linked to https://github.com/flyteorg/flyte/discussions/4743.

issueDTO.title: SMAC smoother can generate infeasible paths when using non-circular robots in very confined spaces
issueDTO.description:
Following up on https://github.com/ros-navigation/navigation2/issues/4271#issuecomment-2879364973

The SMAC smoother could result in an infeasible (colliding) path. The reason is because after modifying the path, it does simple cell cost collision checking (rejects path if cell cost > MAX_NON_OBSTACLE) but does not check for potential collision of orientated footprints.
comments: I want to work on this if possible. I haven't examined the code yet, but I know that there is a collision checker built into nav2. Could we potentially use that function here?

This issue has been labeled as a **good first issue** and is available for anyone to work on.

If this is your first time contributing to an open source project, some aspects of the development process may seem unusual, arcane, or some combination of both.

1.  **You cannot "claim" issues.** People new to open source often want to "claim" or be assigned an issue before beginning work. The typical rationale is that people want to avoid wasted work in the event that someone else ends up working the issue. However, this practice is not effective in open source, as it often leads to "issue squatting", in which an individual asks to be assigned, is granted their request, and then never ends up working on the issue. Accordingly, you are encouraged to communicate your intent to address this issue, ideally by providing a rough outline as to how you plan to address the issue or asking clarifying questions, but, at the end of the day, we will take running code and rough consensus in order to move forward quickly.
2.  **We have a very high bar for contributions.** We have very high standards for contributions and expect all contributions???whether new features, tests, or documentation???to be rigorous, thorough, and complete. Once a pull request is merged into stdlib, that contribution immediately becomes the collective responsibility of all maintainers of stdlib. When we merge code into stdlib, we are saying that we, the maintainers, commit to reviewing subsequent changes and making bugfixes to the code. Hence, in order to ensure future maintainability, this naturally leads to a higher standard of contribution.

Before working on this issue and opening a pull request, please read the project's [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md). These guidelines and the associated [development guide](https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/blob/develop/docs/contributing/development.md) provide important information, including links to stdlib's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), license policy, and steps for setting up your local development environment.

To reiterate, we **strongly** encourage you to refer to our contributing guides **before** beginning work on this issue. Failure to follow our guidelines significantly decreases the likelihood that you'll successfully contribute to stdlib and may result in automatic closure of a pull request without review.

Setting up your local development environment is a critical first step, as doing so ensures that automated development processes for linting, license verification, and unit testing can run prior to authoring commits and pushing changes. If you would prefer to avoid manual setup, we provide pre-configured [development containers](https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/tree/develop/.devcontainer) for use locally or in GitHub Codespaces.

We place a high value on consistency throughout the stdlib codebase. We encourage you to closely examine other packages in stdlib and attempt to emulate the practices and conventions found therein.

-   If you are attempting to contribute a new package, sometimes the best approach is to simply copy the contents of an existing package and then modify the minimum amount necessary to implement the feature (e.g., changing descriptions, parameter names, and implementation).
-   If you are contributing tests, find a package implementing a similar feature and emulate the tests of that package.
-   If you are updating documentation, examine several similar packages and emulate the content, style, and prose of those packages.

In short, the more effort you put in to ensure that your contribution looks and feels like stdlib???including variables names, bracket spacing, line breaks, etc???the more likely that your contribution will be reviewed and ultimately accepted. We encourage you to closely study the codebase **before** beginning work on this issue.

issueDTO.title: [IMPROVEMENT] Allow deleting orphans while retaining the data
issueDTO.description:
### Is your improvement request related to a feature? Please describe (👍 if you like this request)

Recently, one user reported that he needed to reuse a failed replica by modifying its disk and data directory, which is actually associated with an Orphan CR. After editing the replica spec, Longhorn was able to salvage the volume. But there is no perfect way to clean up the related Orphan CR based on my understanding then:
- As long as [the associated node, disk, and data directory are reachable](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn-manager/blob/bb84ca8762db2089f17ec5d29743de2cb94b7a9f/controller/orphan_controller.go#L583), Longhorn will [blindly do data cleanup when deleting an Orphan](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn-manager/blob/bb84ca8762db2089f17ec5d29743de2cb94b7a9f/controller/orphan_controller.go#L351-L361)
- [Orphan CR specs are immutable](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn-manager/blob/bb84ca8762db2089f17ec5d29743de2cb94b7a9f/webhook/resources/orphan/validator.go#L73C12-L73C32), we cannot make an Orphan condition `OrphanConditionTypeDataCleanable` become false by modifying its disk/directory to an invalid location.

### Describe the solution you'd like

The solution can be what Longhorn does for Backup CRs: When [label `DeleteCustomResourceOnly = "delete-custom-resource-only"`](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn-manager/blob/bb84ca8762db2089f17ec5d29743de2cb94b7a9f/types/types.go#L141) is set for an Orphan CR, Longhorn should skip the actual data cleanup.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

Next, Longhorn should be able to directly restore a volume from an orphan without any manual operations mentioned above. See https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/469
comments:

summary.validationOrRequirement: The Orphan CR specs are immutable, and Longhorn will blindly do data cleanup when deleting an Orphan. The Orphan CR condition 'OrphanConditionTypeDataCleanable' cannot be made false by modifying its disk/directory to an invalid location.

summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to an improvement request for Longhorn, allowing the deletion of orphaned CRs while retaining data. The current implementation blindly cleans up data when deleting an orphaned CR. The solution proposed is to set a label 'DeleteCustomResourceOnly = "delete-custom-resource-only"' for the Orphan CR, which would skip the actual data cleanup.

issueDTO.title: Add an option to automatically update the BREE to the highest of all dependencies
issueDTO.description:
Currently PDE warns the user if one of the dependencies has a higher BREE than declared in the manifest. If one open the manifest, then there is even a quick-fix provided to update it.

It would be good to have the same in the "Organize Manifest" Wizard, so it can be applied in batch to many projects and in combination with the new [tycho-cleancode:manifest](https://tycho.eclipseprojects.io/doc/main/tycho-cleancode-plugin/manifest-mojo.html) mojo.
comments: "I'm working on this"

> "I'm working on this"

Thank you and welcome. Are you a student from CodeDays?

The following pages should help you to get started:
- https://github.com/eclipse-ide/
- https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde?tab=readme-ov-file#how-to-contribute

Yes am a student from CodeDays!

 [linkedin.com/in/jose-rodriguez-5b7a062b8](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jose-rodriguez-5b7a062b8?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_profile_view_base_contact_details%3Bz87EVdH%2BSLiolWMfHFx1HA%3D%3D)

Hello, my teammates @JoseRodriguez26  @GreetingsEarthling and I have the following questions:

In the `OrganizeManifestsProcessor.java` file, there are a series of protected boolean variables declared near the top of the `OrganizeManifestsProcessor` class. We believe a change needs to be made here: adding a boolean variable for our update BREE feature. We have been mimicking the **Remove Useless Files** feature because it is a feature that also has something to do with altering files. Can you please confirm this assumption?

However, we noticed that some boolean values are initialized to `true` while others are initialized to `false`. 

With the help of Claude.ai, we came to the understanding that the boolean initialization values reflect the default behavior that the processor should have when run without explicit configuration. 
`true`: for ???conservative, safe cleanup operations???
`false`: for ???potentially destructive, performance-intensive, or structure-changing operations???

Our hypothesis is that our boolean variable `fUpdateBREE` should be initialized to `false` since changing the BREE in a manifest across projects:

- alters the project???s runtime requirements and compatibility promises

- could break compatibility with existing deployment environments that expect a lower Java version

Is our understanding correct? If not, is there an explanation for it?

issueDTO.title: feat: sensible chunk defaults for dask
issueDTO.description:
### Please describe your wishes and possible alternatives to achieve the desired result.


#2033 at least makes it so that we are no longer creating arrays with very small chunks unnecessarily but from a performance perspective, mapping dask chunks to chunks on disk is not a good idea.  Especially with the codec pipeline in zarr being parallelized, the need for dask workers to be responsible for speeding up io is lessened and thus cramming more parallel reads within a worker is probably sensible.  I imagine the same is true for hdf5 even if it isn't parallel i.e., doing more/bigger reads per-dask-chunk.

See https://gist.github.com/lgarrison/ef2922fdb8ca78e8753c39758afedb56 for a related example of this issue where having few python process workers but utilizing the rust-based parallelization of `zarrs` improves throughput.

See https://github.com/zarrs/zarr_benchmarks/blob/9679f36ca795cce65adc603ae41147324208d3d9/scripts/zarr_dask_python_benchmark_roundtrip.py#L22 for using `shards` as the chunk size for dask (since shards contain chunks) as a starting point for implementing better defaults.

In general some todos:

- [ ] Use shards when applicable for zarr
- [ ] Create benchmarks for unsharded data in hdf5 and zarr to find the virtual vs. on-disk chunk size performance tradeoff
- [ ] Write some sort of general-purpose function that can be reused across zarr/hdf5

issueDTO.title: perf: move to parking_lot avoid poisoned locks
issueDTO.description:
If we ever want to get rid of these panics for poisoned locks, we can switch to [parking_lot](https://docs.rs/parking_lot) which doesn't do poisoning. Poisoning only happens when a thread panics while a lock is acquired. If we are strict about not panicking, then we don't need the poisoning feature and its extra overhead.

_Originally posted by @demosdemon in https://github.com/ava-labs/firewood/pull/1027#discussion_r2183245436_

issueDTO.title: Support <math> inside of leaf elements
issueDTO.description:
HTML in leaf elements is legal, but MathCAT can't really do anything about that. The current code just collects the leaf text.

A special case is math inside of leaves, such as

$$
f(n) =\begin{cases}
    1 & \text{if $n^2$ is real} \\
     0 & \text{otherwise}
    \end{cases}
$$

where $n^2$ is math inside of an `mtext` element.
MathCAT could handle that case by "flattening" the math/text. For example
```
<mtext>if <math> <msup><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msup> is real</mtext>
```
can be rewritten/flattened as
```
<mtext>if</mtext> <msup><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msup> <mtext>is real</mtext>
```
This cleanup would be part of `trim_element` in `interface.rs`.

See https://github.com/w3c/mathml/issues/522 for more discussion.

repository.description: MathCAT: Math Capable Assistive Technology for generating speech, braille, and navigation.
repository.name: MathCAT

summary.otherNotes: MathCAT can't handle math inside leaf elements, a special case is described where math inside an mtext element should be flattened, and a rewritten example is provided

issueDTO.title: Move the blocks build output directory from `dist/assets/js/blocks` to `dist/assets/blocks`
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

The assets built for blocks are a mixture of JS, CSS and JSON, however they are output to the directory `dist/assets/js/blocks`.

We should move the location up a level, to `dist/assets/blocks`, to make the organisational structure clearer.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* The blocks build assets should be placed in `dist/assets/blocks` rather than `dist/assets/js/blocks`.

issueDTO.title: time types and foreign keys
issueDTO.description:
In MySQL, `time`, `timestamp`, and `datetime` types can be in foreign key constraints with one another even if they have differing precisions.
However, zero padding makes it so nothing can really be inserted. This is similar to decimal behavior.

Also datetime and timestamp types can reference each other in foreign keys, but values that are equal will still violate the constraint.

Skipped tests here: https://github.com/dolthub/go-mysql-server/pull/3106

issueDTO.title: intermodal transport containers
issueDTO.description: ### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. I'm in the middle of moving, and have spent the last few weeks with a steel cargo container in my yard. Every time I see it, every single time, I think "why don't we have these in CDDA!?" It is possible I have a problem. That problem is, of course, THE LACK OF INTERMODAL TRANSPORT CONTAINERS. For reference, these bad boys are what we're talking about. ### Solution you would like. I believe an intermodal containers should be a vehicle. The first and most important way to model them is as a vehicle, and for that we should have a few custom vehicle panels so that I can sprite them to look like what they are: the intermodal container is a very well recognized structure, and missing them in game is a big deal. As a start, I'd just love to see someone go to the work of designing them, and maybe putting a few of them rarely in front of houses, and frequently in various industrial places. Then, in follow up, we can have some that contain interesting or boring things. Eventually we should see these in railyards and shipyards in huge numbers. However, those are later steps. This is a good first issue for someone who wants to learn how to make a custom vehicle in JSON, but it is a little bit involved so while I am flagging it "good first issue", I really recommend doing something very very small and trivial for your *first* first issue. #### How I'd design them: Intermodal containers are typically 8' x 20' or 8' x 40'. The 20' variety should look like this: ``` WWWWW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WfffW WDDDW ``` Where W is a full height vehicle wall with a new custom panel style, "transport_container" - which comes in "container_side", "container_door_corner", "container_end_corner", and "container_end" And where D is a vehicle door similar to the trunk, where opening one door opens both doors, with a new custom sprite as well. - Ideally, but not necessary, we could add code where opening one door opens the door next to it, but not all three doors, so that opening the middle tile opens both but opening the left tile opens only the left and middle and opening the right opens the right and middle. That would let us model it as two doors despite taking three tiles. However, I think doing it all as one door is the easiest way and we already have that code. - These doors should be very loud to open! And a bit slow. And where `f` is probably just standard cargo storage space, but with a new visual variant. We could add the 40' variety but as you see, they'd get pretty long in game. ### Describe alternatives you have considered. There was a time when I thought we'd also want them as terrain so that we could have furniture in them, but now that we can drag furniture into vehicles, that might not be necessary. For starters, we should get htese as vehicles and see how it works. If we model them as vehicles then you can push them around and things, which is sooooo aaawwwweesome. ### Additional context Long-term, I would like to have different colour choices for these and put them into a vehicle group so you can just place a 'container' and get different skins. Then I might also be able to work in a few with graffiti and stuff, which would really enhance the look, but the odds of me getting that much sprite art done without getting distracted are... not great. In the future, it may be possible to repurpose bicycle code to load intermodal containers onto appropriate flatbed trucks. That would be amazing Eventually, intermodal containers would be a good way to begin thinking about some simple multi-z-level vehicle code, allowing us to stack them on top of each other.

issueDTO.title: Separate transportation and intersection info in the Mobility category
issueDTO.description: Separate transportation and intersection items in the Mobility category under Manage Callouts' in the main Settings menu
comments: That switch actually controls three callout groups: intersections, transportation, and safety (e.g. steps and other hazards). Do we want to group safety with intersections or with transportation? Arguably the intersections are a type of safety callout, but perhaps the point of separating the intersection callout toggle is to allow everything except intersections to continue being called out.

That's a great point :-) Perhaps we split out all 3 separately? All the other Callout options are quite binary whereas this one currently incorporates 3 different types...so splitting them out will allow a person to fine-tune the information they wish to hear. It will increase the panel and require more scrolling for the page...but I think it's worth doing.

I could also argue that the safety spots callout should remain on unless the user decides to turn all callouts off. In the early days of Microsoft Soundscape, there used to be a toggle switch for the Location Updates callout, but starting around the early 2020's,the Location Updates callout became permanently turned on and cannot directly be configured by the user. My argument to leave safety spots on is so that the user is always aware of anything hazardous while walking around. That way the "Manage Callouts" menu wouldn't be cluttered with too many configurations. If we decide to go ahead with my solution, I also wrote a revision to the help documentation explaining "Note: some callouts essential for safe navigation do not have their own toggle switch and can only be disabled with the "Allow Callouts" button." Anyway, having all three callouts in this section or just Transportation and Intersections will be an improvement, even for sighted users. The term Mobility isn't as intuitive for the average user.
I can look into this
Do we know which files in the backend are connected to the different toggles that we want from the Mobility section?

The code where the single toggle is changing three separate settings is here: https://github.com/soundscape-community/soundscape/blob/6a84924d63fc0a2542abac51d8c823832f0330d7/apps/ios/GuideDogs/Code/Visual%20UI/Controls/Settings/CalloutSettingsCellView.swift#L84-L90

The visual design for the toggle is in a storyboard: https://github.com/soundscape-community/soundscape/blob/6a84924d63fc0a2542abac51d8c823832f0330d7/apps/ios/GuideDogs/Code/Visual%20UI/Views/Settings.storyboard#L270-L317

That's all you should really need to tweak for this feature. You don't need to dive into how those settings are used by the `AutoCalloutGenerator` to filter the announcements.

Just for clarification, I separated Transportation and Intersection into 2 different toggles. Before I make a pull request I want to confirm that we get rid of the Mobility toggle altogether and it just be the 2 new toggles?

issueDTO.title: FFI Iterator
issueDTO.description: Iterating across the FFI boundary is extremely slow, so it was initially determined to not be included. However, it may be necessary for some coreth API functionality (as well as being generally helpful for testing). This could still be implemented relatively simply by amortizing the FFI calls to batch the key-value pairs to relatively few calls. This will still require some clever memory management to avoid copying too much data (idea: allocate a pool in Go?) and to enable 2D arrays in C to be translated into slices of slices in Go. Additionally, freeing the iterator may be difficult if using a literal Rust iterator.
comments: @alarso16 do we still need this?

issueDTO.title: varchar size info for a column that already exists is missing from migration
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Adding a specific size for a string/varchar field will not show in the migration file if the column already exists from another migration.

**To Reproduce**
First create the following resource:

```elixir
defmodule MyResource do
  use Ash.Resource, data_layer: AshPostgres.DataLayer
  
  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    attribute :blibs, :string
  end
  
  postgres do
    table "my_resources"

    repo Repo
  end
end
```

Now, generate a migration for it with `mix ash_postgres.generate_migrations`.

This should generate the table `my_resources` with the `blibs` field as a `:text` field.

Now, change the resource to this:

```elixir
defmodule MyResource do
  use Ash.Resource, data_layer: AshPostgres.DataLayer
  
  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    attribute :blibs, :string
  end
  
  postgres do
    table "my_resources"
    
    migration_types blibs: {:varchar, 255}

    repo Repo
  end
end
```

And generate a new migration with `mix ash_postgres.generate_migrations`

This will generate the following migration:

```elixir
  def up do
    alter table(:my_resources) do
      modify :blibs, :varchar
    end
  end

  def down do
    alter table(:my_resources) do
      modify :blibs, :text
    end
  end
```

**Expected behavior**
The final generated migration in the example above should contain information about the column size (in this case, it should add `, size: 255`.
 
** Runtime
 - Elixir version 1.14.4
 - Erlang version 25
 - OS Fedora 28
 - Ash version 2.9.18
 - any related extension versions 1.3.28
comments: I'm seeing this issue as well. When I specify the storage_type as {:varchar, 64} on my Ash.Type, or when I specify it in the postgres block via migration_type, the size is correctly captured in the JSON snapshot but not in the generated migration file. The migration file shows varchar but is missing the size.

Manually adding `, size: 64` in the generated migration file and running the migration is an option for importing existing tables. There's a runtime error on all reads with this setup though:
```elixir

Removing the size in the Ash.Type like this works:
```elixir
@impl Ash.Type
def storage_type(_), do: :varchar
```

But then the size constraint won't appear on new tables either right?

Would introducing `migration_type/1` on the Ash.Type behavior resolve this so you could specify both:
```elixir
@impl Ash.Type
def storage_type(_), do: :varchar

@impl Ash.Type
def migration_type(_), do: {:varchar, 64}
```

2. Sign in with email and password

### 👍 Expected behavior

Receive session alert email in spanish

### 👎 Actual Behavior

Subject: 
`{{emails.sessionAlert.subject}}`
Body:
```
{{emails.sessionAlert.hello}},

{{emails.sessionAlert.body}}

{{emails.sessionAlert.listDevice}}
{{emails.sessionAlert.listIpAddress}}
{{emails.sessionAlert.listCountry}}
{{emails.sessionAlert.footer}}

{{emails.sessionAlert.thanks}}
{{emails.sessionAlert.signature}}
```

Appwrite Cloud

Linux

Appwrite 1.6-RC7

Appwrite Cloud also affected.

Bump

Translation constants like "emails.sessionAlert.body" only exists in the "en.json"
https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/main/app/config/locale/translations/en.json#L21-L29

In all other translations they are missing, see here
https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/main/app/config/locale/translations/es.json

Related - 
* https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/issues/7916

From what I understand, It's only needed to add those lines translated into the other language files:
```   "emails.sessionAlert.subject": "Security alert: new session on your {{project}} account",
    "emails.sessionAlert.hello":"Hello {{user}}",
    "emails.sessionAlert.body": "A new session has been created on your {{b}}{{project}}{{/b}} account, {{b}}on {{date}}, {{year}} at {{time}} UTC{{/b}}.\nHere are the details of the new session: ",
    "emails.sessionAlert.listDevice": "Device: {{b}}{{device}}{{/b}}",
    "emails.sessionAlert.listIpAddress": "IP Address: {{b}}{{ipAddress}}{{/b}}",
    "emails.sessionAlert.listCountry": "Country: {{b}}{{country}}{{/b}}",
    "emails.sessionAlert.footer":  "If this was you, there's nothing more you need to do.\nIf you didn't initiate this session or suspect any unauthorized activity, please secure your account.",
    "emails.sessionAlert.thanks": "Thanks,",
    "emails.sessionAlert.signature": "{{project}} team",```

issueDTO.title: Misleading warning in relational interfaces if user is has no read permission
issueDTO.description: ### Describe the Bug The relational interfaces show the message "The relationship hasn't been configured correctly" if a user is missing read permission on the related collection: This warning is misleading and should be changed to something that indicates that the permissions are missing. Obviously, if the relationship is actually configured incorrectly, the above message should still be displayed. Most likely this requires an adjustment of the relations service, as currently the user doesn't receive the necessary information. ### To Reproduce - Create two collections - Setup a relationship of any kind between the two - Create a role & user - Grant access to main collection, while not granting read access on related / junction collection - Login with the user and create a new item, see the interface with the warning as shown in the screenshot ### Directus Version 10 (up to 10.8.3) ### Hosting Strategy N/A
comments:
Hey 👋 I'd like to work on this issue.
My plan is to adjust the relation service to differentiate between:
a misconfigured relationship (e.g. missing collection or metadata)
and a permission issue (the user lacks read access to the related collection)
The idea is to return a more specific status from the backend (e.g. readable: false) and then update the Admin UI to show a clearer message when access is denied, instead of the generic "relationship not configured" warning.
Would this approach work for you? If so, could you assign the issue to me?
Thanks!

issueDTO.title: Confusing SWT Style Bits in CSS Spy
issueDTO.description:
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/assets/44021373/996918d4-5498-4737-8e74-0b244809668a)

The **CSS Rules** section of **CSS Spy** shows the current **SWT Style Bits** for the selected control, but it seems to contain a lot of useless information, such as styles that are not currently supported by the selected control (e.g. `SWT.RADIO` here), and bits that are not styles (e.g. `SWT.ERROR_MENU_NOT_POP_UP` here). Why is it designed this way, and what is the use of these ?
comments:
The filter should display the correct styles bits as described in this page : 
https://wiki.eclipse.org/SWT_Widget_Style_Bits

I think the idea is to remind what could be used on this widget... but ...as we are in a dynamic display,  it would be better to display in bold if the style bit is set and in normal fond if not set. Using the Widget.getStyle() method that would be easy to do. 

-> Good first issue

I am working on this! 
- CodeDay Student.
I'm working on this

> I'm working on this

Welcome, I assume you are a student from CodeDays, aren't you? The following pages should help you to get started:
- https://github.com/eclipse-ide/
- https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde?tab=readme-ov-file#how-to-contribute

and if you have further questions, don't hesitate to ask, we are here to help.

Hey guys, I'm working on this issue in a group with ahenden13. We were wondering if anybody has thoughts on how we should format the display, as there is a lot of unhelpful information. 

We are inclined to just remove these useless bits, but we could also just remove the error bits, leave everything and bold the set bits, etc. If anyone has any input it would be appreciated!

I think the main issue is that you can not know programmatically what styles a widget support at the moment.

So the first thing would be to have some declarative way (e.g. an annotation) to carry that information and update all widgets to use that thing before one can make progress here. Hardcoding the supported styles seem not very useful to me.

> What you are advising is we instead use something like an annotation.

I do not advise to use _something like an annotation_ but to use an annotation. e.g it could be a repeatable `@Style` with and int value and an optional String description. If we choose retention of runtime that information could be easily queried by tools (even e.g. in autocompletion or validation) to learn about valid styles what currently is only documented in the javadoc (and sadly even only in the class description and not at the constructor).

> The downside to this function is that it uses a lot of long if...else statements to manually grab the set style bits one by one, with hardcoded styles.

The most limiting factor is that there is literally no way for it to be used with custom widgets outside of what we know at platform / SWT.

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to make the CSS Rules section of CSS Spy show the correct and relevant styles bits for the selected control, and to make it more user-friendly by displaying the styles that are currently being used in bold.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a declarative way (e.g. an annotation) to carry the information about what styles a widget supports, and to update all widgets to use that thing before making progress. Hardcoding the supported styles seems not very useful.
summary.attemptedFixes: The team has tried to use the getStyle() method to easily grab only the relevant style bits for a given widget and then bold the styles that are currently being used, but it uses a lot of long if...else statements to manually grab the set style bits one by one, with hardcoded styles.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the CSS Rules section in CSS Spy showing unnecessary information, such as styles not supported by the selected control, and bits that are not styles. The goal is to display the correct styles bits as described in the wiki page.

issueDTO.title: Synchronize dependencies between Bifold and BC Wallet
issueDTO.description:
### Value
Keeping dependencies up to date fixes security vulnerabilities, prevents bugs, and improves performance. Synchronizing dependencies between the two repos has the added benefit of preventing unwanted regressions where an issue might be fixed in Bifold but break in BC Wallet, or vice versa. It's a small amount of work for a lot of gain

### Developer notes
Deps should be aligned between the two repos so that the whichever dep is newer in either is used in both, preferably updating to the latest patch version as well. ie: if one repo has `my-dep@3.4.1` and the other has `my-dep@4.0.0` then upgrade both to `my-dep@4.0.7` (assuming 4.0.7 is the latest patch version)
comments: @bryce-mcmath to update what the actual deliverable is here.

issueDTO.title: TypeError in `DeltaTable.to_pyarrow_dataset` when using non-string partition filter values (e.g., int)
issueDTO.description:
# Environment

**Delta-rs version**: Delta-rs version: >= 0.25.2

**Binding**:  Python

**Environment**: 
- **Cloud provider**:
- **OS**: macOs
- **Other**:

***
# Bug

**What happened**: 
When calling `DeltaTable.to_pyarrow_dataset()` with partition filters that include integers (e.g., `("year", "=", 2024)`), the following error is raised:

    TypeError: argument 'partition_filters': failed to extract enum PartitionFilterValue ('Single | Multiple')
    - variant Single (Single): TypeError: failed to extract field PartitionFilterValue::Single.0, caused by TypeError: 'int' object cannot be converted to 'PyString'
    - variant Multiple (Multiple): TypeError: failed to extract field PartitionFilterValue::Multiple.0, caused by TypeError: 'int' object cannot be converted to 'Sequence'

while it clearly says that 

**What you expected to happen**:
Partition filters should accept primitive types (`int`, `str`, `bool`, `date`) as the value and internally convert them to strings if necessary.


**How to reproduce it**:
from deltalake import DeltaTable

    dt = DeltaTable("s3://my-bucket/my-table")

    dt.to_pyarrow_dataset(partitions=[
        ("year", "=", 2024),         # int triggers error
        ("week", "=", 11),           # int triggers error
        ("date", "=", "2024-03-10"), # str works fine
    ])

**More details**:

- deltalake: 1.1.0  
- Python: 3.10+  
- OS: macOS
comments: take

repository.description: A native Rust library for Delta Lake, with bindings into Python

comments:
These are items that were fixed in the main (Jazzy, Kilted, Rolling, probably even Iron) branches long ago. It looks like they didn't get backported to Humble for some reason (possibly related to ABI compatibility). 

For the single trigger, check out this set of git history, I'm guessing your solution is in here: https://github.com/ros-navigation/navigation2/commits/main/nav2_behavior_tree/test/plugins/decorator/test_single_trigger_node.cpp

For the navigate through poses, I think you'd need to find the issue where a PoseStamped instead of a vector is being injected. If memory serves, that was just an issue in the test itself (like a copy+paste error from the navigate to pose tests), not in the application code.

I'm not worried about the linting, some of the backports we did probably broke Humble's styling but were correct styling for the modern linter profiles. If you wanted to submit a PR to fix those, certainly I'd merge them, but I wouldn't worry about them.
Thanks a lot for your answers!
Are you planning on submitting a PR to patch these? :-)
Yes, I will try my best to patch these in my free time and submit a PR, maybe a week.
@Plumezz any update?
@Plumezz any update?

Hello, I am not sure what your update is about. Is it the unit test issue or a format issue? I have already submitted a PR for the format issue. But I have not yet analyzed the unit test issues in depth. Sorry.

The test issue, I thought you mentioned that you were planning on fixing and opening a PR :-) 

Got it!
I would be available to work on the backport to fix these tests if it's still up for grabs
Please!

issueDTO.title: [DAG][ARM] computeKnownBitsForTargetNode - add handling for ARMISD VORRIMM\VBICIMM nodes
issueDTO.description:
If we fold to a VORRIMM\VBICIMM node then valuetracking can no longer analyse the known bits.

Noticed while working on longer term work for #83422 - I haven't created a test case against trunk, but its possible that existing test coverage might already benefit.
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

issueDTO.title: Add instrumentation details to each README.md
issueDTO.description:
New users have no quick/easy way to determine what telemetry is provided by the various instrumentations here. This is a tracking issue and proposal to add specific details about the telemetry generated by each instrumentation.

For each instrumentation module, there should be a corresponding README.md file that provides:
* a description what the instrumentation does
* whether it is enabled by default via the agent
* how to configure it
* specific details about the telemetry it provides. 

Here is an instrumentation checklist that should be complete before this issue can be closed:

* [x] Activity (#750)
* [x] ANR (application not responding) (#787)
* [x] Crash reporting (#788)
* [x] Fragment
* [ ] HttpUrlConnection
* [x] Network (#789)
* [ ] OkHttp
* [ ] OkHttp-websocket
* [x] Session (covered in #719)
* [x] SlowRendering
* [ ] Startup
* [ ] Volley
comments: @breedx-splk I'd love to take on some of those (e.g. Fragment, Https, Slow Rendering?)

> [@breedx-splk](https://github.com/breedx-splk) I'd love to take on some of those (e.g. Fragment, Https, Slow Rendering?)

Great! Thanks. I'll stay away from Fragment then while you take it.

summary.otherNotes: issue is about adding instrumentation details to each README.md file, providing description, default enablement, configuration and telemetry details for each instrumentation module

issueDTO.title: CLM history variables name change, `*clm2.h0a.*`
issueDTO.description:
Tags using ctsm5.3.062 or newer have separate time averaged and instantaneous history files. This change in CLM was made to be consitent with conventions in CAM (e.g., *.clm2.h0.* is now *clm2.h0a.* or h0i). 
- I think this should be relatively easy to modify on the example config files used for LDF, but wanted to create an issue here too, see also https://github.com/ESCOMP/CTSM/issues/3317
- Example notebooks in CUPiD that use land variables may also need to change here.

NOTE, this CLM PR is not yet integrated into a CESM3 alpha tag.
comments: I think this will work with the `hist_str` for land being set to just 'h0' in all of the existing config files (eg, `[here](https://github.com/NCAR/CUPiD/blob/d9c0a0f15e83f5f2c0cf0e096acaa0f2bfc6d745/examples/key_metrics/config.yml#L74)`) but we should double check that periods aren't added necessarily before or after the h0, which could cause issues if we end up looking for `.h0.` instead of `h0*` files.
One more note here, at this point I think we can largely ignore the `h0i` files, which (typically) don't have information that's used in CUPiD or LDF analyses.

repository.description: CUPiD is a ???one stop shop??? that enables and integrates timeseries file generation, data standardization, diagnostics, and metrics from all CESM components.
repository.name: CUPiD

summary.main: CLM history variables name change, `*clm2.h0a.*`
summary.validationOrRequirement: Tags using ctsm5.3.062 or newer have separate time averaged and instantaneous history files. CLM variable name change to be consistent with conventions in CAM (e.g., *.clm2.h0.* is now *clm2.h0a.* or h0i).
summary.attemptedFixes: hist_str for land being set to just 'h0' in all of the existing config files
summary.otherNotes: CLM PR is not yet integrated into a CESM3 alpha tag. Example notebooks in CUPiD that use land variables may also need to change. hist_str for land being set to just 'h0' in all of the existing config files. We should double check that periods aren't added necessarily before or after the h0, which could cause issues if we end up looking for .h0. instead of h0* files. h0i files can largely be ignored.

issueDTO.title: SWT Radio-Buttons resets radio-button selection after opening and closing FileChooser from same dialog
comments: I'm working on this
Im working on this
I'm working on this
I'm working on this with @lars-v-bui and @Cecilia-Rz

I have a question in regards to reproducing the issue on my local machine. It seems that I have been successful in building and running the Eclipse IDE in general since now I can run any Java file in example folders such as SWTExamples/org.eclipse.swt.examples/org.eclipse.swt.examples.helloworld/. The java files in these different example folders have code that implement functions from the SWT library, hence I was able to run HelloWorld3.java. However, when it comes to the issue itself we are given a snippet of code from Issue #1599???s documentation. For some reason we cannot reproduce the error, even if I were to copy and paste the code into a working Java file such as HelloWorld3.java. All of the import statements at the top of the code that import functions and widgets from the SWT library are not highlighted as errors, but anything with import org.eclipse.jface???. and org.eclipse.junit???. are highlighted as errors. I have tried seeing if I could manually install a plugin for jface and junit but could not manage to do it, and I???ve even commented out the import statements that have jface and junit in them. But some parts of the code use Junit for building UI dialogs, and some of the code is used for automatic testing which is done with Junit. JFace is just built on top of SWT, so the UI dialog features that it provides really comes from SWT itself. JUnit is just for automatic testing, but not directly part of the code for reproduction. What I hypothesize is that we do not need JFace or JUnit at all to reproduce the issue. If JFace just uses similar components of SWT that it is built upon, then I believe it is possible to code a similar program without JFace while still reproducing the issue. As for JUnit I do not believe automatic testing is dire for us to see the bug when running the application, so we can also code a program that simulates the bug without that bug. Is my understanding correct? Any feedback would be highly appreciated.



@grissinibread

The TLDR was that when `setup-production` called it was not executable. However, we did not happen to see this error in the logs. So, it should definitely have logged the fact that it was not an executable file.

issueDTO.title: Reuse the http request object for http probes
issueDTO.description:
Today we construct the request object for every http request for the http probes. This involves concatenating some strings, setting headers, etc.

Probes are simple http get requests that are executed synchronously (for a single probe) and has no request body.

The optimization may be to reuse the request object for all probe executions. This likely save some cpu and memory for the kubelet process.

Some code references:
- [DoProbe](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/4dfd2fe74d96f67c9752bbdc9ae9983a6e5f0492/pkg/probe/http/http.go#L93) is executed today on each probe execution.
- New request are [being created](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/4dfd2fe74d96f67c9752bbdc9ae9983a6e5f0492/pkg/kubelet/prober/prober.go#L146) for each execution.
- New object will need to be stored in [worker](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/4dfd2fe74d96f67c9752bbdc9ae9983a6e5f0492/pkg/kubelet/prober/worker.go#L40) that for http probes will hold the http request object. This object will need to encapsulate the logic of [runProbe](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/4dfd2fe74d96f67c9752bbdc9ae9983a6e5f0492/pkg/kubelet/prober/prober.go#L138) method of the prober.

I'm marking this issue as a good first issue, as the issue doesn't require deep knowledge of Kubernetes. However it is not an easy issue, a few parts of code will be affected and change needs to be done very carefully.

***Please review code and make sure you understand the task before self-assigning the issue.***

Implementation notes

1. If you can send the small benchmark results on probes with and without this optimization, it will be a good starting point. Note, for the benchmark, each probe can run once a second, not more often. But the number of probes is virtually unlimited since we are not defining the limit on number of containers per Pod. Realistically we are talking about 110 pods (max) with maybe 2 containers each, with 3 probes each (660 probes).
2. Code change may be big. So make sure to help reviewers to review the code. One idea may be to split implementation into multiple commits to simplify the review. First, creating the object encapsulating the logic of `runProbe`, second storing and initializing this object in `worker`, and third, actual reusing of the request object.


/sig node
/good-first-issue
/help-wanted
/area kubelet

issueDTO.title: Fix windows test
issueDTO.description:
> Confirm new test passes

On windows it doesn't... https://github.com/bluesky/ophyd-async/actions/runs/16317882701/job/46090638432

This is because in python <= 3.12 `time.time()` on windows uses a low-resolution timer, this has resolution somewhere in the range 1-16ms, so a 10ms tolerance on the test is too low.

_Originally posted by @Tom-Willemsen in https://github.com/bluesky/ophyd-async/issues/965#issuecomment-3083795781_
comments: Apologies, will fix now

issueDTO.title: Sharepoint connector access control sync crashes due to some users with empty creation date (I think)
issueDTO.description:
## Bug Description
When I launch an access control sync, it fails immediately as follows:

```
[FMWK][15:48:30][INFO] [Connector id: SrfNA5gBxrlYG7LtwY5X, index name: .search-acl-filter-sharepoint-mms, Sync job id: YRbsE5gBt2SDsJjqBsat] Executing access control sync
[FMWK][15:48:30][INFO] [Connector id: SrfNA5gBxrlYG7LtwY5X, index name: .search-acl-filter-sharepoint-mms, Sync job id: YRbsE5gBt2SDsJjqBsat] Starting access control doc lookups
[FMWK][15:48:30][INFO] [Connector id: SrfNA5gBxrlYG7LtwY5X, index name: .search-acl-filter-sharepoint-mms, Sync job id: YRbsE5gBt2SDsJjqBsat] Collecting local document ids
[FMWK][15:48:30][INFO] [Connector id: SrfNA5gBxrlYG7LtwY5X, index name: .search-acl-filter-sharepoint-mms, Sync job id: YRbsE5gBt2SDsJjqBsat] Fetching all users
[FMWK][15:48:31][ERROR] [Connector id: SrfNA5gBxrlYG7LtwY5X, index name: .search-acl-filter-sharepoint-mms, Sync job id: YRbsE5gBt2SDsJjqBsat] Document extractor failed
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/connectors/es/sink.py", line 503, in run
    await self.get_access_control_docs(sanitized_generator)
  File "/app/connectors/es/sink.py", line 736, in get_access_control_docs
    async for doc in generator:
  File "/app/connectors/logger.py", line 244, in __anext__
    return await self.gen.__anext__()
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/app/connectors/es/sink.py", line 530, in _decorate_with_metrics_span
    async for doc in generator:
  File "/app/connectors/es/sink.py", line 488, in <genexpr>
    sanitized_generator = (
                          ^
  File "/app/connectors/sync_job_runner.py", line 476, in generator
    async for doc in self.data_provider.get_access_control():
  File "/app/connectors/sources/sharepoint_online.py", line 1644, in get_access_control
    user_doc = await process_user(user)
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/app/connectors/sources/sharepoint_online.py", line 1638, in process_user
    person_access_control_doc = await self._user_access_control_doc(user)
                                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/app/connectors/sources/sharepoint_online.py", line 1585, in _user_access_control_doc
    created_at = datetime.strptime(user["createdDateTime"], TIMESTAMP_FORMAT)
                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
TypeError: strptime() argument 1 must be str, not None
```
### To Reproduce
Difficult to reproduce if you don't have any users without that date in entra. I checked against graph and there are about 20. Weird that it happens instantly as soon as I start the sync.

## Expected behavior
The access control sync to progress and populate its index.

## Environment

- OS: Linux
- Version Connector and Elasticsearch 9.0.3
comments:
Fun! Thanks for filing, @maxesse 

Yep, looks like a bug. From https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/user?view=graph-rest-1.0#properties:

> The date and time the user was created, in ISO 8601 format and UTC. The value can't be modified and is automatically populated when the entity is created. Nullable. For on-premises users, the value represents when they were first created in Microsoft Entra ID. Property is null for some users created before June 2018 and on-premises users that were synced to Microsoft Entra ID before June 2018. Read-only.

Looks like we're not respecting that null/None is a valid option.
Glad to be of help! I guess I don't have many workarounds available until the next release, short of forking the connector and fixing it myself (which I really would like to avoid), right?

issueDTO.title: Pagination with zero total-items shows `0` as first page

Interestingly, at very narrow viewport widths, the `1` button appears along with arrow buttons which can be used to fast forward to the `0` button. ### Expected Behavior The page button shows `1` and is selected by default. It is not possible to navigate to the `0` button at narrow viewport widths. ### Reproduction Sample https://codepen.io/nwhittaker-esri/pen/OJeqqyQ ### Reproduction Steps 1. Visit the repro and compare with the expected vs. actual behavior at standard and narrow viewport widths. ### Reproduction Version 2.12.2 ### Relevant Info _No response_ ### Regression? _No response_ ### Priority impact impact - p2 - want for an upcoming milestone ### Impact Extra consideration is required by the consumer to ensure the pagination component displays an empty state seamlessly. ### Calcite package - [X] @esri/calcite-components - [ ] @esri/calcite-components-angular - [ ] @esri/calcite-components-react - [ ] @esri/calcite-design-tokens - [ ] @esri/eslint-plugin-calcite-components ### Esri team ArcGIS Field Apps

comments:
### Proposed Solution

I propose a secure multi-layered approach:

1. __Capture Process Stderr__: Modify the STDIO connection setup to capture and buffer stderr output from the child process

2. __Error Sanitization__: Create a sanitization function that:

   - Removes absolute file paths (replace with relative or generic paths)
   - Filters out environment variables
   - Limits message length
   - Removes potentially sensitive patterns

3. __Structured Error Reporting__: Enhance error messages to include:

   - Original generic error (for backwards compatibility)
   - Sanitized stderr output (for debugging)
   - Process exit code
   - Command that failed (without sensitive args)

4. __Configuration Control__: Add configuration options to control:

   - Whether to include stderr in error messages
   - Maximum stderr length to include
   - Custom sanitization rules

The implementation would involve:

- Modifying the `TokioChildProcess` setup to capture stderr
- Creating an error sanitization module
- Updating error handling in the connection pool
- Adding configuration options for error verbosity

I am not sure the need for sanitization. Its logs from their server, if they don'rt want something logged they should probably not log it?

We do already plumb stderr through, but might be nice to wrap it in our logging so its formatted

issueDTO.title: Add citation count field (including semantic scholar fetcher)
issueDTO.description:
### 🔍 Motivation

Citation count provides a useful indicator of the academic impact of a publication. Automating the population of this field from Semantic Scholar saves manual effort and enhances bibliographic data quality in JabRef.

### 📌 Goal

Extend the existing `SemanticScholarCitationFetcher` to retrieve the **citation count** for a given paper using the Semantic Scholar API and store it in a new BibTeX field `citationcount`.

### 🛠??? Tasks

1. **Integrate citation count fetching**

   * Implement logic in `org.jabref.logic.importer.fetcher.citation.semanticscholar.SemanticScholarCitationFetcher` using
     `PaperDetails#getCitationCount()` from
     `org.jabref.logic.importer.fetcher.citation.semanticscholar.PaperDetails`.

2. **Add a new field**

   * Define a new field `citationcount` in `org.jabref.model.entry.field.StandardField` (under JabRef-specific fields).
   * Ensure that the field is recognized and included in citation fetcher updates.

3. **Write tests**

   * Add unit tests in
     `org.jabref.logic.importer.fetcher.citation.semanticscholar.SemanticScholarCitationFetcherTest`
     to verify that citation count is fetched and set correctly.
   * Additonally, Mock or simulate Semantic Scholar API responses with citation counts.

4. **UI integration**

    * Add a new FieldEditor `CitationCount` (inspired by IdentifierEditor) and integrate it into the UI by modifying FieldEditors#getForField(...).
    * Add an update button, which uses the SemanticScholarFEtcher to update the citation cound.

### ??? Acceptance Criteria

* When the fetcher is run on an entry with a DOI or title, and Semantic Scholar returns a citation count, the value is written to the `citationcount` field.
* The value is stored as an integer.
* Field appears in the entry editor in tab "General"


### 📚 Helpful resources

* [[Semantic Scholar API](https://api.semanticscholar.org/)](https://api.semanticscholar.org/)
* [`[PaperDetails](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fetcher/citation/semanticscholar/PaperDetails.java)`](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fetcher/citation/semanticscholar/PaperDetails.java)
* [`[SemanticScholarCitationFetcher](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fetcher/citation/semanticscholar/SemanticScholarCitationFetcher.java)`](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fetcher/citation/semanticscholar/SemanticScholarCitationFetcher.java)
* [[How to contribute to JabRef](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [[Developer Docs](https://devdocs.jabref.org/)](https://devdocs.jabref.org/)
