issueDTO.title: [ADMIN] CONTRIBUTORS WELCOME
issueDTO.description:
This issue lists areas that are good entry points to start contributing to opentelemetry-cpp.

For each issue, see the issue comments for details.

## 1. Functional

Typically, features touching a functional area requires to dive into the code, but do not need changes in the infrastructure, like CI, workflows, compilers, platforms, makefiles ...
This is a good opportunity to learn the C++ code itself. The size of the code affected varies by feature.

### 1.1 All signals

Typically, changes affecting all signals at once are using the same pattern, applied everywhere.
The change is limited in scope, but touches multiple parts.
This is a good opportunity to learn how to apply design or coding pattern to an existing code base.

* #3303

### 1.2 Resource detector

* #3548 

### 1.3 Trace signal

* #2283 
* #3545

### 1.4 Metrics signal

Typically, changes affecting the metrics signal are more involved on the functional part (time series, aggregation).
This is a good opportunity to understand in depth a component, with clear boundaries.

* #3292
* #3515
* #3546

### 1.5 Logs signal

* #2689
* #2667

### 1.6 Specific areas

Typically, features touching a specific area do not require to understand the whole code base, but only a well defined subset.
This is a good opportunity to learn the development process (git, PR, review, merge) as well as the affected code.

* #2489

## 2. Code health

This area requires to change `CI`/`CD` scripts to improve the build process.
This is a very good opportunity to learn the github `CI` workflow, to implement new tooling.

### 2.1 Clang-tidy

Iterative changes, to expand coverage to the entire code base.

* #2053

### 2.2 Doxygen

* #1647

## 3. Test coverage

This area is a very good opportunity to learn `docker` to execute tests in a container environment.

* #454

## 4. Documentation

This is internal documentation, for maintainers.
We need to document internal processes (like, how to do a release, an upgrade, a deprecation, ...),
as well as feature design (explain how xyz works) at high level, to understand the code base.

* #2678

## 5. Major work

Some areas in opentelemetry-cpp need major work, and contributions are welcome here as well.

A couple of things to keep in mind:

* These are definitively not "good first issue" items, you should have contributed already to opentelemetry-cpp (to be familiar with the process and tooling) and have some experience to be effective.
* Not every technical aspects are defined yet, a good part of the work will be to propose what needs to be done first.
* Maintainers are here to help and facilitate this, and will provide guidance.
* Consider to join the community meetings to discuss specific areas.

### 5.1 Binary packages

To be able to ship binary packages for opentelemetry-cpp, a lot of preliminary work needs to happen

* [ ] Define how shared libraries are to be versioned, to support compatibility with ABI versions and SDK versions
  * #3110
* [ ] Implement tooling to verify shared libraries compatibility
  * #1996
* [ ] Reduce technical dependencies in the code base
  * #1429
* [ ] Define packages scope
  * #2682

### 5.2 Full Windows support

To instrument an application using only opentelemetry-cpp api, the following issue needs to be resolved for Windows:

* https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-cpp/issues/1520#issuecomment-1197117564
* #2534
* #3176

## 6. Too late

Fixed already:

* #3073
* #2453
* #3091
* #2250
* #74
* #3138
* #2297
* #2570
* #2208
* #2054
* #2049
* #1631
* #3201
* #3193
* #2641
* #1391
* #3230

issueDTO.title: Bug: Linux Packer Scripts Fail on Windows Machine
issueDTO.description:
### Expected Behaviour

Creation of linux based AMIs


### Current Behaviour

Running commands for Linux AMIs listed under Step 3 of [Getting Started Page](https://aws-games.github.io/cloud-game-development-toolkit/latest/getting-started.html#step-2-create-perforce-helix-core-amazon-machine-image) results in the following error:

| ==> jenkins-linux-packer.amazon-ebs.ubuntu: /usr/bin/env: ???bash\r???: No such file or directory
| ==> jenkins-linux-packer.amazon-ebs.ubuntu: Provisioning step had errors: Running the cleanup provisioner, if present...

### Possible Solution

Those using Windows machines will need to install [WSL](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/wsl) and a WSL distribution to run the commands successfully.


### Steps to Reproduce

Go through [Getting Started Page](https://aws-games.github.io/cloud-game-development-toolkit/latest/getting-started.html#step-2-create-perforce-helix-core-amazon-machine-image) on Windows machine. 

### Cloud Game Development Toolkit version

latest

https://superuser.com/questions/374028/how-are-n-and-r-handled-differently-on-linux-and-windows for reference

https://github.com/hashicorp/packer/issues/2489 another one

This is the issue. Because we use file provisioner followed by shell provisioner to execute we encounter this issue.

@henrykie Could invoking the existing scripts indirectly using a shell provisioner bipass the issues we are seeing here? Based on the links above it seems that the issue is related to the file provisioner specifically

issueDTO.title: [SDK] MetricFilter needs a new AttributeProcessor to handle IncludeExclude
issueDTO.description:
Metric filtering allows to include or exclude some attributes during metric collection.

The declarative configuration defines attribute_keys filtering with:
- an include list
- an exclude list

See also the SDK spec for stream configuration:

https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/main/specification/metrics/sdk.md#stream-configuration

The opentelemetry-cpp SDK needs to provide a proper subclass of AttributeProcessor to implement this behavior.

Current AttributeProcessor subclasses like FilteringAttributesProcessor only implement partially the desired filtering.

<!--

**IMPORTANT**: As part of posting this comment, please make sure:
- that the issue is properly labeled with both `area-` and `feature-` labels.
- to apply one of the `Complexity: <value>` labels is applied to the issue [Simple | Medium | Hard]
- for an issue which was marked with `Complexity: Simple` label, it may be a good fit for a first-time contributors to this repo.
  If so, please also apply `good-first-issue` label.
-->

# Help Wanted

## Issue Summary

See https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/51611#issue-1959832122

## Potential Design

We can add one additional property to `CircuitStartOptions` and `WebAssemblyStartOptions` each:

```ts
export interface CircuitStartOptions {
  // <existing members>

  // Exists for compatibility with WebStartOptions.
  circuit?: CircuitStartOptions;
}

export interface WebAssemblyStartOptions {
  // <existing members>

  // Exists for compatibility with WebStartOptions.
  webAssembly?: WebAssemblyStartOptions;
}
```

Then we'll update `Boot.Server.ts` and `Boot.WebAssembly.ts` to "normalize" the options. Without loss of generality between circuit and WebAssembly options, something like this should work:

```ts
async function boot(options?: Partial<WebAssemblyStartOptions>): Promise<void> {
  // ...
  const normalizedOptions = options?.webAssembly ?? options ?? {};
  setWebAssemblyOptions(Promise.resolve(normalizedOptions));
}
```

This approach always prioritizes the "nested" options over top-level options. I don't anticipate there being any cases where nested and top-level options are specified on the same object, so the simplicity of this approach seems preferable over introducing more complicated option merging semantics.

## Code References

[`CircuitStartOptions.ts`](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/main/src/Components/Web.JS/src/Platform/Circuits/CircuitStartOptions.ts)
[`WebAssemblyStartOptions.ts`](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/main/src/Components/Web.JS/src/Platform/WebAssemblyStartOptions.ts)
[`Boot.Server.ts`](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/main/src/Components/Web.JS/src/Boot.Server.ts)
[`Boot.WebAssembly.ts`](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/main/src/Components/Web.JS/src/Boot.WebAssembly.ts)

## Additional Notes
- If the change you are going to make will include a **public API change** in the framework, then the change will need to go through our [API Review Process](/docs/APIReviewProcess.md). Please read this process to take any necessary steps, to avoid any potential delays down the road with accepting this change.
- If this is your first contribution to the repo, you may find it useful to learn [How to build the repo](/docs/BuildFromSource.md)
- Please note, that the changes will be considered for the vNext version of the framework by default. That is, after the change gets merged in main, it will be available only in the next preview release of the framework and will be shipped in the upcoming major release of the product.

Looks like this issue has been identified as a candidate for community contribution. If you're considering sending a PR for this issue, look for the `Summary Comment` link in the issue description. That comment has been left by an engineer on our team to help you get started with handling this issue. You can learn more about our Help Wanted process [here](https://aka.ms/aspnet/processes/help-wanted)

issueDTO.title: publish: recording the closure-size/size
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug:**
During the publish operation, we are asking for the closure-size [here](https://github.com/flox/flox/blob/5a8e106b30e86ed0e5d8e668f860157e7e81d3d0/cli/flox-rust-sdk/src/providers/publish.rs#L324). This results in another fetch of the entire closure's narinfo. In other words... it has the same effect on the network as calling `--recursive`.

This is also probably not the information we need at this point, but instead the `narSize`.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. flox publish
2. watch publish server logs to see a stream of narinfo requests for the entire closure

Result:

Expected:
A fetch of a single narinfo.

**Screenshots/terminal output (if relevant):**
```
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/03skkhbdzmivfr8c99rqbb9s5clfi0sy.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/07rgldq5cy0w1w1gvmznxmhwqwrp5jkm.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/0d4hjqfgsdchamwyfjbs3fjmycv9a5m0.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/1shqbmklbzx51mwia5ljivyrnrn130v2.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/2af51irxs1ilijingdad4hjhaigyh83c.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/2ciphq431s5bz8rjfq06z5j38ns1z1id.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/367564bwkacaqpg6c9ggxmgfx3v7ryzw.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/3l0ghb5nqlvrf83wsf2cxwn1my9xnwxv.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/3pj3d23p8k1wqgs26fjnwhh7cj5bg2c2.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/3yscaaha27gnrvch82lck0a11wjr1z3y.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/40yifhx34v4g4llrdn3v2ag8w02j10fv.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/4izi23kn57b3cw47jddzq14wcv01b5y5.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/4myqaxi85b5rmifk0x2bslzxqj642krd.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/4n5yjras972fb8d6zbcr3h40824x4296.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/58br4vk3q5akf4g8lx0pqzfhn47k3j8d.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/5whbjs10qadqlzp1ip8s8dpb093kb2p4.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/639yanpdlismyzy51rg3yw8r01k0d5fw.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/64mdyqpyzm99lx92jn2y0j1rx330cm42.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/6zvnmsqqc31zr93imf80yb39s9w5x3br.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/7qjfq0hvahprklprpr6dzpk6npqql3wl.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
      INFO   127.0.0.1:46388 - "GET /cache/80l1sb3vcmrkcdd7ihlizkcnv19rq9fj.narinfo HTTP/1.1" 307
```

comments: For context, the json result is normalized into a catalog structure that is stored in the catalog database.  Base catalog packages are done in `update-catalog` here -> https://github.com/flox/update-catalog/blob/main/src/collect-narinfo.py#L186.  And we should probably try to be consistent.  Note that the catalog service does not currently use fields within this data for anything, only the presence of the block at all is used to _prefer_ those packages over ones that do not have it present.

Recommend replacing this `--closure-size` with `--size` and obtaining the closure size somewhere else; preferably using the local store where this would run over the SQL instead of network. And only run over the top-level thing being published.

issueDTO.title: Remove MongoDBProxy
issueDTO.description:
We install [a fork of MongoDBPRoxy](https://github.com/openedx/MongoDBProxy) and use it in edx-platform (search for `mongodb_proxy`). The package is extremely simple -- it just makes is so that pymongo automatically retries certain queries N times.

I hear that this feature is now baked into Mongo and/or pymongo. If we can take advantage of that builtin feature, it would be great to remove this custom mongodb_proxy package from edx-platform and archive the repo so that we don't have maintain it anymore.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [x] Confirm that the functionality of mongodb_proxy can be recreated using builtin mongo features
- [ ] Switch edx-platform to use the builtin mongo retry feature, and uninstall mongodbproxy from edx-platform
- [ ] Manually smoke-test that Studio and LMS still run when mongodb_proxy is uninstalled.
- [ ] File an [Axim Systems Request](https://github.com/openedx/axim-engineering/issues/new/choose), asking that MongoDBProxy be archived.

issueDTO.title: Feature Request - Current Bids
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
As a user, I would love to see all the active auctions I'm currently engaged in. It would help me find the current auctions that I'm bidding on faster, without having to go through the explore DAOs page -- which will only expand as more DAOs onboard. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Not 100% sure, but perhaps a section in the user dropdown maybe?  This could activate immediately after bidding, or perhaps there's a 'watch' or 'subscribe' feature. 

Could also have a curated section on the explore or home page. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We have an excellent bots system that posts updates on Twitter and in Discord. People could rely on those instead of using the interface.
comments: We could add this to the User Command Center that Sun's working on @jordanlesich
related to #318

## 🧩 Product Overview

Eden???AI is an AI API aggregator that provides access to multiple AI services like image generation, text analysis, parsing, moderation, etc across different AI providers.  

This integration enables workflows and AI agents to perform advanced AI tasks automatically, such as generating images, extracting text from images, analyzing sentiment, and more.

---

## ?????? Important Note for Contributors

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

**Contributors based in India: please check your eligibility for receiving payments through your Stripe account before submitting, as this may affect your ability to get paid.**

---

## 🛠??? Write Actions

| **Action Item**                         | **Use Case** |
|-----------------------------------------|--------------|
| **Generate Text**                       | Produce GPT-style text completions from prompts. |
| **Summarize Text**                      | Extract key sentences from long passages. |
| **Extract Keywords in Text**            | Identify important terms in a text. |
| **Detect Language of Text**            | Detect the language used in a text. |
| **Extract Named Entities in Text**      | Identify entities (names, places) in text. |
| **Moderate Text**                       | Detect explicit or policy-violating text. |
| **Spell Check**                         | Identify and correct spelling or grammar errors. |
| **Translate Text**                      | Translate text into different languages. |
| **Invoice Parser**                      | Extract structured invoice data from files. |
| **Receipt Parser**                      | Extract data from receipts. |
| **Extract Text in Image (OCR)**        | Extract text from images (OCR). |
| **Image Generation**                    | Create images from text prompts. |
| **Generate Audio From Text**            | Convert text to spoken audio. |

---


## 📚 API Reference

- [Eden???AI API Docuemntation](https://docs.edenai.co/reference/start-your-ai-journey-with-edenai)

---

## 🧪 Test Account Access

Test Eden???AI by creating a free account on [Eden AI](https://www.edenai.co/) and using your API key with built-in credit for experimentation.

---

## 🧑???💻 New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the open-source AI automation platform powered by TypeScript. Pieces are reusable modules that, once merged, become available in the automation builder and to AI agents.  
Start creating here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)

issueDTO.title: [Filters] Add filters to Task View - Task Instances Tab
issueDTO.description: ### View Task View ??? Task Instances Tab ### Filters to Add - Filter by **Run ID** ??? Allows users to locate a specific run of interest for this task - Filter by **Operator Type** ??? Helpful for identifying runtime behavior across operator classes (e.g., all `PythonOperator` vs. `BranchOperator`) - Filter by **Duration Range** ??? Surface long-running task instances that may require optimization - Filter by **Logical Date** (from DAG Level) ??? Aligns with data intervals and scheduling logic - Filter by **Try Number** ??? Identify retries or flaky task runs - Filter by **Queue** ??? Investigate issues related to worker routing or prioritization - Filter by **Pool** ??? Debug resource contention or pool-based throttling - Filter by **Mapped Index** ??? Useful for triaging issues in mapped tasks, especially outlier indices - Filter by **DAG Version** and / or **Bundle Version** ??? Correlate issues with DAG-level code changes ### API Support ?????? Partial - `/taskInstances` API supports filtering by: - `dag_id`, `dag_run_id`, `task_id`, `map_index`, `execution_date`, `state`, `try_number`, `queue`, `pool` - Missing support for: - `duration` range - `operator` type - `dag_version` ### UI Impact - Extend the table filter panel with these fields (some already present in the table) - Consider grouping filters into metadata (queue/pool), execution details (duration/try), and versioning ### Notes - These filters help narrow down problematic or anomalous task instances in large DAGs - Especially valuable in cases with dynamic task mapping or retry-heavy operators ### Committer - [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.

issueDTO.title: [Filters] Add filters to DAG View - Backfills Tab
issueDTO.description: ### View **DAG View ??? Backfills Tab** ### Filters to Add - Filter by **Start Date / End Date** ??? Useful to isolate backfills that targeted a specific data range - Filter by **Created At** ??? Helps identify when backfills were initiated (e.g., ad hoc vs. automated) - Filter by **Completed At** ??? Enables monitoring of completion lag or stuck backfills - Filter by **Duration** ??? Surfaces long-running backfills that may impact system performance - Filter by **Reprocess Behavior** ??? Distinguish between missing-only backfills and full-range reprocessing - Filter by **Max Active Runs** ??? Useful when diagnosing throttling or concurrency constraints in backfill execution - Filter by **Status** ??? Surface failed or incomplete backfills ### API Support ??? Yes - `/dags/{dag_id}/backfills` supports filtering via: - `start_date`, `end_date` - `created_at`, `completed_at` - `status`, `table.duration`, `table.reprocessBehavior`, `max_active_runs` ### UI Impact - Add filter controls above the backfill table (consistent with DAG Runs tab) - Consider sortable columns and pill filters for behavior or status - Could also support "re-run" or "cancel" from filtered selection ### Notes - Users often need to investigate reprocessing activity during incidents - Filtering helps correlate performance issues with large or frequent backfills

issueDTO.title: [Filters] Add filters to DAG View ??? Runs tab
issueDTO.description: ### View DAG View ??? Runs tab ### Filters to Add - Filter by **Run After Range** ??? Helps find runs that were delayed or executed later than expected - Filter by **Start Date** ??? Helps find runs that started during a specific window of time (e.g. following a system update) - Filter by **End Date** ??? Useful to identify runs that ended recently or ended during a problematic period - Filter by **Duration Range** ??? Identify long-running or stuck DAGs - Filter by **DAG Version** and/or **Bundle Version** ??? Correlate failures or anomalies with recent code or deployment changes - Filter by **Conf Key/Value** ??? Enables users to track down runs with specific parameters (e.g., a run triggered with a certain `partner_id`) - Filter by **Logical Date Range** ??? Useful for identifying runs within a specific scheduled interval (e.g., a regression starting on June 1) - Filter by **Triggered By** (e.g. manual, CLI, sensor, asset, backfill) ??? Quickly isolate runs from specific sources or trigger types - Filter by **Consuming Asset** ??? Identify DAG runs triggered by a specific upstream asset event - Filter by **Producing Asset** ??? Identify DAG runs producing a specific downstream asset event ### API Support ?????? Partial - `/dagRuns` supports filtering by: - `dag_id` - `state` - `run_type` - `execution_date` (logical date) - Missing filter support for: - Conf content (e.g., key/value search) - Run-after range - Logical date range - DAG version or bundle version - Trigger source (manual, CLI, etc.) - Producing asset / Consuming asset ### UI Impact - Filters could be placed above the DAG Run table (as dropdowns, date pickers, or input fields) - Filtering improves usability in high-throughput environments and large DAGs - Enables faster root cause analysis and run correlation ### Notes - Conf filtering and trigger source filtering are especially useful for asset-aware and parameterized DAGs - Logical date and duration range are essential for tracking SLAs and performance regressions

issueDTO.title: [Filters] Improve DAG View ??? Code tab with search and section filters
issueDTO.description: ### View DAG View - Code tab ### Proposed Improvements - **Text Search (within DAG code)** ??? Enables quick lookup of task IDs, parameter names, function names, or config snippets - **Toggle for File Diff (across DAG Versions)** ??? Helps users understand changes introduced between versions (especially when troubleshooting regressions) - **Section Filter (e.g., show only task definitions, schedule config, etc.)** ??? Useful when scanning long DAG files to focus on relevant areas (e.g., `@task` decorators, `@asset` functions) ### API Support ??? No - DAG source code is retrieved in full via the `/dagSource` endpoint. - No server-side support for search, diff, or section indexing currently exists. ### UI Impact - Text search input could be added above the code viewer, with inline highlighting. - A toggle for DAG version comparison could enable unified or split diff views. - Section filters could be implemented via regex (e.g., jump to task definitions) or indexing during parsing. ### Notes - Particularly helpful for large DAGs with many custom functions or inline logic - Would bring the UI experience closer to modern IDEs, improving developer ergonomics

issueDTO.title: Automate common text transforms.
issueDTO.description:
### Description

There are a number of text transformations that amount to repetitive tasks commonly done by authors. To give one example, if I'm quoting a brief passage that contains quotation marks???

> During this time the  meanings of "liveness" and "presence" were indistinguishable from Western discourses of modernization.

???I'll need to convert the double-quotes used in the quotation to single-quotes in my paper, like so:

> Lisa Parks argues that "during this time the  meanings of 'liveness' and 'presence' were indistinguishable from Western discourses of modernization."

This sort of thing can be done by hand or with find-replace (if find-in-region were a thing in Zettlr; see #4040). But it's also the sort of yak shaving/repetitive task that cries out for automation, particularly when using a tool like Zettlr that contains other features of advanced text editors.

### Proposed Changes

Many programming text editors contain a menu or sub-menu from which users can select text transformations that are common in programming, such as changing tabs to spaces, toggling upper and lower case characters, straightening quotes, etc. For instance, BBEdit has a killer `Text` menu:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caa059ea-7846-462f-8763-fa0e57431161)

I'm suggesting that Zettlr add a similar menu or sub-menu populated with text transformations that are common in academic or journalistic writing. These could include:

- Double quotes to single quotes. (See above.)
- Single quotes to double quotes.
- Italics to quotes (e.g., for changing `_Cultures in Orbit_` to `"Cultures in Orbit"` to satisfy a different style guide.)
- Quotes to italics.
- Join lines (a.k.a. unfill-region, see #4039)
- Sentence case to title case.
- Title case to sentence case.

???and possibly others.

Possible locations for these menu items could include the edit menu (or a sub-menu under the edit menu), the right-click context menu when text is selected in the editor, or a top-of-screen toolbar button. Some of the most commonly used transforms might also be given their own keyboard shortcuts.

### Caveats

None.

### Do you Wish to Attempt Implementing this Yourself?

No

### Zettlr Version

Nightly

### Your Platform

- [ ] Windows
- [ ] macOS
- [x] Linux

### Operating System Version

Manjaro (Rolling)

### Additional Information

_No response_
comments:
I keep finding more transforms that would be useful.

- Text cut-and-pasted from PDFs sometimes has extra spaces in weird places, so "strip duplicate spaces" could be useful.
- Straighten quotes would be very useful, since text cut-and-pasted from Word documents and from PDFs often contains smart quotes that aren't needed in markdown.
- I occasionally find article or book PDFs where the page designer has replaced double quotes with pairs of individual single quotes (e.g., '' instead of "). Similarly, text cut and pasted from LaTeX documents will often have pairs of single quotes and/or backticks in place of double-quotes. A transform that converted paired single quotes and paired backticks to double-quotes would come in handy from time to time.
- Different style guides advise for or against using spaces on either side of emdashes. A transform would make it simple to toggle from one to the other.

Im gonna add a good first issue label here, because the bulk of the work only involves writing appropriate CodeMirror commands. Tying them to a context menu or keyboard shortcuts is then trivial. So anyone who wants to learn how CodeMirror commands work is invited. @wideaperture would you mind collecting your suggestions in an easy to parse task list so that people can pick and choose? Maybe even create subissues on this one, if that works?

Sounds good, thanks for putting this on the roadmap! Here's the list of tasks, which I will link to the related sub-issues, once these are created.

- Straighten quotes. (Convert `??? ??? ??? ???` to `" ' ' "`.) #5675
- Double quotes to single quotes (Convert `"` to `'`.) #5676
- Single quotes to double quotes (Convert `'` to `"`.) #5676
- Italics to quotes (Convert italicized text, like `_Cultures in Orbit_` to quoted text, like `"Cultures in Orbit"`) #5677
- Quotes to italics (Convert quoted text, like `"Cultures in Orbit"` to italicized text, like `_Cultures in Orbit_`) #5677
- Join lines. #4039
- Sentence case to title case. #5678
- Title case to sentence case. #5678
- Strip duplicate spaces. (Convert `technical things  have political qualities` to `technical things have political qualities`) #5679
- Paired quotes to double quotes. (Convert ` `` ` and `''` to `"`) #5680
- Add spaces around emdashes (Convert `???contended???in a curious mixing of metaphors` to `???contended ??? in a curious mixing of metaphors`) #5681
- Strip spaces around emdashes (Convert `???contended ??? in a curious mixing of metaphors` to `???contended???in a curious mixing of metaphors`) #5681
- Create a sub-menu, `Transform`, for text transforms like those above that appears in the `Edit` menu and/or in the right-click context menu for selected text in the editor.
Thank you! I have now added the corresponding label to each of them. Maybe we can share the workload with new contributors!
Thank you so much! Would it help if I provided some regular expressions for the various transforms? I???m not savvy enough to contribute to the code base, but I???m at least handy with regex.
Definitely, but regex is not suitable for everything. And for some others, it may be easier to do it manually. But I guess it won't hurt to think about that!
True! I can see how native functions and/or simple find-replace strings could work for many, if not most, of these.

Well, regex is native, too :D I'm just always hesitant to use them in instances where simpler things may work too, because Regex adds quite some overhead in terms of parsing. Although, for commands that are invoked consciously and not on every keypress this is probably worrying too much on my side!
Github just added sub issue management on mobile -- I've now added your issues as sub issues here so that it's hopefully even easier to find!
Fantastic, thank you! I think the older #4039 may also be a sub-issue of this now.
Good catch, added!

@richdouglasevans and @nathanlesage ??? As promised, here is a composite PDF from which you can glean text to test the various transforms.

Below are the representative passages for cutting and pasting. I notice that the cut-and-paste behavior differs somewhat depending on the PDF viewer from which the text is copied to the clipboard. Zotero's on-board PDF viewer, for example, seems to replace line breaks with extra spaces, while other PDF viewers introduce hard wraps for each line of text. In any case, here goes:

This passage from Lisa Parks' _Cultures in Orbit_ demonstrates #5680 (paired quotes to double quotes):

```
Our World???s structure established precedents for subsequent
global television coverage, alternating between live views of the television
studio, maps, and remote locations, interpellating the viewer not only as
??????globally present?????? but as ??????culturally worldly?????? and ??????geographically mobile.??????
Seen by millions of viewers throughout North America and Europe, this
early experiment helped to determine one of the cultural forms of satellite
television.
```

When I paste it from Zotero's PDF viewer, instead of the hard wraps, I get #5679 (duplicate spaces):

```
Our World???s structure established precedents for subsequent  global television coverage, alternating between live views of the television  studio, maps, and remote locations, interpellating the viewer not only as  ??????globally present?????? but as ??????culturally worldly?????? and ??????geographically mobile.??????  Seen by millions of viewers throughout North America and Europe, this  early experiment helped to determine one of the cultural forms of satellite  television.
```

This passage from Evans and Ludgren's _No Heavenly Bodies_ has some wicked hard wraps that could be resolved with #4039 / unfill-region (Zotero again changes these wraps to duplicate spaces):

```
The launch of Sputnik and Yuri Gagarin???s flight, of course, ??were impor??tant
landmarks of the Space Race and widely considered to be significant victo-
ries for the Soviet ??Union during the Cold War. 2 However, the act of broad-
casting Gagarin???s return to Moscow to audiences in Western ?? E
urope was not
an example of unidirectional propaganda, but rather a cooperative effort
by broadcasters in both the Soviet U
 ?? nion and ??Europe.3
```

This passage from Patrick Robert Parsons' _Blue Skies_ has more hard wraps, as well as smart quotes, both single and double, to be straightened (#5675). Once straightened, the quotes could also be used to test #5686 (converting between double and single quotes). It also has an emdash with no spaces around it (#5681): 

```
The consumer could choose from
three-inch tubes to ???giant??? twenty-inch screens, as well as direct view pic-
ture tubes or early ???projection screen??? receivers. None of the sets were cheap.
Prices ranged from $99 to nearly $5,000 for custom-built models.12 The av-
erage selling price was around $575 in 1947 and, although prices came down
a bit each year, it was still a costly adventure.13 As historians Christopher
Sterling and Michael Kittross noted: ???The typical 5-inch to 7-inch receiver
cost from $375 to $500 in mid-1948???several weeks??? pay for the average
worker. 
```

And the excerpt of the interview with Whitney Phillips from Nieman Lab contains emdashes that do have spaces around them (#5681):

```
Our world is awash in mis- and disinformation. Conspiratorial thinking
and misguided beliefs and attitudes towards science are widespread. But
combatting this deluge of problematic information must be done with care.
Too often, argues Whitney Phillips, we dismiss the people who consume or
propagate such information as irrational. In fact, given the experiences
they may have been having on the internet for many years ??? or what they
may have been encountering via traditional media for decades ??? their
views, troubling as they may be, may in many cases be perfectly rational.
```

[TransformExamples.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19493251/TransformExamples.pdf)

Love it @wideaperture ??????

It's immediately thrown up stuff 🥳 For example, the excerpt from Evans and Ludgren's _No Heavenly Bodies_ includes some unwanted line breaks... I ran the command in my dev version of Zettlr and they're removed. Sadly, the text has some "funky" whitespace that confounds the existing transforms.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c7bff1e-a9f1-475d-a871-a6d8908ecc7b)

That "whitespace" is `SPACE` + `SOFT HYPHEN` ([?](https://www.ascii-code.com/CP1252/173)) + `SPACE`.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/74d612bf-92f4-4a11-ac2f-de86b75e4f54

I'll leave it to you and Hendrik to decide _What_ to do here; perhaps there's a composite transform called `Zap Gremlins` that does a whole bunch of cleanup on a selected block of text:

* remove unwanted line breaks
* strip duplicate spaces
* remove any soft hyphens, hairline spaces, that sort of thing
* more?

In any case, GREAT! Having real data to work with is fantabulosa ??????

Thank you, @richdouglasevans! I love the idea of a `Zap Gremlins` option. Another Zettlr-adjacent app, Scrivener, [seems to have this feature](https://forum.literatureandlatte.com/t/what-is-zap-gremlins/44999/2), so some users may already be familiar with it:

> Text Tidying ??? Zap Gremlins Strips Unicode and ASCII control characters from the selection. If you are having difficulties compiling, or have found areas in your text where the cursor seems to get ???stuck??? when moving through ranges of text, your document may have acquired these invisible control characters from somewhere. This command will strip out all of the Unicode characters falling within the range of #x00 to #x1F, save for the necessary #x09, #x0A, #x0C and #X0D characters, which are used to print spaces, line returns, page breaks and tabs in your text.

I haven't used Scrivener in something like 12 years, so I had no idea they had implemented this. It seems, in fact, like we've independently arrived at [nearly all the same features](https://www.literatureandlatte.com/blog/clean-up-your-texts-with-scrivener):

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0ecb032c-e896-4f17-a53d-f39ff569010c)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e3869737-f59d-42d8-a3e8-dc77cd3813ff)

I think the only (relevant, non-word processor-y) ones not on our list are `Zap Gremlins`, `Strip Leading Tabs/Spaces`, `Make Uppercase`, and `Make Lowercase`.

@nathanlesage Any sense of when these features might be code-reviewed/merged? I know you have more important things going on, so no worries. I'm just triaging different manuscript tasks and this would be such a significant time saver, that there's some stuff I might put off until it's available.

Thank you, as always!!

Hiya @wideaperture and @richdouglasevans -- I know this issue has been open a bit, but I really do want to fast-track this now.

My idea currently is the following since @kyaso and @sensologica have little time right now:

It might make sense to put this even before the table editor. However, I am very lost with regards to the various pull requests you opened, @richdouglasevans -- could you provide me with a sorted list in which order I should look at them? Then we can merge this soon and be done with this task.

I'm at IC2S2 next week where I'm conference chair, however, so it'll be the week thereafter at the earliest.

> However, I am very lost with regards to the various pull requests you opened, @richdouglasevans -- could you provide me with a sorted list in which order I should look at them?

There is just a single pull request (PR) which addresses exactly one of the proposed transforms:

* #5701

I have implemented all of the transforms _locally_ ??? the various videos showcasing the editor integration attest to that ??? but I have not raised PRs for them because:

> I'm using this PR to both flush out the approach and learn any things about contributing to this codebase. If all goes well I'll implement the other text transforms secure in the knowledge that the approach has been signed-off by Hendrik (and others) and any "dumb" first-time contributor stuff is sorted.

In your comment on that PR you expressed a potential reservation about the approach taken; [you wrote](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701#issuecomment-2772653913):

> I'll have to think if it's really adequate to have the transform commands implemented using a factory style.

The other twelve or so transforms all use the exact same approach; I am loathe to raise twelve or more PRs only to receive a review comment along the lines of _"This approach is inadequate."_ You know what I mean? :D

Mmm 🤔 What I'll do is raise exactly one more PR for another transform so that you can see how the approach works across two distinct transforms. I will action any review comments you leave and, hopefully, PRs for the remaining transforms will flow in quickly with (relatively) minimal review required because the approach has been signed-off.

I'll raise that PR tomorrow and then reply to this conversation with a sorted list of exactly two PRs ??????
Sounds good! Thanks for sticking with me, even if it took a while 🙈

I've updated the single existing PR with another commit. * #5701 I've done another commit as opposed to another PR because this work is still "up in the air" about the approach. The approach might be rubbish in which case deleting one PR and branch is easier than two PRs and two branches. For the reviewer -- Hendrik I reckon 😄 -- I suggest starting in the `transforms` directory: each transform is implemented in its own file. If we go ahead with this approach there will eventually be 12+ distinct transform files in this directory. The `transform-selected-text.ts` [file](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701/commits/22720ecb402506888a02907f14727b2fa221962a#diff-c8b72e744c4ad2c580752e458bcf587e1990c8c8d87d5b0ef4d0bb0886ddcc88R39) contains the machinery for all these transforms: the `transformSelectedText` higher-order function accepts some transformation function -- it doesn't care what the specifics of the transformations are -- and it handles all the CodeMirror machinery. This leaves the implementation for each transform free to focus on just doing the transform: * the `stripDuplicateSpaces` transform [is trivial](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701/files#diff-f8e8885cfb2144e5180d7d5d6dfb15c4dcb19151b1e0cf2833a6281538246534R16): the JSDoc is longer than the implementation. * the `italicsToQuotes` [transform](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701/files#diff-26c049ca247b0a5c20b97524cf86d333cf7a28ef5d727ade068ec5909cd80c09R16) is the most "complicated" transform which is why I chose to include it as the only other transform in this PR. It uses Hendrik's existing AST code in the implementation following a steer from Hendrik. The other transforms are somewhere between these two in terms of implementation complexity. (Many are one-liners.) They all use the `transformSelectedText` higher-order function which does not change across all 12+ transformations. Each transformation has unit tests: indeed, the unit test code dwarfs the implementation code. There are some outstanding questions around I18N and, I think, around adding these transformation commands to the app's menu somewhere. (Currently the transforms are only exposed via the context menu.)

> Hiya [@wideaperture](https://github.com/wideaperture) and [@richdouglasevans](https://github.com/richdouglasevans) -- I know this issue has been open a bit, but I really do want to fast-track this now.
> 
> My idea currently is the following since [@kyaso](https://github.com/kyaso) and [@sensologica](https://github.com/sensologica) have little time right now:
> 
> It might make sense to put this even before the table editor. However, I am very lost with regards to the various pull requests you opened, [@richdouglasevans](https://github.com/richdouglasevans) -- could you provide me with a sorted list in which order I should look at them? Then we can merge this soon and be done with this task.
> 
> I'm at IC2S2 next week where I'm conference chair, however, so it'll be the week thereafter at the earliest.

You folks are the best, thank you so much! Happy to be a beta tester if that's helpful.

Right, all the transforms are "in" locally. ``` $ git lp 0f945c35d9dc6fd3f8afe8afd0369ce6f75a9c1a (HEAD -> 5659-automate-text-transforms) feat: add transform to title-case text bddf3a004dbdf43e377361e79c3f27abd46be111 feat: add transform to zap gremlins 694ee7afeead1041e5947932be308c13a0b019d1 feat: add transform to sentence-case text 21694febe608f3115b064728056fb04ad3c11d39 feat: add transform to paired quotes to double quotes 8dc0a094c9e18e5edf58005d06856337645a8318 feat: add transform to convert quotes to italics eb25f8b3cbd9f2adac30b9ff80dec6463b1ccc40 feat: add transform to convert curly quotes to straight quotes b15710f8a5e97fc5a6caa3c483b2b1885fad0c9c feat: add transform to convert single quotes to double quotes 46a4073156395c14e48423c2449ac1aefdedddb2 feat: add transform to convert double quotes to single quotes 58885d4ae7d42cd109f82344da843e0d5fb3535b chore: fix lint issues f9f7e687ae2718d344c50a9e548214844db9a04c feat: add transform to remove spaces around emdashes d9035143ca17d441d48be748558c16d247f03b63 feat: add transform to add spaces around emdashes e3164d1e559ceea6d747442e301cca642a467174 feat: add transform to remove line breaks ec19edc4608f809621b472b44e58da84ca4b3d7c feat: Add transform to change italics to quotes 4e686f4c7523f3c7667b2d71fc4e51c26747c684 feat: Add transform to strip duplicate spaces ``` I haven't pushed only because I want to do a spot of manual testing (locally) using the documents that @wideaperture provided for such testing. I'll push this stuff up sometime tomorrow.

issueDTO.title: <shift>-<enter> should do an enter but keep user control
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes I want to tell gemini cli: 
"""
Look at this output, this is clearly wrong:

  - gic_migration_2024_06_25: ??? Assertion passed: Command succeeded.
  - sakura_repo_exists: ??? Path exists: /Users/ricc/git/sakura
"""

Where the first part (lines 1/2) im typing and the second part (3/4) is the output of some commands i cut pasted.

However, as soon as I press the first eNTER i lose control and gemini cli gets it. We need to have some mechanism to introduce an <ENTER> without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in tyiuping mode.

I suppose SHIFT ENTER is the most natural, but happy to consider others too (or maybe one exists and Im not aware of it)
comments:
I'd support this, and it would be a good first issue for someone interested in contributing.

If no one takes it though then I will.

Heads up, we do support shift-enter on mac if you follow the same steps that Claude asks you to follow to configure your terminal to support it. https://b.corp.google.com/issues/424007249 has more details.

,take

Just to add, I personally use the Warp Terminal on Mac. By default, Warp allows you to add a new-line using either of the following:

* ??? + ??? Enter
* ??? + ??? Enter

But once you are running Gemini, it doesn't work with either approach.
Thamks for the info on warp. We would really appreciate a pull request to make both of them work  when Gemini Cli is running in warp.

hey @maisyk as per my knowledge warp isnt a terminal on its own, it uses a custom Rust-based UI framework and handles input at the application layer, not via the OS TTY driver

Warp collects keystrokes in its own internal editor, only sending the buffer to the shell on Enter or whatever you configure

so when we use gemini on warp, it is no different than using a gemini on a normal terminal, i hope this helps us understand this issue better

issueDTO.title: remove references to "system daemon" in the documentation

issueDTO.description:
We should generate an SBOM for bpfman itself and all container images built in this repo.
Something like https://github.com/actions/attest-sbom would be a good place to start - although there is `cargo cyclonedx` which would be used for the Rust/Cargo stuff if necessary.

The SBOM be uploaded as an artifact as part of a CI workflow.

This is potentially useful as Snyk (provided to us via the CNCF) doesn't support Rust directly.

issueDTO.title: docs(tutorial): Writing your Go application
issueDTO.description:
Add to `Writing your Go application` section.

This is basically referring to the following parts of the cilium/ebpf documentation:
https://ebpf-go.dev/guides/getting-started/#compile-ebpf-c-and-generate-scaffolding-using-bpf2go

On generating your `*_bpfel.go` etc.. files from your bytecode.
You can refer to the command invocation from the examples to build this for x86_64, arm64, ppc64el, s390x

Adapt the Go code from:
https://github.com/bpfman/bpfman/blob/main/examples/go-app-counter/tracepoint_main.go

It can be greatly simplified:
- No need to rely on the bpfman utils libraries
- Take the value of `map_pin_path` as a cmdline flag, defaulting to `/sys/fs/bpf`
- Don't bother checking if running on K8s or not. The purpose of the userspace application is simply to:
  - Load the maps from a file-descriptors found in `/sys/fs/bpf`
  - Periodically print the value from the maps
comments:
Hi, @dave-tucker. I'm [Dosu](https://dosu.dev), and I'm helping the bpfman team manage their backlog. I'm marking this issue as stale.

**Issue Summary:**
- Proposal to enhance the "Writing your Go application" section in the cilium/ebpf documentation.
- Suggestions include simplifying bytecode generation for different architectures and removing dependencies on bpfman utils.
- Recommends using a command-line flag for `map_pin_path` and removing Kubernetes checks.
- Focus on loading maps and periodically printing their values in the userspace application.
- No comments or further activity on the issue since it was opened.

**Next Steps:**
- Please confirm if this issue is still relevant to the latest version of the bpfman repository by commenting on this issue.
- If there is no response, the issue will be automatically closed in 7 days.

Thank you for your understanding and contribution!

issueDTO.title: docs(tutorial): Add content to writing an eBPF Probe in C section
issueDTO.description:
Take the example from here: https://github.com/bpfman/bpfman/blob/main/examples/go-app-counter/bpf/tracepoint_counter.h

And explain it a little.

Use ringbuffer instead of perf_event_array since opening perf events on all CPUs to consume events from userland requires additional capabilities.

Point out that the LIBBPF_PIN_BY_NAME is required for bpfman to know you wish to make this map "public"

Add a new markdown file /docs/getting-started/tutorial.md with the title "Tutorial".
The document should have the following headings:

```
# Development Environment

# Writing your application

# Building your application

# Packaging your application

# Running your application with bpfman locally

# Deploying your application to Kubernetes
```

Under each heading you may add "Coming soon..."

issueDTO.title: [Good First Issue] [RISCV64]: Implement CPU plugin just-in-time emitter for Swish operation
issueDTO.description:
### Context

[JIT Emitters](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/README.md) are part of code generation feature (a.k.a. tensor compiler) that automatically produces highly-efficient optimized fused subgraph binary code. Each emitter implements specific operation from low level OpenVINO dialect.

### Prerequisites
Due to limited resources, cross compilation is preferred option now for building OpenVINO targeting RISC-V development boards. Please see the documentation ["Cross compile OpenVINO??? Runtime for RISCV64 systems"](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/docs/dev/build_riscv64.md) for more details. For this work, you need to build [`xuantie-gnu-toolchain`](https://github.com/XUANTIE-RV/) or [`riscv-gnu-toolchain`](https://github.com/riscv-collab/riscv-gnu-toolchain.git) with `QEMU` support for emulation. So you don't need to have RISC-V development board even to contribute to OpenVINO for these platforms 😃 

### What needs to be done?

* Create `fp32` [Swish](https://docs.openvino.ai/2025/documentation/openvino-ir-format/operation-sets/operation-specs/activation/swish-4.html) operation [JIT Emitter](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/plugin/riscv64/jit_eltwise_emitters.hpp) for RISCV64 platform with RVV1.0 support. Use OpenVINO [CPU plugin JIT emitters](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/README.md) documentation and [RISC-V "V" Vector Extension](https://github.com/riscvarchive/riscv-v-spec/releases/tag/v1.0) documentation for details.
* Support your implemented JIT Emitter in the [JIT Executor](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/eltwise.cpp#L805).
* Modify [RISCV64 kernel](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/kernels/riscv64/jit_uni_eltwise_generic.hpp#L19) (in both places: [create_eltwise_emitter](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/kernels/riscv64/jit_uni_eltwise_generic.cpp#L401) and [get_supported_precisions](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/kernels/riscv64/jit_uni_eltwise_generic.cpp#L528)) to apply developed JIT emitter.

Before emitter implementation, please, modify tests to be sure that developed functionality is covered by test:
 * Add `jit` kernel check in [activation](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/0a177ff48a7197bee7eeb08f4e81b9d0ce8db271/src/plugins/intel_cpu/tests/functional/custom/single_layer_tests/classes/activation.cpp#L229) test, the test must fail.
* If test doesn't fail then add supported operation in [CPU activation test instantiation](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/0a177ff48a7197bee7eeb08f4e81b9d0ce8db271/src/plugins/intel_cpu/tests/functional/custom/single_layer_tests/classes/activation.cpp#L263) if it's absent.

### Tests
Tests are disabled in default build, so ensure to add `-DENABLE_TESTS=ON` into cmake command during the project configuration.

[GoogleTest](https://github.com/google/googletest) is used for testing. CPU functional test target is [ov_cpu_func_tests](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/tree/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/tests/functional). You can use `GoogleTest` filter:
```sh
# If you use xuantie-gnu-toolchain:
<xuantie_install_path>/bin/qemu-riscv64 -cpu rv64,x-v=true,vext_spec=v1.0 ./bin/[platform]/[build_type]/ov_cpu_func_tests --gtest_filter="*smoke*Activation*Swish*"

# If you use riscv-gnu-toolchain:
<riscv_install_path>/bin/qemu-riscv64 -cpu rv64,v=true,vext_spec=v1.0 ./bin/[platform]/[build_type]/ov_cpu_func_tests --gtest_filter="*smoke*Activation*Swish*"
```

### Example Pull Requests

* [Abs](https://docs.openvino.ai/2025/documentation/openvino-ir-format/operation-sets/operation-specs/arithmetic/abs-1.html) operation: https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/pull/30218


### Resources

- [Contribution guide - start here!](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [What is OpenVINO?](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino#what-is-openvino-toolkit)
- [CPU plugin JIT emitters](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/README.md)
- [Blog post on contributing to OpenVINO](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [User documentation](https://docs.openvino.ai/)
- [Intel DevHub Discord channel](https://discord.gg/7pVRxUwdWG) - engage in discussions, ask questions and talk to OpenVINO developers
- [How to link your Pull Request to an issue](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#manually-linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-the-pull-request-sidebar)
-  ["Cross compile OpenVINO??? Runtime for RISCV64 systems"](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/docs/dev/build_riscv64.md)
- [RISC-V "V" Vector Extension](https://github.com/riscvarchive/riscv-v-spec/releases/tag/v1.0)


### Contact points

@a-sidorova

summary.main: Implement CPU plugin JIT emitter for Swish operation on RISCV64 platform with RVV1.0 support, and modify JIT Executor and RISCV64 kernel.

Cross compilation is preferred option for building OpenVINO targeting RISC-V development boards. QEMU support for emulation is required.
summary.attemptedFixes: There is already a PR for this task: https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/pull/31279, but the author didn't take this ticket. The author @Benefe is asked to let us know if they're working on the PR productization.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is a Good First Issue and requires implementation of CPU plugin JIT emitter for Swish operation on RISCV64 platform with RVV1.0 support. The emitter should be developed using OpenVINO CPU plugin JIT emitters documentation and RISC-V "V" Vector Extension documentation. The issue also requires modification of JIT Executor and RISCV64 kernel. Before emitter implementation, tests should be modified to ensure developed functionality is covered. Cross compilation is preferred option for building OpenVINO targeting RISC-V development boards. QEMU support for emulation is required.

issueDTO.title: SPIKE does not build on Windows
issueDTO.description:
When we try building any binary we get the following error:

```
# github.com/spiffe/spike-sdk-go/security/mem
C:\Users\volkan\go\pkg\mod\github.com\spiffe\spike-sdk-go@v0.5.11\security\mem\secure.go:190:20: undefined: syscall.Mlockall
C:\Users\volkan\go\pkg\mod\github.com\spiffe\spike-sdk-go@v0.5.11\security\mem\secure.go:190:37: undefined: syscall.MCL_CURRENT
C:\Users\volkan\go\pkg\mod\github.com\spiffe\spike-sdk-go@v0.5.11\security\mem\secure.go:190:59: undefined: syscall.MCL_FUTURE
```

This is related to the methods not existing in windows in SPIKE SDK, which causes a compile time error.

repository.description: SPIKE is a lightweight secrets store that uses SPIFFE as its identity control plane. It protects your secrets and helps your ops, SREs, and sysadmins manage sensitive data securely with minimal overhead.
repository.name: spike

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to resolve the compile-time error when building the SPIKE SDK on Windows.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a fix for the SPIKE SDK methods not existing in Windows.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the SPIKE SDK methods not existing in Windows, causing a compile-time error.

issueDTO.title: This button doesn't always send the "Magic Link" template
issueDTO.description:
### Discussed in https://github.com/orgs/supabase/discussions/27425
Originally posted by **askkaz** June 20, 2024 We have walked a lot of Supabase users through setting up their auth emails and it is frequently a source of confusion that this button: sends the "Confirm signup" template if the user has not yet confirmed their email and not the "Magic Link" template. I think it would help users getting started if the initial menu was context aware enough to display the correct option ("confirm signup"). bonus nit - template names should match, see "password recovery" vs. "reset password" double bonus nit - email template tab names should all match casing ("Confirm signup" vs "Magic Link")

issueDTO.title: RFE: Improve indentation of annotations on multiple lines
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**

When running READ reports (e.g. `task <filter>`), where in the task list also annotations get displayed, longer annotations have non-first line indentations in line with the task description, which is misleading. It would be expected that annotations' second+ line indentation is similar to the first line, or even shifted to the right, as to be able to visually discern between annotations and task descriptions.

**Actual result (with example):**
```
ID Age   Description                                                                                 Urg 
 9  4min Task with annotations                                                                          1
           2025-07-15 Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.
           2025-07-15 Etiam vitae diam at quam congue facilisis. Donec suscipit lectus a egestas
         eleifend. Quisque dapibus eros a mattis bibendum. In gravida nibh molestie purus rhoncus,
         vitae bibendum quam molestie. Fusce interdum pretium massa. Morbi facilisis tempus massa,
         quis cursus velit sollicitudin sed.
           2025-07-15 Sed sagittis turpis nec sodales rutrum.
           2025-07-15 Fusce sed mi pulvinar, sodales quam vel, consequat arcu. Praesent condimentum
         eu nulla ac posuere. Suspendisse hendrerit metus sed lacus vulputate, non tincidunt turpis
         tempus. Mauris eu tellus malesuada, efficitur nibh vitae, imperdiet tellus.
10 31s   Task without annotations                                                                       0
```

**Expected result (proposal 1):**

```
ID Age   Description                                                                                 Urg 
 9  4min Task with annotations                                                                          1
           2025-07-15 Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.
           2025-07-15 Etiam vitae diam at quam congue facilisis. Donec suscipit lectus a egestas
           eleifend. Quisque dapibus eros a mattis bibendum. In gravida nibh molestie purus rhoncus,
           vitae bibendum quam molestie. Fusce interdum pretium massa. Morbi facilisis tempus massa,
           quis cursus velit sollicitudin sed.
           2025-07-15 Sed sagittis turpis nec sodales rutrum.
           2025-07-15 Fusce sed mi pulvinar, sodales quam vel, consequat arcu. Praesent condimentum
           eu nulla ac posuere. Suspendisse hendrerit metus sed lacus vulputate, non tincidunt turpis
           tempus. Mauris eu tellus malesuada, efficitur nibh vitae, imperdiet tellus.
10 31s   Task without annotations                                                                       0
```

**Expected result (proposal 2):**

```
ID Age   Description                                                                                 Urg 
 9  4min Task with annotations                                                                          1
           2025-07-15 Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.
           2025-07-15 Etiam vitae diam at quam congue facilisis. Donec suscipit lectus a egestas
             eleifend. Quisque dapibus eros a mattis bibendum. In gravida nibh molestie purus rhoncus,
             vitae bibendum quam molestie. Fusce interdum pretium massa. Morbi facilisis tempus massa,
             quis cursus velit sollicitudin sed.

             eu nulla ac posuere. Suspendisse hendrerit metus sed lacus vulputate, non tincidunt turpis
             tempus. Mauris eu tellus malesuada, efficitur nibh vitae, imperdiet tellus.
10 31s   Task without annotations                                                                       0
```

**Version:**

3.4.1.

issueDTO.title: Create an awesome list for Fedify
issueDTO.description:
I'd like to create an awesome list to:

- Gather real-world Fedify examples
- Gather resources or articles like tutorials
- Help users discover existing projects for inspiration

## Proposed Structure

- Services
  - Ghost
  - Hollo
  - Hackers'Pub
  - ...
- Frameworks
  - BotKit
  - ...
- Tutorials
  - ...
- Videos, Talks
  - ...


## For Discussion

1. Languages

   Many articles are written in Korean. How should we label them?

2. Inclusion Criteria

   What criteria should we use to determine which projects/articles to include?

3. Category selection criteria
 
   Are the current categories sufficient?
comments: If this proposal is okay, I'd be happy to write more concrete details.

>     1. Languages
>        Many articles are written in Korean. How should we label them?

How about adding labels like `[KO]`, `[EN]` or flags to project names? Also, adding sentences like "Korean tutorials for ..." in the description section seems considerable. 

>     2. Inclusion Criteria
>        What criteria should we use to determine which projects/articles to include?

Criteria based on minimum star ratings and licensing requirements will be good starting points. whether they're actually used in the community could also serve as a metric

>     3. Category selection criteria
>        Are the current categories sufficient?

The current category structure looks fine. I think it would be better to update this incrementally over time.

Looks fine in general!

1. Languages: Actually, many resources are written in Korean and Japanese. I think we could label them like below:

   > - [????????? ????????? ????????? ??? 2???. ???????????? Fedify & Hollo ????????????](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sqxR8zscSDo) (?????????, ???????????????)

2. Projects: I think it's okay to include projects under @fedify-dev org. For Hackers' Pub??? I think it's okay for some categories (e.g., ???Success stories???).

3. Categories: How about ???Examples????

Great. Let's start with official projects and articles like:

```md
## Services
- [Hollo](https://github.com/fedify-dev/hollo) - Federated single-user microblogging software
- [Hackers' Pub](https://github.com/hackers-pub/hackerspub) - ActivityPub-enabled social network for hackers

## Libraries
- [BotKit](https://github.com/fedify-dev/botkit) - A framework for creating ActivityPub bots

## Examples
- [microblog](https://github.com/fedify-dev/microblog) - A simple federated microblog example using Fedify for educational purpose

## Tutorials and Resources
- [Creating your own federated microblog](https://fedify.dev/tutorial/microblog) (English, ?????????, ?????????)
- [OSSCA: Fedify ???????????? ??????????????? ?????? ??????](https://hackers.pub/@hongminhee/2025/ossca-fedify-contributors-guide) (?????????)
- [BotKit ????????????](https://velog.io/@hongminhee/getting-started-with-botkit) (BotKit, ?????????)
- [Fedify DeepWiki](https://deepwiki.com/fedify-dev/fedify)

## Talks
- [????????? ????????? ????????? ??? 2???. ???????????? Fedify & Hollo ????????????](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sqxR8zscSDo) (?????????, ???????????????)
```
Ghost for ActivePub looks heavily under construction so I've removed that.

We can also be inspired by this page.
We can see what projects are actually using @fedify/fedify

https://github.com/fedify-dev/fedify/network/dependents?dependents_before=Mzg2NzI5ODE5MDY&package_id=UGFja2FnZS00NzE4NjI4MTM3

issueDTO.title: Avoid confusion between ???data file type??? and ???image file type??? output formats
issueDTO.description:
When downloading data via the _data access form_, file type selection can cause confusion for users unfamiliar with ERDDAP between the _data file types_ and the _image file types_. This is particularly the case for .geotif files, where users expect real/raw data to be available in the file. Although the ideal solution would be to add a geotiff writer that writes raw data values (as proposed by Bob Simons in [issue #58](https://github.com/ERDDAP/erddap/issues/58)), an alternative to avoid this confusion could be to categorize ???_data file type_??? and ???_image file type_??? formats directly in the output format selection menu, as simulated in the attached image.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/05b75c14-d77f-4c46-aaac-a4084764fd76)

repository.description: ERDDAP is a scientific data server that gives users a simple, consistent way to download subsets of gridded and tabular scientific datasets in common file formats and make graphs and maps. ERDDAP is a Free and Open Source (Apache and Apache-like) Java Servlet from NOAA NMFS SWFSC Environmental Research Division (ERD).

issueDTO.title: De-selecting time does not automatically remove time *constraints from url
issueDTO.description:
Hi there,

I just wanted to point out a *possible low priority bug.  We recently upgraded our version of ERDDAP to 2.25.1 (axiom/docker-erddap:2.25.1-jdk21-openjdk) and noticed that when de-selecting the time variable in the tabledap > Data Access Form, the "time" is removed from the url after generating it but the "time constraints" remain in the generated url.  We *think this wasn't the case previously, but it's possible this is expected behavior?  Our assumption was that de-selecting time would remove all time components from the generated url.  We noticed it because we ran into issues with no data being returned due to those time constraints remaining in the url.

Again, low priority but wanted to point it out in case it is in fact a bug.

This is the case for Chrome Version 133.0.6943.141 (Official Build) (arm64) on a mac.

A screenshot is attached indicating the issue.

Thanks for your time!

Best,
Sam

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f60c9bb4-0d2c-415c-866e-de44c0f9662e)
comments:
I don't know of any intention to change that behavior. I did just check on a server several versions behind and it has the same behavior.

I understand the current behavior is a little surprising, but it's also possible somebody would want to constrain a variable that they do not request in the output. One possible solution would be to change the UI to make it clearer that including the variable and applying the constraint are two separate decisions (and make it easier to clear the constraints).

No problem @ChrisJohnNOAA and thank you for the prompt reply!  We will move forward with this in mind : )

Cheers,
Sam

The plan to improve this is to add a column of checkboxes (similar to the variable column). It should be titled "Apply Constraint" and there should be a button to "Uncheck All". The main goal here is to allow users to choose not to apply a constraint.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/51c5a280-86d8-451f-83f8-2d021da1f6da)

To add this the "writeDapHtmlForm" method in both [EDDTable](https://github.com/ERDDAP/erddap/blob/main/WEB-INF/classes/gov/noaa/pfel/erddap/dataset/EDDTable.java#L8167) and [EDDGrid](https://github.com/ERDDAP/erddap/blob/main/WEB-INF/classes/gov/noaa/pfel/erddap/dataset/EDDGrid.java#L11749) will need to be updated.

Hello @ChrisJohnNOAA ! I don't get the idea .
Can you help me
@Anees02 What are you stuck on? What doesn't make sense?

@ChrisJohnNOAA 
From the plan what I understand was!
1. Add a column for each row i.e a checkbox
2. The title of the column is apply constraint with unchecked button

But i don't get the idea that each row will have different constraints right?

@Anees02 The constraints are what is defined on the right side of the current UI. The columns titled "Optional Constraint #1" and "Optional Constraint #2". The goal of the change is to make it easy for users to see and control what rows have a constraint applied to them when the url is generated.

@ChrisJohnNOAA 

the plan i explained is that correct, if it is correct i will work on the plan
@Anees02 Yes, the plan sounds good.

@ChrisJohnNOAA !
I don't understand the code at all, I have hands on experience in html, css and javascript.
I built java applications using spring and spring boot with react js as front end.

I code looks very vast and i don't know how much time it will take time to understand the codebase.

issueDTO.title: aws-cdk-lib/pipelines: CodePipelineSource.github documentation evokes questions
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the issue

`CodePipelineSource.gitHub` says "This is no longer the recommended method." but why not?

I tracked down the [comment in question](https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk/blob/main/packages/%40aws-cdk/pipelines/lib/codepipeline/codepipeline-source.ts#L24) to [this PR](https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk/pull/12326) and specifically to [this commit](https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk/pull/12326/commits/6bcbe53d9eb6806079a01ffa7e6655a1944ac88c). 

The odd thing is that the comment was added with the wording as such at the time the feature was being added. But the wording seems to imply that at one point the method was the recommended method, but the method didn't exist before the PR which introduced both it and the comment. 

I am wondering why it wouldn't be a good idea to use this method, seeing as I am already using the GitHubSourceAction in one of my stacks and it is using the owner/repo/branch with the oauthToken as a SecretValue?

### Links

https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk/blob/main/packages/%40aws-cdk/pipelines/lib/codepipeline/codepipeline-source.ts#L24
comments: This is a recommendation from CodePipeline - see [this page](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/codepipeline/latest/userguide/update-github-action-connections.html) for more info. We should expand upon this in our own docs, so thank you for bringing this up 🙂

Hmmm, haven't seen this before! In my app, I am using CDK version 2 and I have this import:
```
import { GitHubSourceAction } from "aws-cdk-lib/aws-codepipeline-actions";
```
But that construct has owner, branch, etc as required properties. ~~Where is the construct which is mentioned in the docs above?~~ I see that the "version 2" of the `GithubSourceAction` is actually the `CodeStarConnectionsSourceAction`. Is that correct? It seems odd to call the first "version 1" and the second "version 2".

Edit: Also I wonder if the recommendation might not be as strong now that Github has [fine-grained personal access tokens](https://github.blog/2022-10-18-introducing-fine-grained-personal-access-tokens-for-github/#:~:text=Fine%2Dgrained%20personal%20access%20tokens%20offer%20enhanced%20security%20to%20developers,your%20data%20of%20compromised%20tokens.&text=Stolen%20and%20compromised%20credentials%20are,data%20breaches%20across%20the%20industry.)?

Edit: After digging into this, it looks like in order to create a CodeStarConnection, you are forced to create a CodeStarProject. If this is the case then I don't see how the connection can be the preferred method to connect to an existing github repo, like in the case of a bespoke code pipeline or cdk pipeline. Creation of the CodeStarProject ends up creating a repo for you, from what I can tell, which is too heavy-handed of a solution.

Yes, CodePipeline's `v1` matches with `GithubSourceAction` while `v2` matches with `CodeStarConnectionsSourceAction`. This is CodePipeline's way of referring to these functionalities, I don't know if I agree with it either You shouldn't be forced to create a project. You should be able to go to the codesuite console (CodeBuild, CodePipeline, etc) and go to settings -> connections to create a connection without any other setup other than what's necessary to link AWS with GitHub
oh jeez... definitely never noticed that before! Sorry about the fuss above. I was quite confused.
is this closed or Should I Take and work on it? @papiro

> is this closed or Should I Take and work on it? @papiro 

I think it's just a matter of seeing if that comment is still there and figuring out why from a technical perspective it isn't the preferred way and providing the alternative way.

issueDTO.title: Decommission active consumers information tracking
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

When we worked on the dashboard sharing functionality, we added the functionality that tracked with which roles the dashboard had been shared. This information was saved on the service side for business decision needs. But now, after more than a year, we don't need this information anymore and has stopped saving it on the service side.

We also need to update the plugin to stop sending this information to the service. In particular, we need to stop using `Active_Consumers` and `Activity_Metrics` classes and remove them.

https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/aaa172cf6f0b32e7d74d95cef31b535f0798b809/includes/Core/Dashboard_Sharing/Activity_Metrics/Active_Consumers.php#L23 https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/aaa172cf6f0b32e7d74d95cef31b535f0798b809/includes/Core/Dashboard_Sharing/Activity_Metrics/Activity_Metrics.php#L23

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* Active consumer information is no longer stored or sent with refresh token requests, and related infra is removed entirely

## Implementation Brief

* [ ] In `Google\Site_Kit\Core\Authentication\Clients\OAuth_Client`
  * Remove usage of `Active_Consumers` and `Activity_Metrics` in their class property and their usage across the class

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] Allow Transform job to target alias index
issueDTO.description:
Right now Transform can only target an existing index or create a new one. It does not work if an alias index is provided.
This makes it impossible to automate the process and integrate with rollover jobs .

More details:
Lets take the following indexes as example, created hourly

elb-metrics-2022-12-19-01; 
elb-metrics-2022-12-19-02; 
elb-metrics-2022-12-19-03 ; etc ..

From transform job we can select as a source a wildcard of indexes, for example elb-metrics-*  ( this will include present and future indexes). But on the target index I only have the option to select an existing index, for example transformed-metrics or it will create this one if it doesn???t already exist . 
Now this transform jobs runs continuously, so once it is set up, it will write from source (wildcard indexes) to this transformed-metrics index.
The problem is that this index transformed-metrics will eventually have months to years of data but we only want to keep it for a few months.
And there is no way to rotate or create transformed-metrics-2 because the continuous job is set to write into transformed-metrics.
I want to be able to write in a target alias if possible so I can then rotate these indexes and keep only some.

I tried to have Transform to a write into an alias index but this doesn???t work, it does not support to target an alias 
Error: Failed to index the documents
comments:
Similar request for rollup 
#61 
#445
#226 is related and best to be resolved along with this one
Could I be assigned to this?
(+1). This is a huge limitation for us to use transform jobs.
@dragosrosculete How were you able to get around this problem?
@MahendraAkkina I used an index pipeline to rewrite the _index field to the alias. Worked like a charm. It doesn't work with datastreams because of the op_type.
