issueDTO.title: Leaving a room must leave all the predecessor rooms
issueDTO.description: Currently, when a user is leaving a room, it leaves the room and that's it. However, we must also leave all the predecessor rooms, i.e. all its the tombstoned rooms.
comments:
To solve this we have to recursively find all the predecessor rooms and make a `leave` request for each of them. I'm not sure there is a way to do this atomically, so if the client disconnects while leaving the rooms, he will remain joined in some rooms. Is there a better way to do this?

There are also other ways for a user to `leave` a room (like a kick from an Admin) and this implementation wouldn't cover that. Is this ok? Maybe this feature would be better implemented on the homeserver?

It could be implemented server-side, as long as the state events aren't not encrypted.

> I'm not sure there is a way to do this atomically, so if the client disconnects while leaving the rooms, he will remain joined in some rooms. Is there a better way to do this?

That's a real concern yes. I don't believe it's a critical operation, so we may consider it's up to the user to handle that for the moment.

> There are also other ways for a user to leave a room (like a kick from an Admin) and this implementation wouldn't cover that. Is this ok?

Let's start with a normal leave before working on kick or ban. Those have different semantics I reckon.

repository.description: Matrix Client-Server SDK for Rust
repository.name: matrix-rust-sdk

summary.main: Implement leaving a room, including all predecessor rooms, to ensure correct room state
summary.validationOrRequirement: Good first issue, consider handling user disconnection while leaving rooms. Different semantics for kick or ban.
summary.attemptedFixes: Recursive find of predecessor rooms and make a `leave` request for each. Consider server-side implementation for better handling.
summary.otherNotes: Implementation may not be atomic, leaving user joined in some rooms if client disconnects. Other ways to leave a room (e.g. kick from Admin) not covered in this implementation.

issueDTO.title: Streaming Output Filter for LLM Nodes
issueDTO.description:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (????????????????????? [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)).
- [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] ??????????????????????????? Issue?????????????????????????????????:???
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### 1. Is this request related to a challenge you're experiencing? Tell me about your story.

I'm using Dify to build a chatflow with streaming output. My current chatflow uses two LLM nodes:

-   DeepSeek-R1: Generates a thinking process, wrapped in `<think>` HTML tags.
-   Gemini: Generates the final answer.

The DeepSeek-R1 node adds the following HTML prefix to its streaming output:

```html
<details style="color:gray;background-color: #f8f8f8;padding: 8px;border-radius: 4px;" open> <summary> Thinking... </summary>
```

When accessing the chatflow via the API, I need to receive the streaming output *without* this HTML prefix. However, if I try to filter the output using a code node (e.g., with regular expressions/python scripts), it breaks the streaming ??? I have to wait for the entire response before processing it.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Filenames of files downloaded via PrusaLink are truncated to 8.3 characters
issueDTO.description:
### Printer model

MK4S

### Firmware version

6.2.0

### Upgrades and modifications

None

### Printing from...

PrusaLink

### Describe the bug

This one is really simple. If you have a model with a filename like:

My_Axolotl_Model.bgcode

...and you upload it to PrusaLink, it appears with that filename. But if you download it, PrusaLink sends it with the filename:

MYAXOL~1.BGC

...which, of course, is the 8.3-character truncated filename for older file systems like FAT16.

There's no reason why PrusaLink can't send the file with its full and original filename, which is obviously retained after uploading because it appears correctly in the PrusaLink file store for the printer.

### How to reproduce

Upload a file with a filename that exceeds the 8.3 format. Download the same file and observe its filename.


### Expected behavior

The file should be transmitted by PrusaLink with its full and original filename.

### Files

_No response_
comments: I just wrote a PR #4598 that will solve this issue :)
Update the small download icon under Storage works well. What does change the filename to 8.3 format is when you open the file and use the BIG DOWNLOAD button.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Multiple Filters not Supported by Supabase Realtime
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

Right now, Supabase Realtime does not support multiple filters. If used, the live provider for supabase will send an invalid filter payload, causing the realtime request to fail.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create any realtime resource
2. Add more than 1 filter to the resource (I was using a useList hook with multiple objects in the filters option)
3. Watch websocket network requests, it will show an error.

### Expected behavior

I think we should either log a warning if we see multiple filters, or naively take the first one? 

### Packages

- supabase realtime v2.30.34 (not latest, but also not fixed in latest)
- @refinedev/supabase 5.9.4

### Additional Context

See here for Refine's implementation, where it is joining each filter with a comma. 

https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blame/8be95d808ae2f3f280ebd015bd95eb04238fe463/packages/supabase/src/liveProvider/index.ts#L67

See here for feature that is being discussed. No real activity it seems.

https://github.com/supabase/realtime/issues/486
https://github.com/supabase/realtime-js/issues/97
comments:
Hello @amerryma, 

Can you please give us the `full error log` and `filters`?

Hello @amerryma, thanks for the issue.

We discussed with the core team and decided not to add `filters` to the subscription since complex and relation-based filters might not work as expected in Supabase Realtime.

After removing `filters`, any change in the `posts` table will trigger the `posts` query again, ignoring the filters. We believe this approach is correct. What do you think?
My workaround for now was picking one filter that did 90% of the server side filtering then did the rest on the client side. So you're saying that you will remove the filtering altogether?

> My workaround for now was picking one filter that did 90% of the server side filtering then did the rest on the client side. So you're saying that you will remove the filtering altogether?


I was wrong. [In this use case](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/discussions/6366), the filters must work. We'll investigate [this issue](https://github.com/supabase/realtime-js/issues/97) and see what we can do.

We're currently considering showing a warning when multiple filters are used and allowing users to override the `liveProvider`'s filters using the `meta.realtimeFilters` prop.
I've also bumped [an issue](https://github.com/supabase/realtime/issues/486#issuecomment-2371379197) directly inside supabase/realtime to see what the status is there.

Until there are any updates in the supabase side, we should have this working without an error. Picking the first filter will work for many cases but it must be configurable (like `meta.realtimeFilter`). When working with multiple filters, realtime subscription may log a warning (like @alicanerdurmaz stated) about the current issue and say that only the first filter is picked etc.

If Supabase starts supporting multiple filters in the future, we can just deprecate the `realtimeFilter` and revert back to the current state 🤔 

Maybe @alicanerdurmaz can provide a detailed description for the implementation we want and it will be a guide for anyone interested in working on this issue 🚀 🚀

@amerryma @aliemir 

I think it would be good to warn if there is more than one filter and allow the user to override the filter if needed. 

1. **Warning for Multiple Filters**  
   If more than one filter is used, show a warning to user. If `meta.realtimeFilter` is available, use that instead of `params.filter`.
   [Code Link](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blame/8be95d808ae2f3f280ebd015bd95eb04238fe463/packages/supabase/src/liveProvider/index.ts#L67)

2. **Fix Filter Syntax Errors**  
   There are some syntax errors in the generated filter. These need to be fixed and tested.

3. **Skip Unsupported Filters**  
   Some filters that work in Refine don't work with Supabase Realtime. Ignore those filters when generating for Realtime.  
   [Supabase Realtime Docs](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/realtime/postgres-changes)

Hey! 
I want to work on this issue.
Hello @raja8287, thanks for improving Refine, we are open to all contributions 🙌
Hi, is it still open? I would like to work on it.
Yes @Klebson-I 🙌
Hey @alicanerdurmaz , Can you please assign this to me.
@SharkyBytes you can create a PR, we don't assign issues to people anymore.
Hey!I want to work on this issue

Hey! I'd like to work on this issue.

Plan:
- If multiple filters are passed, warn the dev
- Use only the first filter by default
- Allow override via meta.realtimeFilter

Does this sound good?
Hi! I???m new to open source and I???d love to contribute to this issue. Can I work on this? Any additional context or guidance would be appreciated 🙌

issueDTO.title: Content request: best design practices for wallets (UX/UI)
issueDTO.description:
This is a content request for anyone to write a beginner friendly article about designing a crypto wallet interface.

Whoever wants to write the article, please first comment on this issue and we will assign it to you.

**Where will the article live?**
It will be added to design documentation: https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/design-and-ux/

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- focus on practical tips how to handle different steps in the process
- describe common UX issues in wallets to fix or avoid
- guidelines to follow 

If this is too broad it can be split into multiple articles
comments: Gm @konopkja. I have experience in this field and would love to be assigned this task. I would love to split it into multiple articles.

hi @BoluwatifeInferno  thats great! Thank you so much! Can you please create a new issue mentioning this one and explaining perhaps summary of the first article you would write?  What the sections of the article be about.

Given the topic, are you a designer?

Yes I am, a bit rusty but I am well in tune with the basics. 

Oh sure, may I ask how to create a new issue mentioning this one?
no need to create new issue - i will assign you this one.

Gm @konopkja. I wasn't sure if this was necessary but it was mentioned in a previous comment, so I decided there was no harm. This is a mini outline of the first article in this series. 

**Best Practices In Designing Crypto Wallet Interface For Beginners.**

Overview of crypto wallets and their significance.
1. Understanding the Basics of Crypto Wallets
Types of wallets (custodial vs. non-custodial, hot vs. cold).
Key features and functionalities.
2. Key Design Principles for a Crypto Wallet Interface
Simplicity, accessibility, and security considerations.
3. Practical Steps for Designing a Crypto Wallet Interface
User research, wireframing, prototyping, and iterative design.
4. Common UX Issues in Crypto Wallets and How to Avoid Them
Complex onboarding, confusing terminology, poor error handling.
5. Guidelines for an Effective Wallet Design
Consistency, feedback, responsiveness, and visual hierarchy.

Hi, comments bellow. 

> **Best Practices In Designing Crypto Wallet Interface For Beginners.**
> 
> Overview of crypto wallets and their significance.
> 
> 1. Understanding the Basics of Crypto Wallets
>    Types of wallets (custodial vs. non-custodial, hot vs. cold).
>    Key features and functionalities.

What would be the content here? how does this contribute to the goal of the article? (we should consider the reader will know these basic differences already)
 
> 2. Key Design Principles for a Crypto Wallet Interface
>    Simplicity, accessibility, and security considerations.

This isn't wrong, but is very nuanced in this context. Be careful here when writing the content and consider that too simple UI often lacks appropriate amount of guidance for users (which results in poor usability as novice users do not know what to do and the UI doesnt help them, classic example is wallet "receive" screen design with a simple big QR code, acc address and no other information what to do).

Similarly some wallets in the name of security force people to only write down recovery phrase without providing other options that are deemed "less secure" resulting in a situation where people arent ready for this level of commitment and are being forced into something they do not feel comfortable doing at that point. 

> 3. Practical Steps for Designing a Crypto Wallet Interface
>    User research, wireframing, prototyping, and iterative design.

issueDTO.title: [EPIC] Implement expressions as ScalarUDFImpl
comments:
Wondering if it makes sense to convert some of these. Specifically the two I added:
- `GetStructField`: DataFusion has a similar `get_field` already we could use, but it operates by field name instead of index, so it has to find the right field by name for each batch which adds some overhead, which is some of the downside it seems to the UDFs over logical and physical expressions which can optimize these cases at analysis time. Implementing a custom ScalarUDF also doesn't really make sense because as a user you would never select a nested field by index, always by name.
- `GetArrayStructFields`: There's no equivalent DataFusion expression AFAIK, but the same thing above applies where there's not really a use cases for using this function directly, Spark just creates this at analysis time from an `ExtractValue` operation
@Kimahriman what you say makes sense. For `GetStructField` and `GetArrayStructFields` it may not be useful to convert to ScalarUDFImpl

One limitation of trying to switch from PhysicalExpr to ScalarUDFImpl I faced  - is lack of capability extract the batch size. That is why it won't work for non-determenistic functions. Though, those functions are tightly coupled with spark runtime, so I doubt they are worth being included into the datafusion-spark crate.

The list of expressions to be updated includes IfExpr, Cast, ToJson, and many others. The potential solution is unclear, but some comments suggest that it may not be necessary to convert all expressions, especially those with no equivalent in DataFusion, such as GetArrayStructFields. One limitation of switching from PhysicalExpr to ScalarUDFImpl is the lack of capability to extract the batch size, making it unsuitable for non-deterministic functions.

```console
$ ./quantize --quantized-type F16 --model-path ~/Kokoro_espeak.gguf --quantized-model-path ./out.gguf
ERROR: 0 is not a valid quantization type.
```

Turns out `--quantize-type` is an int_param??? https://github.com/mmwillet/TTS.cpp/blob/4bf8c80801e55e2459bdb877532a6b25da2aafad/examples/quantize/quantize.cpp#L33

I should be able to use human-readable names like I do with [llama.cpp](https://github.com/ggml-org/llama.cpp/blob/7675c555a13c9f473249e59a54db35032ce8e0fc/tools/quantize/README.md#L27)

```bash
./llama-quantize ./models/mymodel/ggml-model-f16.gguf ./models/mymodel/ggml-model-Q4_K_M.gguf Q4_K_M
```

The following human-friendly names should be supported, corresponding to those in https://huggingface.co/mmwillet2/Kokoro_GGUF/tree/main :
* F16
* Q4
* Q5
* Q8

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: cache not being busted when updating rollouts
issueDTO.description: ### Bug Description A user from our Discord reported that when they change a rollout rule to 100% that it is not being reflected in evaluations due to caching. https://discord.com/channels/960634591000014878/1390318142684659774 Cache should be invalidated whenever a flag changes as its a read through cache, so seems like this is a bug. ### Which major version? v1 ### Version Info v1 ### Search - [x] I searched for other open and closed issues before opening this ### Steps to Reproduce create rule with default rollout = false create rule with 100% rollout -> true above the default rollout rule run evaluation for this flag expect match = true ### Expected Behavior rollout rule comes into effect immediately ### Additional Context ```yaml flipt: config: meta: telemetry_enabled: false metrics: enabled: true exporter: "otlp" otlp: endpoint: "https://0.0.0.0:4318/" cors: enabled: true allowed_origins: "*" log: level: WARN db: url: "postgres://${database_user}:${database_password}@${database_host}:${database_port}/${database_name}?sslmode=disable" max_idle_conn: 2 max_open_conn: 0 # unlimited conn_max_lifetime: 0 # unlimited cache: enabled: true backend: redis ttl: 600s redis: host: ${cache_host} port: ${cache_port} password: ${cache_password} require_tls: true authentication: required: true exclude: management: false evaluation: true session: domain: ${flipt_domain} methods: oidc: enabled: true providers: google: issuer_url: "https://accounts.google.com/" redirect_address: "${flipt_domain}" client_id: "${flipt_oauth2_client_id}" client_secret: "${flipt_oauth2_client_secret}" ```
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This is a known limitation in Flipt v1: cache invalidation for flag evaluations relies mainly on TTL, and manual eviction only happens for direct flag or variant updates. Updates to rollout rules (or segments) often do not trigger immediate cache invalidation, so changes like setting a rollout to 100% may not be reflected until the cache entry expires. This is because the system avoids complex dependency tracking for cache eviction and instead relies on periodic TTL-based eviction for most evaluation results. See details in [this PR](https://github.com/flipt-io/flipt/pull/954).

If you need changes to take effect immediately, you can temporarily disable the cache or reduce the TTL as a workaround. The underlying issue is that the update flow for rollout rules may not be calling the cache invalidation routine (`DeleteFlag`) as expected, which is likely the root cause of the stale evaluations you???re seeing.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

---
<sup>How did I do? [Good](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=great_response) | [Irrelevant](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=irrelevant_answer) | [Incorrect](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=incorrect_sources) | [Verbose](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=too_verbose) | [Hallucination](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=hallucination) | [Report 🐛](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=bug_report) | [Other](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/7f55e3e1-7c0d-4bb9-ab64-b7464f14e473?feedback_type=other)</sup>  [![Join Discord](https://img.shields.io/badge/join-5865F2?logo=discord&logoColor=white&label=)](https://go.dosu.dev/discord-bot) [![Share on X](https://img.shields.io/badge/X-share-black)](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=%40dosu_ai%20helped%20me%20solve%20this%20issue!&url=https%3A//github.com/flipt-io/flipt/issues/4410)

issueDTO.title: Support for merging styles into one, similar to sources

It is currently possible to [merge](https://maplibre.org/martin/sources-composite.html) multiple tile sources (composite sources), e.g. `/{source1},???,{sourceN}/{z}/{x}/{y}`.   We need to allow the same thing for styles:

```
/style/{style1},???,{styleN}
```

When merging:
* [ ] combine the list of styling rules in the order provided by the user
* [ ] combine the list of sources into a single list, de-duplicating them
  * [ ] TODO: in case a of a duplicate URL, but different data source name, we may need to update the style to use the new source name
* [ ] consider merging tile sources into a single composite source request
* [ ] combine fonts and sprites

issueDTO.title: Disconnect race condition
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**

Latest version... 12.1.5 on Android. There is a race condition between

`BleManager.isPeripheralConnected(peripheralId)`

and

`BleManager.disconnect(peripheralId)`

where `isPeripheralConnected` returns `true` for a little bit after the event listener for `disconnect` fires. I've only tested it on Android.

**To Reproduce**

```typescript
const disconnectCallback = async ({ peripheral, status, domain, code }: BleDisconnectPeripheralEvent) => {
    const isConnected = await BleManager.isPeripheralConnected(peripheralId)
    // logs "isConnected true"
    console.log('isConnected', isConnected)
})

BleManager.onDisconnectPeripheral(disconnectCallback)

// await BleManager.disconnect(peripheralId, false) also has the race condition
await BleManager.disconnect(peripheralId)
```

**Expected behavior**

`isPeripheralConnected` should return `false`

**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**

Android 15+ devices

**Additional context**

I believe the issue is in `Peripheral.java`. The thread on:

https://github.com/innoveit/react-native-ble-manager/blob/4ac49e9825820a4836f4fcbcab85f2f3d6cee93a/android/src/main/java/it/innove/Peripheral.java#L162-L163

is likely competing with the sync function call:

https://github.com/innoveit/react-native-ble-manager/blob/4ac49e9825820a4836f4fcbcab85f2f3d6cee93a/android/src/main/java/it/innove/Peripheral.java#L280-L282

our workaround currently is...

```typescript
const maxTries = 10
const delayMs = 500
for (let tries = 0; tries < maxTries; tries++) {
    const stillConnected = await BleManager.isPeripheralConnected(peripheralId)
    if (!stillConnected) return true

    console.debug(`Still connected, retrying (${tries + 1}/${maxTries})`)
    await sleep(delayMs)
}
```
comments:
i guess maybe the problem is that force is enabled by default on Android, can you try to reproduce the same issue with:
```js
await BleManager.disconnect(peripheralId, false)
```

By first looking into that i think that is not a race condition but actually a behavior that happens when you're forcing it to disconnect(the force flag is enabled by default on android).
@lucaswitch Hi there. The race condition is still exhibited when `force` is `false`.

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to resolve a race condition between BleManager.isPeripheralConnected(peripheralId) and BleManager.disconnect(peripheralId) where isPeripheralConnected returns true for a little bit after the event listener for disconnect fires.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is specific to Android 15+ devices and requires the BleManager.onDisconnectPeripheral event listener to be set up.
summary.attemptedFixes: The workaround is to retry the disconnection up to 10 times with a 500ms delay between attempts. The force flag is also suspected to be enabled by default on Android, but this does not resolve the issue.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is believed to be in Peripheral.java, specifically lines 162-163 and 280-282. A workaround is to retry the disconnection up to 10 times with a 500ms delay between attempts.

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request] Add Conjugation to complete the set operations on BitSet
issueDTO.description:
### Review Mojo's priorities

- [x] I have read the [roadmap and priorities](https://docs.modular.com/mojo/roadmap.html#overall-priorities) and I believe this request falls within the priorities.

### What is your request?

The BitSet collection currently implements union, intersection and difference. Of the common mathematical set operations we are only missing [conjugation](https://www.probabilitycourse.com/chapter1/1_2_2_set_operations.php) a.ka. all not. 

### What is your motivation for this change?

Conjugation is essentially just a not on all values in the BitSet. Having an efficient standard implementation of this common operation would help any programmer using the collection to do boolean algebra.

Completing the set notation would be valuable for anyone implementing mathematical code in set theory or boolean algebra. 

### Any other details?
Conjugation and all not is only the same in the region the BitSet covers. 
A BitSet with the values 1001 should return a result BitSet with the values 0110 when all_not is called.
I would be happy to provide a draft implementation if you think this would be a good addition.

### Mathematical accuracy
If we want true conjugation we would need to implement the following:
If we want to make a conjugation that is more faithful to the possibly infinite nature of sets in mathematics we can have a struct which has an internal Bitset of things that are not in the conjugation. Then if we have a Conjugation of A, let us call it Ac, would return true if the value is set to zero in the BitSet A or if it is outside the range of the BitSet A. 

The union of two such conjugations Ac ??? Bc would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the intersection A ??? B. 
The intersection of two such conjugations Ac ??? Bc would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the union A???B. 
The difference between conjugations Ac-Bc would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the difference B-A. 
The conjugation of a conjugation Ac is just the BitSet A.

The intersection of a conjugation and a BitSet Ac ??? B would lead to a BitSet that is the difference B-A. 
The difference between conjugation and a BitSet Ac-B would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the difference  A ??? B, and if it is the other way around A-Bc then it result in the BitSet A???B. 
The union of a conjugation and a bitset Ac ??? B would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the difference A-B.
 
Needless to say this is a more complicated proposal than the simpler version and may be better suited to a set manipulation library.
comments:
+1 to filling in the API for this. Let's do the simpler version you referred to.

We would happily welcome a PR for this, thanks!

Having an efficient standard implementation of this common operation would help any programmer using the collection to do boolean algebra. Completing the set notation would be valuable for anyone implementing mathematical code in set theory or boolean algebra. A BitSet with the values 1001 should return a result BitSet with the values 0110 when all_not is called. If we want true conjugation we would need to implement the following: If we want to make a conjugation that is more faithful to the possibly infinite nature of sets in mathematics we can have a struct which has an internal Bitset of things that are not in the conjugation. The union of two such conjugations Ac ??? Bc would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the intersection A ??? B. The intersection of two such conjugations Ac ??? Bc would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the union A???B. The difference between conjugations Ac-Bc would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the difference B-A. The conjugation of a conjugation Ac is just the BitSet A. The intersection of a conjugation and a BitSet Ac ??? B would lead to a BitSet that is the difference B-A. The difference between conjugation and a BitSet Ac-B would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the difference  A ??? B, and if it is the other way around A-Bc then it result in the BitSet A???B. The union of a conjugation and a bitset Ac ??? B would lead to a conjugation where the new inner BitSet is just the difference A-B. Needless to say this is a more complicated proposal than the simpler version and may be better suited to a set manipulation library.

issueDTO.title: Focus not visible on Cover block background video
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Firefox includes `<video>` elements in the focus order (other browsers only include video controls, if present, in the focus order). The [cover block's styling removes `outline` style](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/286e6be2b13fc6ab2059b66d5c79728d811562ee/packages/block-library/src/cover/style.scss#L192) from the element, preventing the browser's default focus outline from appearing.

Removing the `outline` property from the CSS rule would allow the browser to use it's default focus outline. However, in some layouts an outline outside the `<video>` element could be obscured; adding `outline-offset: -2px;` would position the outline over the element.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions

1. In Firefox, go to a published page with a Cover block set to use a video background.
2. Use the Tab key on a keyboard to navigate through focusable elements on the page, paying attention to the page's visible focus indicators.
3. Navigate from last focusable element before the Cover block to the first focusable element after the Cover block, notice there was a Tab press between those focusable elements where there was no visual indication of what was focused; that was when the `<video>` element was focused.

### Screenshots, screen recording, code snippet

![video in focus order, focus not visible](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13856150/176040663-14a2083c-c242-44e6-b65b-5be2de4df9f3.gif)


### Environment info

- WordPress 5.8.4


### Please confirm that you have searched existing issues in the repo.

Yes

### Please confirm that you have tested with all plugins deactivated except Gutenberg.

No
comments: Confirming this is still in place in WP6.3 and FF 116.0.2

I see the outline in WP 6.4.2 and FF 116.0.03
When the cover has focus it has the .is-selected class so the following selector works:
.block-editor-block-list__layout.is-navigate-mode .block-editor-block-list__block.is-selected::after
There's CSS to apply a consistent border around selected blocks.

Should this also work for :focus in the case where the editor somehow doesn't apply the class? I think maybe not.
@colinduwe I wasn't reporting an issue with the block as presented in the Block Editor, I was reporting an issue with the block once it's published.

## Reproduction Report
### Description
This report validates whether the issue can be reproduced.

### Environment
- WordPress: 6.9-alpha-60342
- PHP: 8.2.28
- Server: Apache/2.4.62 (Debian)
- Database: mysqli (Server: 11.8.2-MariaDB-ubu2404 / Client: mysqlnd 8.2.28)
- Browser: Chrome 138.0.0.0
- OS: macOS
- Theme: Twenty Twenty-Five 1.2
- MU Plugins:
  * Gutenberg Test Plugin, Disable Login Autofocus 
  * Gutenberg Test Plugin, Disable Remote Patterns 
  * Gutenberg Test Plugin, Enable Templates UI 
  * Gutenberg Test Plugin, No-cache Headers 
  * Gutenberg Test Plugin, Normalize Theme 
  * server-timing.php 
- Plugins:
  * Gutenberg 21.1.0
  * Test Reports 1.2.0

### Actual Results
1.  ??? Error condition occurs (reproduced).

### Supplemental Artifacts
#### Chrome Browser
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c1f7a9e-b66c-4839-975c-6cac3e011fdd

#### Mozilla Firefox Browser
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/86177884-d65c-4b16-9bef-25ac5da80c00

Firefox includes <video> elements in the focus order (other browsers only include video controls, if present, in the focus order). The cover block's styling removes outline style from the element, preventing the browser's default focus outline from appearing.

The important thing here is whether the video block set as the background of the Cover block should be focused.

The video is the "background" of the content, and should be generally just a decoration to highlight the content in the cover block, so it may has no meaning as content. In that sense, I think the video should not be focused in the first place.

Pinging @joedolson @alexstine for a11y feedback.

issueDTO.title: `NIOAsyncTestingChannel` and `EmbeddedChannel` option handling
issueDTO.description:
Considering that `NIOAsyncTestingChannel` and `EmbeddedChannel` would it make sense to allow more than  `ChannelOptions.Types.AllowRemoteHalfClosureOption`?

I'm trying to test a traceroute implementation which sets `ChannelOptions.socket(IPPROTO_IP, IP_TTL)` but the test crashes because of a [`fatalError`](https://github.com/apple/swift-nio/blob/344db24aaa0eb3a56f47a700a9121639fe5437f9/Sources/NIOEmbedded/AsyncTestingChannel.swift#L580).

Would it make sense to allow any (socket) option? Perhaps storing them in the type so `getOption` would be able to return it as well?
comments:
Hey @klaaspieter, thanks for filing this. You're absolutely right: this is a reasonable ask.

The right shape is probably to both keep a local store of the set options so you can retrieve them, and also actually change the behaviour of the channel (like we're doing with `AllowRemoteHalfClosureOption`) if the channel does support it.
@gjcairo made a PR for it: https://github.com/apple/swift-nio/pull/3308.

repository.description: Event-driven network application framework for high performance protocol servers & clients, non-blocking.
repository.name: swift-nio

summary.main: Allowing more options in NIOAsyncTestingChannel and EmbeddedChannel, specifically considering socket options.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Store the set options locally and change the channel's behavior if it supports it.
summary.attemptedFixes: A PR has been made for it: https://github.com/apple/swift-nio/pull/3308
summary.otherNotes: The test crashes due to a fatalError, and the issue is about allowing more options in NIOAsyncTestingChannel and EmbeddedChannel.

issueDTO.title: Refactor and consolidate all module inline data into a single method
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

Starting in #10165 it was proposed to refactor several methods that hook into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` filter, so they are consolidated into a single method `get_inline_data` that will return all data in the single method.

For consistency, we should do this in all modules, and preferably enforce this as with an interface. We can create `Module_With_Inline_data` interface that will force adding `get_inline_data` method, and new trait `Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait` that will include `register_inline_data` method, which will hook into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` filter and invoke `get_inline_data` method.

We can then refactor all modules to use this new interface and trait, and it should be used in all new modules that are created in the future.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* New interface `Module_With_Inline_Data` is introduced to enforce the presence of a unified method on any module that provides inline data.
* New trait `Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait` is introduced to include a registration method - which will hook into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` and use the interface enforced method as a callback
* Existing modules with inline data should be refactored to use the interface and trait for consistency.

## Implementation Brief

* [x] Add new interface `includes/Core/Modules/Module_With_Inline_Data.php` 
  *  It should enforce `get_inline_data` method which should return an array
* [x] Add new trait `includes/Core/Modules/Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait.php`
  * Include  `register_inline_data` method which hooks into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` and uses `get_inline_data` as a callback
* [x] Update following modules: 
  * `includes/Modules/Analytics_4.php`
  * `includes/Modules/Ads.php`
  * `includes/Modules/Sign_In_With_Google.php`
    * Each should implement `Module_With_Inline_Data` interface and use `Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait` trait
    * Refactor existing callback for `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` hook to use new method `get_inline_data`
    * In the `register` method, invoke `register_inline_data`
* Search through codebase if any new module was added in the meantime which is also using the inline data, after this IB was written

### Test Coverage

* Update tests for updated modules to adapt the new method name usage

## QA Brief

* Smoke test the affected modules: "Analytics 4", "Ads" and "Sign in with Google" to make sure the refactor didn't cause any regressions

## Changelog entry

* N/A.
comments: AC ???
IB ???

Hey @abdelmalekkkkk, congrats on raising your first PR!

It does need a QA Brief, which will be needed for QA but is also useful for CR (and, indeed, needs to be reviewed as part of the CR process). I've assigned it back to you in Execution to add the QAB.
@techanvil Done! Thanks for letting me know.

Thanks @abdelmalekkkkk. The PR for the issue is good and I've gone ahead and merged it - congrats on your first merge!

That said - the current QAB is a bit too broad in scope; there's a lot of functionality associated with the Ads, Analytics and Sign in with Google modules, and QA engineers could spend time smoke testing unnecessary areas (or, more likely would ask you to advise them what they should be focusing on).

To make the QAB more specific, we should focus on the specific areas of functionality that the refactored code relates to, i.e. the functionality that depends on the pieces of inline data being present.

To identify these areas, I'd suggest searching for GitHub issues which mention the data keys, e.g. searching for [`supportedConversionEvents`](https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Agoogle%2Fsite-kit-wp+supportedConversionEvents&type=issues), and use these issues and their QABs for smoke testing suggestions. Alternatively, use IDE tooling to help identify PRs and their linked issues (for example I use GitLens in Cursor/VS Code, although this [doesn't seem available](https://www.reddit.com/r/ZedEditor/comments/1b5q3dl/switched_to_zed_and_missing_gitlens/) for Zed).

Simply linking to these issues with the direction to run through their QABs should suffice, rather than reproducing the QABs in this issue.

This is admittedly a bit fiddly as, despite the refactor itself being pretty straightforward, giving it a proper test means delving into some complex areas of functionality. Please feel free to reach out to me if you need any help with this.

issueDTO.title: Prefer System `getProperty()` over `getenv()`
issueDTO.description:
## Context / Recommended reading

https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#getenv-java.lang.String-

## What problem are you trying to solve?

More portable code.

There are at least two methods for reading some options passed to a Java program via process metadata:
- `System.getProperty()`
- `System.getenv()`

They are not the same. They have their specific gotchas, etc.

But in some cases it's well-documented it's preferred to use pre-built properties like:
- `System.getProperty("user.home")` over `System.getenv("HOME")` 
- and literally a few others like this (not all!)

## Describe the situation before applying the recipe
```java
System.getenv("HOME")
```

## Describe the situation after applying the recipe
```java
System.getProperty("user.home")
```

issueDTO.title: Make the "Default delay" variable dynamic for each endpoint
issueDTO.description:
### Reason/Context

The aim of this evolution would be to make the performance of a component (such as a VAS or a BFF) using mocks more realistic.

### Description

Give the option of making the ???default delay??? variable dynamic for each endpoint

### Implementation ideas

_No response_
comments:
Hi @gozen59 

Thanks for raising this issue. Can you specify a bit more what you mean by "dynamic for each endpoint"? 

As of today, delay has a default value per operation. For example, `GET /pets` can have a default delay set to 50ms and `POST /pets` a default delay set to 100ms. You also have the ability to override this value per request by specifying a `delay` parameter in the endpoint URI. For example, you can call `GET /pets?delay=200` and this time it will take 200ms to respond.

From what I read in #1597, it looks like you're looking for some randomness regarding this delay to simulate things more realistically. Is that correct? And #1597 would be another way of specifying a per-request value (instead of the `?delay=` param? Still correct?

In case my reading is correct and you're looking for some randomness, what would you think of adding an additional `delay strategy` field next to the existing `delay`? As an example, we could have:
* delay: `100`
* delay strategy: `random-20`
and the applied delay would be a random value in the 80-120 range (100 + or - 20%)

This could allow us to have a flexible approach and define some more advanced computations (using mean, percentile, etc).

What do you think?

Hi @lbroudoux ,

Yes, I was thinking of something simpler, a bit like the [Uniform_Random_Timer](https://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/component_reference.html#Uniform_Random_Timer) component in Jmeter: 
 - a Random Delay Maximum (Maximum random number of milliseconds to pause.)
 - and Constant Delay (like the actual delay, Number of milliseconds to pause in addition to the random delay.)

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity :sleeping:

It will be closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs. To unstale this issue, add a comment with a detailed explanation. 

There can be many reasons why some specific issue has no activity. The most probable cause is lack of time, not lack of interest. Microcks is a Cloud Native Computing Foundation project not owned by a single for-profit company. It is a community-driven initiative ruled under [open governance model](https://github.com/microcks/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). 

Let us figure out together how to push this issue forward. Connect with us through [one of many communication channels](https://microcks.io/community/) we established here.

Thank you for your patience :heart:

[Uniform_Random_Timer](https://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/component_reference.html#Uniform_Random_Timer) could be a strategy on its own. 

We could have these different cases and strategies:

### Fixed delay (as of today) 

* delay: `100`
* delay strategy: `null` or `fixed`

> Applies a delay of 100ms

### Uniform random delay

* delay: `100`
* delay strategy: `random`

> Applies a uniform random delay in ms in the 0-100 range

### Ranged random delay

* delay: `100`
* delay strategy: `random-20`

> Applies a random delay in ms in the 80-120 range (100 + or - 20%) 


What do you think @gozen59? Would that be a good start?
This could be a good first issue for a wannabe contributor. Let me know if you're interested in some initial guidance!

Hi  @lbroudoux  ,

Sorry for the delay.
I really like this "**Ranged random delay**" strategy :)

Thanks & regards
Postponing this one to `1.13.0` as we'll not be able to put it into `1.12.1`. Sorry!

The author was looking for something simpler, like the Uniform_Random_Timer component in JMeter, with options for Random Delay Maximum and Constant Delay. The idea is to have different delay strategies, such as Fixed delay, Uniform random delay, and Ranged random delay.

issueDTO.title: tracker: improve the kubelet test coverage
issueDTO.description:
There is a strong and growing consensus in sig-node about the need of increasing the test coverage in the kubelet, improving the current testsuite about coverage and reliability. See for example the [April 26 sig-node meeting notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ne57gvidMEWXR70OxxnRkYquAoMpt56o75oZtg-OeBg/edit#heading=h.d9zp2j5jvkke) and the [April 27 sig-node CI subgroup meeting notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fb-ugvgdSVIkkuJ388_nhp2pBTy_4HEVg5848Xy7n5U/edit#heading=h.2v8vzknys4nk).

This work has already begun and there are already some PR posted (see: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/108024#pullrequestreview-954083698). This is a great start. There are more areas in the kubelet, especially in the container manager and resource manager area, that can use better unit test coverage.

Besides the obvious benefits of documenting and preserving the current behaviour, adding tests is meant to lower the barrier for future work and contributions.

Examples of some areas which can benefit of more tests:

- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/internal_container_lifecycle.go
- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/internal_container_lifecycle_linux.go
- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/pod_container_manager_linux.go
- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/qos_container_manager_linux.go
- everything coverage-driven (check [test code coverage](https://go.dev/blog/cover) and build from there)
- error paths in general
-  e2e tests in general

issueDTO.title: Android user should be prompted to enable background battery usage
issueDTO.description:
Quiet networks will be more reliable if Android apps can run continuously in the background. To do this, users need to give the app permission. (We might choose not to run in the background when the user is on mobile data and is using QSS, to save battery, but that's another issue!) 

A user can trigger the dialog asking them to allow background battery use, but we need to prompt the user to do this. 

We could do this with a notification in the settings, or with a prompt on first run. 

"Would you like to enable background battery usage? This will make your notifications more reliable, and improve reliability for others in your community."

One thing that's tricky about this is that it's a global setting for Quiet, not a setting specific to any one community. We might need to make some section for global settings within the community settings. Or it could be another settings area in the community switcher... but this might be confusing.
comments:
@holmesworcester, I dug it a little on this and it seems that Android has two separate concepts for this: **Background activity** and **Battery Optimization**. 

On iOS it's all rolled into a single toggle: **Background app refresh**

So on Android, the first time flow might be something like this:

1. App Launch
	???	The user opens the app for the first time.

2. Request **Background Activity** Permission
	???	The app explains why background activity is needed (e.g., for reliable notifications or syncing).
	???	The user is prompted to grant permission for Background Activity.

3. Detect **Battery Optimization**
	???	The app checks if Battery Optimization is enabled for it.
	???	If enabled, the app explains why disabling it is important (e.g., for consistent notifications).

4. Request to Disable Battery Optimization
	???	The app directs the user to the system settings to disable Battery Optimization for the app.
	???	The user makes the change and returns to the app.


Is the requirement for both concepts? Are we only doing this on Android?

@holmesworcester this is ready for review.

I shared some thoughts/questions above ???. We'll need to make some decisions and then I can do another pass to clean it up.

Some of my questions at this point:
1. Is this only for Android? (iPhone has similar, but not the same, concepts with Background App Refresh and Low Power Mode)
2. Should we consider the Background Activity/Data permission on Android too?

Research and explorations in the [Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/vX86VHWl2nv8WLo1CyDwLn/Background-Battery-Use?node-id=13-37&t=R13Ko8gyN8Zz1fYc-4)
Yes, let's consider the background activity/data permission. I just saw a prompt from signal about this in a recent version.

Here's the latest [Loom](https://www.loom.com/share/f6706639844342d6a6244ae96cbcf39b) & [Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/vX86VHWl2nv8WLo1CyDwLn/Background-Battery-Use?node-id=2823-2234&t=toY1Yg5ariw7KChd-4)

What's the best way to find out if we can enable these functions without bringing up the android settings screens or native dialogs? I'm not sure of a good way to find out, as Android isn't my wheelhouse.

This is updated to draft 2 ([Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/vX86VHWl2nv8WLo1CyDwLn/Background-Battery-Use?node-id=2830-2122&t=IoqtaWDR2CmYXF82-1)) cleaning up some of the noise from decisions we made. Still questions on when and how to show the first run prompts, mocked up some options.

issueDTO.title: Create design for `A Guide to Integrating the Chimoney Slack Bot` blog on featured posts.
issueDTO.description:
## 👋 Welcome!

Welcome to Chimoney's open-source community! This issue is specifically designed for first-time contributors, so if you're new to open source or haven't contributed to our codebase before, you're in the right place. We're here to help you take your first steps and guide you through the process of making your first contribution.

## What You'll Need to Know

You don't need any prior knowledge or experience to work on this issue. We're here to support you every step of the way, so don't hesitate to ask questions if you're unsure about anything.

## Problem

We don't have designs for each of the thumbnails in our featured posts section. We would like to have a design for the `A Guide to Integrating the Chimoney Slack Bot` blog.
![Screenshot from 2024-03-16 16-04-08](https://github.com/Chimoney/Community-Website/assets/47274629/efeb95ef-27dc-4a01-b1f6-1c7e3dabd2ca)


## 📋 Step by Step

1. **Claim this issue:** Comment below to claim this issue. If someone else has already claimed it, feel free to ask if they've started working on it or if they need any help.
  
2. **Create the design:** Create a thumbnail image with dimensions as `426 x 359` px that is appropriate for the `A Guide to Integrating the Chimoney Slack Bot` blog

3. **Commit your changes:** Once you've made the necessary updates, commit your changes and then submit a pull request so we can review your changes and merge them into the main codebase.

## 💬 Keep Us Updated

We encourage you to keep us updated on your progress. If you encounter any challenges or need assistance, don't hesitate to ask for help. We're here to support you throughout the process.

## 👥 Collaboration

If you see someone else working on this issue or if you'd like to collaborate with others, feel free to reach out and offer your assistance. Collaboration is key to our success as a community!

## ??? Questions?

If you have any questions or need clarification on anything, please leave a comment below. We're here to help!

issueDTO.title: Overview Page: Refresh Adds Duplicate Commits, PRs, and Contributions (Increments by 5 Each Time)
issueDTO.description: There is a bug in the Overview section where clicking the refresh button repeatedly causes the number of displayed commits, pull requests, and contributions to increase incorrectly (typically by 5 on each refresh). This seems to be a frontend issue where the fetched data is appended rather than replaced.
comments: A bug on the Overview page causes duplicate entries for commits, pull requests, and contributions each time the refresh button is clicked, resulting in an incorrect increment (typically by 5) with every refresh. The issue appears to stem from a frontend problem where newly fetched data is appended rather than replacing the existing data, leading to inflated numbers.

issueDTO.title: Use OTel semconv package instead of consts
issueDTO.description:
The telemetry package should probably use the OTel semconv package for the consts below. The benefit of doing so is that updates to the semconv would generally require minimal changes to the telemetry package. Since the constants are already defined there, it does not make sense to redefine them in the telemetry package.

See the consts defined under the "feature_flag" namespace: https://pkg.go.dev/go.opentelemetry.io/otel@v1.37.0/semconv/v1.34.0#section-readme:~:text=Namespace%3A%20feature_flag

https://github.com/open-feature/go-sdk/blob/d7174f73db903064b8170007c2a347b727379cab/openfeature/telemetry/telemetry.go#L27-L36
comments: Yes, this is a good idea. I'm in favor of this.
Fully support. We do this elsewhere.

issueDTO.title: Assumptions on interface names
issueDTO.description:
To the extent I understand:

- CalculiX requires node groups to be named starting with `N`: `NwetSurface`
- The adapter takes the names without the `N` (`wetSurface`) and automatically "converts it to CalculiX format" (i.e., prepends the `N`).

We should:

1. Check if the first assumption really still holds
2. Not ask the user to remove the `N`, if that is part of the name

repository.description: preCICE-adapter for the CSM code CalculiX
repository.name: calculix-adapter

summary.main: Verify the assumption about CalculiX requiring node groups to be named starting with `N` and ensure the adapter correctly handles this naming convention.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Check if the first assumption still holds and do not ask the user to remove the `N` if it's part of the name.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the interface names in CalculiX and the adapter, specifically with node groups and the `N` prefix.

issueDTO.title: need a model of KIMI k2 also
issueDTO.description:
### Feature request

 add feature for KIMIK2  https://github.com/MoonshotAI/Kimi-K2

### Motivation

Need to use for the personal project
comments:
### :bulb: Auto-generated documentation-based answer:
The feature request is asking for support of the KIMI K2 model from MoonshotAI. Currently, this specific model is not mentioned in the documentation as a supported model.

However, PR-Agent/Qodo Merge supports a wide variety of models through LiteLLM. To add support for a new model like KIMI K2, you would need to:

1. Check if the model is supported by LiteLLM (the underlying library used by PR-Agent)
2. If supported, configure it as a custom model using the custom model configuration options
3. Set the appropriate environment variables as required by LiteLLM for that specific model

For custom models, you can configure them by:
- Setting `model="custom_model_name"` in your configuration
- Setting `custom_model_max_tokens` for the model's token limit
- Adding the required environment variables as specified in the LiteLLM documentation

You should check the LiteLLM documentation at https://litellm.vercel.app/docs/proxy/quick_start#supported-llms to see if KIMI K2 is supported and what environment variables are needed.

#### Relevant Sources:

> - https://qodo-merge-docs.qodo.ai//usage-guide/changing_a_model#custom-models
> - https://qodo-merge-docs.qodo.ai//usage-guide/changing_a_model#changing-a-model-in-pr-agent

issueDTO.title: Python high level SDK: support `mode="x"`
issueDTO.description:
With the recent [un-deprecation of put-if-absent in lakeFS](https://github.com/treeverse/lakeFS/issues/6956), it's now possible to support a file write mode that fails writes if an object already exists. 

This allows implementing `mode="x"` as described in [`open()`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#open) for file writers in the Python high level SDK.
comments:
I see that `upload(...)` already supports `mode="x"`.

https://github.com/treeverse/lakeFS/blob/7743cd4e6caf206ed186f33c0a9e0bbd7069922f/clients/python-wrapper/lakefs/object.py#L402-L403


Just to be clear, are you suggesting to replace those checks with the `If-None-Match: *` header instead?
@nopcoder per @skshetry , we need to change the client side verification to a server one, right?
right, also check the header support while providing presign URL

> right, also check the header support while providing presign URL

@nopcoder, how can I check the header support? I see that the presigned URL generated from `get_physical_address` does not have any `if-none-match` params in it.

https://github.com/treeverse/lakeFS/blob/dc49df9acc617c4d010ff492f72d60aa658feb68/clients/python-wrapper/lakefs/object.py#L545

Or, did you mean to pass `if-none-match` header during `link_physical_address`?

summary.attemptedFixes: Checks with the `If-None-Match: *` header instead, and client side verification to a server one, and header support while providing presigned URL.
summary.otherNotes: The recent deprecation of put-if-absent in lakeFS has made it possible to support a file write mode that fails writes if an object already exists, allowing for the implementation of `mode="x"` as described in the open() function for file writers in the Python high level SDK.

issueDTO.title: FDC3 Workbench intent raising control could be more intuitive
issueDTO.description:
## Minor Issue
Please use minor issues for discrepancies or errors found in the spec or supporting documentation, examples, and other materials.  If you wish to propose a new feature or a revision to an existing feature, please use the *Enhancement Request* template.

### Area of Issue
 - [ ] App Directory
 - [ ] API
 - [ ] Context Data
 - [ ] Intents
 - [ ] Desktop Agent Bridging
 - [ ] Use Cases
 - [x] Other

### Issue Description: 
When using the FDC3 workbench to test raising an intent I do not seem to be able to raise an intent. If I select an intent and click the "Raise Intent" button I get a validation error saying "Please Select a Context First":

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cf36ea65-3bcb-432d-9d17-44ad74ce4cef)

It should be possible to raise an intent without a conext so IMHO this is an error but when I try to select a context I am unable to select an intent:


![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c27ca503-c440-4c7c-91c5-dc4180d20092)

I am able to type in an intent and add that. Once I have done that I am able to raise an intent (this always fails but I suspect this is beacuse there are no listeners).
comments:
`context` is a required parameter in `raiseIntent`:

```ts
raiseIntent(intent: string, context: Context, app?: AppIdentifier): Promise<IntentResolution>;
```
https://fdc3.finos.org/docs/api/ref/DesktopAgent#raiseintent

Riasing an intent without context is done by passing the `fdc3.nothing` context, as described here: https://fdc3.finos.org/docs/api/spec#intents-and-context

Perhaps the `fdc3.nothing` context type could/should be selected by default?

> I am able to type in an intent and add that. Once I have done that I am able to raise an intent (this always fails but I suspect this is beacuse there are no listeners).

Yeah, it's likely responding with `ResolveError.NoAppsFound` if its a made up intent. The field accepts any string so that unstandardized intetns can be entered. From memroy, if you set a context it auto-populates the list with intents that have handlers...
@Roaders did I manage to explain this away? If not we can pick up in the meeting in an hour...
No I'm afraid not, I'm pretty sure it's not behaving as it should. I am planning to be at the meeting but having issues with South west rail at the moment!

I'd propose:
1. Making the "Raise Intent" button disabled until both the context and the intent are selected.
2. If the intent type has no options, instead of saying "no options", it could say "No apps have registered intents that support the selected context."

Turns out that this was user error and just a little explanation as suggested by @julianna-ciq would make the situation much clearer.

We should probably also disable the Intent selection list until a context has been selected. Any selection that's made in there is removed when a context is selected anyway.

repository.description: An open standard for the financial desktop.
repository.name: FDC3

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to make the FDC3 Workbench intent raising control more intuitive by disabling the 'Raise Intent' button until both context and intent are selected, and providing a clearer error message.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The 'Raise Intent' button should be disabled until both context and intent are selected. Additionally, the intent type should be validated to ensure that it has options or provide a clear error message.
summary.attemptedFixes: Proposed solutions include disabling the 'Raise Intent' button until both context and intent are selected, and providing a clearer error message. Additionally, disabling the Intent selection list until a context has been selected was also suggested.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the FDC3 Workbench intent raising control, specifically with the 'Raise Intent' button being disabled when no context is selected. The description also mentions the possibility of selecting the 'fdc3.nothing' context type by default. The issue was later found to be caused by user error, but the proposed solutions include disabling the 'Raise Intent' button until both context and intent are selected, and providing a clearer error message.

issueDTO.title: [Good First Issue] [RISCV64]: Implement CPU plugin just-in-time emitter for LogicalOr operation
issueDTO.description:
### Context

[JIT Emitters](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/README.md) are part of code generation feature (a.k.a. tensor compiler) that automatically produces highly-efficient optimized fused subgraph binary code. Each emitter implements specific operation from low level OpenVINO dialect.

### Prerequisites
Due to limited resources, cross compilation is preferred option now for building OpenVINO targeting RISC-V development boards. Please see the documentation ["Cross compile OpenVINO??? Runtime for RISCV64 systems"](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/docs/dev/build_riscv64.md) for more details. For this work, you need to build [`xuantie-gnu-toolchain`](https://github.com/XUANTIE-RV/) or [`riscv-gnu-toolchain`](https://github.com/riscv-collab/riscv-gnu-toolchain.git) with `QEMU` support for emulation. So you don't need to have RISC-V development board even to contribute to OpenVINO for these platforms 😃 

### What needs to be done?

* Create `fp32` [LogicalOr](https://docs.openvino.ai/2025/documentation/openvino-ir-format/operation-sets/operation-specs/logical/logical-or-1.html) operation [JIT Emitter](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/plugin/riscv64/jit_eltwise_emitters.hpp) for RISCV64 platform with RVV1.0 support. Use OpenVINO [CPU plugin JIT emitters](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/README.md) documentation and [RISC-V "V" Vector Extension](https://github.com/riscvarchive/riscv-v-spec/releases/tag/v1.0) documentation for details.
* Support your implemented JIT Emitter in the [JIT Executor](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/eltwise.cpp#L805).
* Modify [RISCV64 kernel](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/kernels/riscv64/jit_uni_eltwise_generic.hpp#L19) (in both places: [create_eltwise_emitter](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/kernels/riscv64/jit_uni_eltwise_generic.cpp#L401) and [get_supported_precisions](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/4ebe493140b90cbaaa68e2c71fe8e1dbd7461822/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/nodes/kernels/riscv64/jit_uni_eltwise_generic.cpp#L528)) to apply developed JIT emitter.

### Tests
Tests are disabled in default build, so ensure to add `-DENABLE_TESTS=ON` into cmake command during the project configuration.

[GoogleTest](https://github.com/google/googletest) is used for testing. CPU functional test target is [ov_cpu_func_tests](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/tree/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/tests/functional). You can use `GoogleTest` filter:
```sh
# If you use xuantie-gnu-toolchain:
<xuantie_install_path>/bin/qemu-riscv64 -cpu rv64,x-v=true,vext_spec=v1.0 ./bin/[platform]/[build_type]/ov_cpu_func_tests --gtest_filter="*smoke*Logical*LogicalOr*"

# If you use riscv-gnu-toolchain:
<riscv_install_path>/bin/qemu-riscv64 -cpu rv64,v=true,vext_spec=v1.0 ./bin/[platform]/[build_type]/ov_cpu_func_tests --gtest_filter="*smoke*Logical*LogicalOr*"
```

### Example Pull Requests

* [Abs](https://docs.openvino.ai/2025/documentation/openvino-ir-format/operation-sets/operation-specs/arithmetic/abs-1.html) operation: https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/pull/30218


### Resources

- [Contribution guide - start here!](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [What is OpenVINO?](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino#what-is-openvino-toolkit)
- [CPU plugin JIT emitters](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/plugins/intel_cpu/src/emitters/README.md)

issueDTO.title: 1 validation error for I18nObject en_US Input should be a valid string
issueDTO.description: ### Self Checks - [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general). - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (????????????????????? [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)). - [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] ??????????????????????????? Issue?????????????????????????????????:) - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### Dify version 1.6.0 ### Cloud or Self Hosted Self Hosted (Docker) ### Steps to reproduce ??When I updated to version 1.6.0 and clicked on the Tools page, this error appeared, and all tools became invisible. 1 validation error for I18nObject en_US Input should be a valid string [type=string_type, input_value=None, input_type=NoneType] For further information visit https://errors.pydantic.dev/2.11/v/string_type ### ?????? Expected Behavior ### ??? Actual Behavior _No response_
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This error happens because one or more tools have i18n fields (like label or description) where the `en_US` value is missing or set to `null` instead of a string. This breaks Pydantic validation and causes all tools to disappear from the Tools page.

To fix it, check your tool metadata (YAML files for built-in tools, or database entries for custom/API tools) and make sure every i18n object has a valid, non-null string for `en_US`???even an empty string is acceptable. After correcting any missing or null values, restart your backend.

Recent changes to i18n files in Dify 1.6.0 may have introduced this issue, so it's worth reviewing any recent updates to your tool definitions or translations as well??[cite](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/21459).

If you have a lot of tools, consider writing a quick script to scan for missing or null `en_US` fields in your tool configs before restarting. This should resolve the validation error and restore the Tools page.

issueDTO.title: Split the adapter config file to one file per participant
issueDTO.description:
For the OpenFOAM adapter we decided to have one adapter configuration file per participant, [as shown here](https://github.com/precice/tutorials/blob/master/CHT/heat_exchanger/buoyantSimpleFoam-CalculiX/Inner-Fluid/precice-adapter-config.yml). This was done so that we don't need to modify the solver to accept an extra command-line argument (we want to keep the solvers intact).

If there is no problem with the current setup, I propose that we also change the CalculiX adapter to look for one YAML file per participant, instead of accessing [a common file for all the participants](https://github.com/precice/tutorials/blob/master/CHT/heat_exchanger/buoyantSimpleFoam-CalculiX/config.yml). We already discussed this with @uekerman.

(as the links may break in the future, they refer to the `precice-adapter-config.yml` and `config.yml` of the heat exchanger tutorial for OpenFOAM and CalculiX)
comments:
So sth like this 

```yml
participant-name: Solid
interfaces:
- nodes-mesh: Solid-Mesh
  patch: surface
  read-data: [Force]
  write-data: [Displacement]

precice-config-file: ../precice-config.xml
```

Let's do this when releasing preCICE v3 as it breaks the tutorials.

issueDTO.title: Inconsistent lookup for read/write data in CHT and FSI
issueDTO.description:
For temperature and heat flux, we are checking whether the field name is exactly matched in the config:

https://github.com/precice/calculix-adapter/blob/4496e8f160ec121481653baf44ec032813409ac6/adapter/PreciceInterface.c#L624

For other fields, we are checking whether the field name just starts with this prefix (similar behavior as in the OpenFOAM adapter), sometimes with a trailing `-`, sometimes without:

https://github.com/precice/calculix-adapter/blob/4496e8f160ec121481653baf44ec032813409ac6/adapter/PreciceInterface.c#L37

https://github.com/precice/calculix-adapter/blob/4496e8f160ec121481653baf44ec032813409ac6/adapter/PreciceInterface.c#L654

Additionally, data names are hard-coded for preCICE:

https://github.com/precice/calculix-adapter/blob/4496e8f160ec121481653baf44ec032813409ac6/adapter/PreciceInterface.c#L628

Finally, this error message is rather confusing:

https://github.com/precice/calculix-adapter/blob/4496e8f160ec121481653baf44ec032813409ac6/adapter/PreciceInterface.c#L662

"Does not exist" made me think that I still needed to specify it somewhere. However, it just means that the adapter does not know how to handle it.

issueDTO.title: Instant meeting outside of dashboard?
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Please keep this note for other contributors -->

### How to use GitHub

* Please use the 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are interested into the same feature.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

---

## Feature request

Maybe this was already discussed during the dashboard design, but I couldn't find it.

With the new dashboard we have now "Start meeting", which allows us to create an "instant meeting", that is automatically deleted after 1 day by default. This option is _only_ available on the dashboard. So to start an instant meeting while in a conversation, one first has to drop to the dashboard to then create the meeting. (and understand, that the option is only there)

I think we should consider adding this option to the "add" menu as well, so it is reachable even outside the dashboard.

issueDTO.title: Feature request: Multiline commands
issueDTO.description:
As I understand it now, one must open the gnome extensions windows and disable/re-enable run-or-raise in order to load changes in the config file. Maybe there is already a better way which I missed? Otherwise I have some ideas to make this more comfortable:

1. Watch the file and reload config changes automatically
2. Offer a shortcut to reload the config file. Having this in the default config file would be very handy and make it easy to customize and adopt.

Now I'm wondering if (2) could be implemented with a line of bash... I believe there are commands to disable/enable a specific extension.
comments:
This actually worked like a charm, I also added a command to open the config file, at least with gedit as default editor it works great 🥳  (Gedit shows no reaction if the file is already open so it can just be integrated in one shortcut.)

Workflow becomes quite nice: Just press the shortcut once to quickly open the file, edit, save, press shortcut again to reload. Iterate or just close the editor when done.

```
<Super>r,bash -c "xdg-open ~/.config/run-or-raise/shortcuts.conf && gnome-extensions disable run-or-raise@edvard.cz && gnome-extensions enable run-or-raise@edvard.cz"
```

Now I've got another feature request in mind to allow multiline commands 😆 

This currently does *not* work:
```
<Super>r,bash -c "xdg-open ~/.config/run-or-raise/shortcuts.conf && \
    gnome-extensions disable run-or-raise@edvard.cz && \
    gnome-extensions enable run-or-raise@edvard.cz"
```

For doing this, one has to change the `extension.js / parseLine call` and `action.js / parseLine`. It is not a cubersome task, however, I won't implement it in the moment. (Unless more users express an interest.) Leaving open for the case anyone wanted to implement it.

This alias caused the triage script to throw an error:

Should we:

# :wave: Important: PLEASE READ :wave:

This issue has been labeled as a **good first issue** and is available for anyone to work on.

If this is your first time contributing to an open source project, some aspects of the development process may seem unusual, arcane, or some combination of both.

1.  **You cannot "claim" issues.** People new to open source often want to "claim" or be assigned an issue before beginning work. The typical rationale is that people want to avoid wasted work in the event that someone else ends up working the issue. However, this practice is not effective in open source, as it often leads to "issue squatting", in which an individual asks to be assigned, is granted their request, and then never ends up working on the issue. Accordingly, you are encouraged to communicate your intent to address this issue, ideally by providing a rough outline as to how you plan to address the issue or asking clarifying questions, but, at the end of the day, we will take running code and rough consensus in order to move forward quickly.
2.  **We have a very high bar for contributions.** We have very high standards for contributions and expect all contributions???whether new features, tests, or documentation???to be rigorous, thorough, and complete. Once a pull request is merged into stdlib, that contribution immediately becomes the collective responsibility of all maintainers of stdlib. When we merge code into stdlib, we are saying that we, the maintainers, commit to reviewing subsequent changes and making bugfixes to the code. Hence, in order to ensure future maintainability, this naturally leads to a higher standard of contribution.

Before working on this issue and opening a pull request, please read the project's [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md). To reiterate, we **strongly** encourage you to refer to our contributing guides **before** beginning work on this issue. Failure to follow our guidelines significantly decreases the likelihood that you'll successfully contribute to stdlib and may result in automatic closure of a pull request without review.

Setting up your local development environment is a critical first step, as doing so ensures that automated development processes for linting, license verification, and unit testing can run prior to authoring commits and pushing changes. If you would prefer to avoid manual setup, we provide pre-configured [development containers](https://github.com/stdlib-js/stdlib/tree/develop/.devcontainer) for use locally or in GitHub Codespaces.

We place a high value on consistency throughout the stdlib codebase. We encourage you to closely examine other packages in stdlib and attempt to emulate the practices and conventions found therein.

-   If you are attempting to contribute a new package, sometimes the best approach is to simply copy the contents of an existing package and then modify the minimum amount necessary to implement the feature (e.g., changing descriptions, parameter names, and implementation).
-   If you are contributing tests, find a package implementing a similar feature and emulate the tests of that package.
-   If you are updating documentation, examine several similar packages and emulate the content, style, and prose of those packages.

In short, the more effort you put in to ensure that your contribution looks and feels like stdlib???including variables names, bracket spacing, line breaks, etc???the more likely that your contribution will be reviewed and ultimately accepted. We encourage you to closely study the codebase **before** beginning work on this issue.

issueDTO.title: SSL fails in web interface since v1.15.1
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Starting with Meilisearch v1.15.1, the web interface becomes inaccessible via HTTPS when using locally-issued certificates (mkcert). The SSL connection fails with different error messages across browsers, suggesting a regression in SSL certificate handling.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install mkcert and generate local SSL certificates:
   ```bash
   mkcert -install
   mkcert localhost 127.0.0.1
   ```
2. Start Meilisearch v1.15.1 with SSL configuration:
   ```bash
   meilisearch --ssl-cert-path localhost+1.pem --ssl-key-path localhost+1-key.pem
   ```
3. Open browser and navigate to `https://localhost:8443/`
4. See connection error

**Expected behavior**
The Meilisearch web interface should load successfully over HTTPS, as it did in previous versions (v1.15.0 and earlier).

**Screenshots**
Error messages observed:

**Chrome:**
```
This site can't be reached
The webpage at https://localhost:8443/ might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address.
ERR_FAILED
```

**Firefox:**
```
An error occurred during a connection to localhost:8443. The response from the OCSP server was corrupted or improperly formed.
Error code: SEC_ERROR_OCSP_MALFORMED_RESPONSE
```

**Meilisearch version:**
v1.15.1

**Additional context**
- **Architecture:** x86_64
- **OS:** Linux Mint 22.1
- **Browsers:** Chrome, Firefox
- **Certificate type:** mkcert-generated local development certificates
- **Working versions:** v1.15.0 and earlier
- **Suspected cause:** This issue appears to be related to PR #5471 "Support EC private key as SSL certificate" which modified SSL certificate handling logic in v1.15.1

The problem specifically affects locally-generated certificates (mkcert) and may be related to changes in how different certificate types (RSA vs EC) are processed. The OCSP-related error in Firefox suggests the new SSL implementation may have issues with certificate validation or OCSP handling for development certificates.

**Workaround:** Downgrading to Meilisearch v1.15.0 resolves the issue temporarily.

Minimal repro:

```python
class A:
    a: int = 3

class B(A): pass
super(B, B()).a = 3
```

issueDTO.title: Allow to make global variables unwritable
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Some architectures have zero registers. They always hold the value zero and if they are written too don't change.
The only way to represent this in our uplifted archs is by checking for them and generating different RzIL.

These extra paths in an IL op take a lot of allocations and will be rarely used.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Being able to define a callback in `RzAnalysisILConfig` to check for global variable names which are immutable would be nice. As long as the checks are constant time it shouldn't matter.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Adding extra checks in the uplifting, as described above.

**Additional context**

none
