Hi @pierDipi and KServe maintainers,

I???m interested in contributing to this issue to address the controller panic in the InferenceService reconciler when autoscalerClass is not set to keda with external autoscaling configurations. I see that @orfeas-k is assigned and has started investigating, and I???d like to offer support to help resolve this issue.

To ensure I can contribute effectively, could you clarify:

1. Would it be helpful for me to reproduce the panic using the provided YAML and test @orfeas-k???s potential fix, focusing on validating the new error message?
2. Should I propose a test case in the KServe test suite (e.g., under test/) to ensure the controller rejects invalid configurations with a clear, actionable error?
3. Are there preferred validation patterns or error message formats for the fix in hpa_reconciler.go?
4. How can I best coordinate with @orfeas-k to assist with implementation or testing without overlapping efforts?

I???ve set up a KServe development environment with Kubernetes and am prepared to reproduce the issue, test proposed fixes, or contribute validation logic. Any guidance on next steps or specific areas where I can add value would be appreciated. Thank you for supporting contributions to KServe!

#### Minimal reproduction of error
I reproduced using the [KEDA example](https://kserve.github.io/website/latest/modelserving/autoscaling/keda/autoscaling_keda/#create-inferenceservice) but
1. removed `serving.kserve.io/autoscalerClass`
2. replaced the `metrics` field with one similar to this example
	```
      metrics:
        - type: External
          external:
            metric:
              backend: "prometheus"
            target:
              type: Value
              value: "2"
	```

#### Why it's happening
My understanding is:
1. There is no `serving.kserve.io/autoscalerClass` annotation set, thus it assumes the default one in
	https://github.com/kserve/kserve/blob/47f30145d2edfedb288224e8f0235877f695f44d/pkg/controller/v1beta1/inferenceservice/reconcilers/autoscaler/autoscaler_reconciler.go#L75-L83, which is HPA
	https://github.com/kserve/kserve/blob/47f30145d2edfedb288224e8f0235877f695f44d/pkg/constants/constants.go#L185-L191
2. It runs the HPAReconciler
	https://github.com/kserve/kserve/blob/47f30145d2edfedb288224e8f0235877f695f44d/pkg/controller/v1beta1/inferenceservice/reconcilers/autoscaler/autoscaler_reconciler.go#L91

Given that (but please confirm) using HPA as the default `autoscalerClass` is expected, the failure comes from the fact that getHPAMetrics tries to iterate the `metric.Resource.Name` but there is no such field.

https://github.com/kserve/kserve/blob/d20d4228a8b2956b800ad5a3e62c0578b5a5b97f/pkg/controller/v1beta1/inferenceservice/reconcilers/hpa/hpa_reconciler.go#L62


Thus, does the validation mentioned above refers to validating the `metrics` during HPA creation and more specifically during getHPAmetrics? If so, what should we validate it against? Which are the expected fields for `autoscalerClassHPA`? I noticed that the HPA reconciler also runs for `external` autoscalerClass
https://github.com/kserve/kserve/blob/d20d4228a8b2956b800ad5a3e62c0578b5a5b97f/pkg/controller/v1beta1/inferenceservice/reconcilers/autoscaler/autoscaler_reconciler.go#L93-L95. My current guess is that we 'd need to only confirm there is a `metric.Resource.Name`.
cc @pierDipi

Hi @shhubhxm, I just got back to this bug. I think this is a pretty trivial bug (if my understanding from above is correct) and thus fixing and writing a test won't be too involved. It will be a bit hard to collaborate on that. From my point of view, you could definitely test the provided fix and confirm that this works and probably also give my PR a review.

issueDTO.title: [v2][Enhancement] Improve project and code documentation using LLMs
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
LLMs like ChatGPT can help make our project documentation easier to understand and fill any missing gaps.
- Currently the project documentation is present in the project [wiki](https://github.com/Udayraj123/OMRChecker/wiki). 
- Also the code comments are scarce except for the variable naming and the descriptions present json schemas that give some context.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We should leverage code understanding capabilities of the LLMs to greatly improve documentation. We can  -
- Improve the existing User Guides in the Project wiki
- Incrementally add explanatory code comments which can be read by docs generators later
    - Looking for a good prompt that does this job well

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Developers have to refer to the provided samples to learn how to use each of the flags present in our template/evaluation schemas

- Websites like deepwiki provide AI generated documentation(cool stuff) - https://deepwiki.com/Udayraj123/OMRChecker
- Similarly there's gitdiagram, checkout more [here](https://forgithub.com/)

**Additional context**
We are also planning to move it into a dedicated docs/pages folder in future. Also exploring using docs generators like Docusaurus for more elaborate project and code documentation.

> Need help with extensively documenting the usage of template schema in dev branch which introduces a few more Pre Processors - I have already added a basic readme in each of the folders in `samples/experimental` but need someone to refine those for a wider audience.
> Another help is needed in giving more examples of cases where thresholding configuration is needed for OMRChecker to work with high accuracy.

You can use this as a reference for a starting point too -
https://deepwiki.com/Udayraj123/OMRChecker
Note: please share your queries and approaches on discord for quicker discussions:
- Link to the [Discord invite](https://discord.gg/qFv2Vqf)
- Link to the [Hacktoberfest 2024 channel](https://discord.com/channels/590134763784896514/1284801897714155613/1284802010549321770)

issueDTO.title: Document: Deferred Insert
issueDTO.description:
1. `save_to_db` only dumps a maximum of 500 records per queue into the Database hourly. 

Restricting to 500 (arbitrary & very low number) leads to starvation when you're pushing records in higher volumes. We could easily just let the job flush as many records as it can instead?

2. Document creation is reset

Since `doc.insert` is used within the deferred_insert API, the creation time is reset during DB insert. Essentially we end up re-writing the original information.
comments:
2 - I fixed it and didn't PR 💀 

There's flag in doc.insert to prevent overriding creation and owner.

Also let's reduce frequency of flushing, 1 hour seems too much, a signle frappe.clear_cache can clear it. 

Perhaps we need clear separation and connection to 2nd redis service (redis queue one) for ensuring persistence. Using frappe.cache is a bad idea for a lot of code that we have.

I'd like to take a look at this if a PR isn't already merged. I am beginning to check out frappe and from what I could dig out, `save_to_db` is triggered during site migrations. Is there any other time this happens? Is migration a periodic thing here and where could I read/find more about this in the docs?

For __point. 1__, What I understand from the issue is record_count limit is not required here:
```python3

def save_to_db():
	queue_keys = frappe.cache.get_keys(queue_prefix)
	for key in queue_keys:
		...
		while frappe.cache.llen(queue_key) > 0 and record_count <= 500:
```

>  leads to starvation when you're pushing records in higher volumes. We could easily just let the job flush as many records as it can instead?

In this case, all records could be bulk retrieved:

```python3
cache_size = frappe.cache.llen(key) 
pipe  = frappe.cache.pipeline()
pipe.range(key, 0, cache_size - 1)
pipe.ltrim(key, cache_size, -1)
records, success? = pipe.execute()
```

I am not sure why this is designed this way since to no effect, `insert_record(record, doctype)` should work regardless:
```python3

			if isinstance(records, dict):
				record_count += 1
				insert_record(records, doctype)
				continue
			for record in records:
				record_count += 1
				insert_record(record, doctype)
```

in which case my proposal is something along these lines. chime into remark:
```python3

def get_cached_records_from_key(key) -> List["Documents" | dict] | None:
     cache_size = frappe.cache.llen(key) 
     pipe  = frappe.cache.pipeline()
     pipe.range(key, 0, cache_size - 1)
     pipe.ltrim(key, cache_size, -1)
     records, success? = pipe.execute()
     if success?:
        return records
     # do something else

def save_to_db():
	queue_keys = frappe.cache.get_keys(queue_prefix)
	for key in queue_keys:
		record_count = 0
		queue_key = get_key_name(key)
		doctype = get_doctype_name(key)
                if records := get_cached_records_from_key(key):
                    insert_many_records(records, doctype)

def insert_many_records(records, doctype) -> None:
    for record in records:
        record.update(dict(doctype=doctype))
    # not sure why frappe.get_docs is executed first. For bulk, I'm assuming it is:
    frappe.get_list(doctype, filters=<some_filters>).insert_many(records)
```


> Perhaps we need clear separation and connection to 2nd redis service (redis queue one) for ensuring persistence. Using frappe.cache is a bad idea for a lot of code that we have.

However, I cannot associate the context here with the issue.


To summarize:
- Some context on migration periodic runs would be helpful.
- Can we get multiple doctype records in a list and then insert in bulk as proposed above?
- Out of scope, but still something to reflect late on: In the above operation, Is `save_to_db` a blocking call and when does it happen? If so, could this be decoupled and made non blocking?

Let me know what do you think.

> Some context on migration periodic runs would be help

I've updated a PR for this.
I'd like to: 
1. know when is this feature triggered 
2. Understand proper setup needed to test this feature?
Hi, I???d like to work on this. Please assign it to me

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to improve the Deferred Insert feature in frappe by removing the record count limit and allowing the job to flush as many records as it can, and to make the save_to_db function non-blocking.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to improve the Deferred Insert feature by removing the record count limit and allowing the job to flush as many records as it can. Additionally, it's suggested to use a single frappe.clear_cache instead of hourly and to reduce the frequency of flushing.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue has been fixed by updating a PR. The fix involves using a pipeline to retrieve records from the cache and inserting them in bulk. The author has also suggested decoupling the save_to_db function and making it non-blocking.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about improving the Deferred Insert feature in frappe. The current implementation has a record count limit of 500, which can lead to starvation when dealing with high volumes of records. The proposal is to let the job flush as many records as it can instead of limiting it to 500. Additionally, there's a flag in doc.insert to prevent overriding creation and owner, and it's suggested to reduce the frequency of flushing and use a single frappe.clear_cache instead of hourly.

issueDTO.title: Support vendor defined error codes
issueDTO.description:
> Vendor defined error codes are still not handled nicely. As a vendor, you probably do something like this:
> 
> ```c
> #define CKR_MY_ERROR_A (CKR_VENDOR_DEFINED+1)
> #define CKR_MY_ERROR_B (CKR_VENDOR_DEFINED+2)
> #define CKR_MY_ERROR_C (CKR_VENDOR_DEFINED+3)
> ```
> 
> In cryptoki 0.10.0, these [will be mapped](https://github.com/parallaxsecond/rust-cryptoki/blob/cryptoki-0.10.0/cryptoki/src/error/rv.rs#L120) to RvError::GeneralError. Therefore, as a cryptoki user I cannot distinguish between the vendor-defined errors.
> 
> From [Section 3.6 of the standard v3.1](https://docs.oasis-open.org/pkcs11/pkcs11-spec/v3.1/os/pkcs11-spec-v3.1-os.html#_Toc111203196):
> 
> Return values CKR_VENDOR_DEFINED and above are permanently reserved for token vendors.
> 
> So it should be safe to map these to something like `RvError::VendorDefined(code)`. 

 _Originally posted by @thgoebel in [#54](https://github.com/parallaxsecond/rust-cryptoki/issues/54#issuecomment-3083797101)_

A similar approach than #246 should probably be acceptable there!

repository.description: Rust wrapper for the PKCS #11 API, Cryptoki

summary.validationOrRequirement: Return values CKR_VENDOR_DEFINED and above are permanently reserved for token vendors, as per Section 3.6 of the standard v3.1.

issueDTO.title: GKEStartJobOperator impersonation chain not working with Kubernetes RBAC
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow version

Other Airflow 2 version (please specify below)

### If "Other Airflow 2 version" selected, which one?

2.10.5

### What happened?

I am trying to run the GKEStartJobOperator using impersonation chain from airflow. I have setup RBAC in the gke cluster to give that iam account permissions using the method shown here https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/role-based-access-control#rolebinding. However, when running GKEStartJobOperator it seems to call the GKE cluster with the unqiue id of the service account in the impersonation chain rather than the email. This causes the RBAC to fail as it cant match the User. It works if i put the unqiue id directly as a user subject.

### What you think should happen instead?

The follow error happens `User \???<unique_id>\??? cannot create resource \"jobs\" in API group \"batch\" in the namespace \"airflow-jobs\": requires one of [\"container.jobs.create\"] permission(s).` I expected it to use the email in the impersonation chain rather than the unique id.

### How to reproduce

1. set up rbac as follows
```
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: Role
metadata:
  namespace: airflow-jobs
  name: job-creator
rules:
  - apiGroups: [ "batch" ]
    resources: [ "jobs", ]
    verbs: [ "create" , "list", "get", "update", "patch", "delete"]
  - apiGroups: [ "batch" ]
    resources: [ "jobs/status" ]
    verbs: [ "get" ]
  - apiGroups: [ "" ]
    resources: [ "pods" ]
    verbs: [ "list", "get"]
---
kind: RoleBinding
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
metadata:
  name: job-creator-binding
  namespace: airflow-jobs
subjects:
  - kind: User
    name: <iam-service-account>
    namespace: airflow-jobs
roleRef:
  kind: Role
  name: job-creator
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
```
2.  create a dag with operator configure with impersonation chain
```
job_task = GKEStartJobOperator(
        task_id="job_task",
        project_id=???<project-id>,
        location="europe-west1",
        cluster_name=???<gke-cluster-name>???,
        namespace="airflow-jobs",
        image="perl:5.34.0",
        cmds=["perl", "-Mbignum=bpi", "-wle", "print bpi(2000)"],
        name="test-job",
        ttl_seconds_after_finished=60,
        wait_until_job_complete=True,
        deferrable=True,
        impersonation_chain=???<iam service account>???,
    )
```

### Operating System

linux

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

apache-airflow==2.10.5+composer
apache-airflow-providers-apache-beam==6.0.4
apache-airflow-providers-celery==3.10.0
apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes==10.1.0
apache-airflow-providers-common-compat==1.6.0
apache-airflow-providers-common-io==1.5.4
apache-airflow-providers-common-sql==1.26.0
apache-airflow-providers-dbt-cloud==4.3.3
apache-airflow-providers-fab==1.5.3
apache-airflow-providers-ftp==3.12.3
apache-airflow-providers-google==15.1.0
apache-airflow-providers-hashicorp==4.1.1
apache-airflow-providers-http==5.2.2
apache-airflow-providers-imap==3.8.3
apache-airflow-providers-mysql==6.2.2
apache-airflow-providers-openlineage==2.2.0
apache-airflow-providers-postgres==6.1.3
apache-airflow-providers-redis==4.0.2
apache-airflow-providers-sendgrid==4.0.1
apache-airflow-providers-smtp==2.0.3
apache-airflow-providers-sqlite==4.0.2
apache-airflow-providers-ssh==4.0.1
apache-airflow-providers-standard==1.0.0

### Deployment

Google Cloud Composer

### Deployment details

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

issueDTO.title: docs:  Identify and clean up references to broken or unmaintained plugins
issueDTO.description:
There are currently several plugins referenced in the documentation and ecosystem that appear to be outdated, unmaintained, or no longer functional. This makes it harder for users to find reliable tools and contributes to confusion about what's actively supported.

## Objective

We should audit the list of known plugins (in the docs) and identify:

- Plugins that are broken or no longer work with current Beets versions
- Plugins that are no longer maintained (e.g., stale repos, no recent commits/issues)
- Any links in the docs or plugin lists that are dead or outdated
- The sidebar of the plugins in the docs is way to long! We should put them into the same categories as in the main page.

This issue was prompted by #5779  noting that some plugins, while historically useful (like `beets-copyartifacts`), may no longer be actively supported or even working with the current beets version.
comments: We should also probably do something about dead internal plugins, for example `beatport` 😅

To kick this of a bit and get us going I created a list of all the plugins that are currently in the beets docs. **Feel free to edit this comment** and add notes on the plugins. You can also reply and I will update this comment.

issueDTO.title: Autogenerate code example / tutorial outputs in documentation
issueDTO.description:
It would be nice to have an automated way of doing the following:
- Generates output of code examples and includes it in the docs
- Error or warn if any of the code examples don't run (or crash) so it's easy to identify what to fix

Something like [nbsphinx](https://nbsphinx.readthedocs.io/en/0.3.2/) does both of the above.
comments: If we generate the code examples, let's make sure the generated code is checked in, otherwise we won't realize when we change something.

I also looked into this. It is quite hard to do so for docs as we don't really have a unified formatting for example code in docs. (@soumith agrees on this I think).

For tutorials, I remember that @soumith mentioned they are already autogenerated.

It shouldn't be too hard to unify the formatting for example code in docs. I think we only need to figure out when code gets printed -- are there other things that I'm not taking into account here?

ie if we get something like
```
>>> x = torch.randn(4, 4)
>>> x.size()
torch.Size([4, 4])
>>> y = x.view(16)
>>> y.size()
torch.Size([16])
>>> z = x.view(-1, 8)  # the size -1 is inferred from other dimensions
>>> z.size()
torch.Size([2, 8])
```
then the rule for printing things is "follow the python interpreter".

One thing that is wrong at times is
```
>>> if True:
...    cool_stuff()
```
Probably either using `...` (like python) or spaces (for copy-paste benefit) is better.
I have a regenerator that successfully checks most of the valid (ha! there are quite a few old "numel matches but the shapes are incompatible" examples that are invalid these days, e.g. `add`) torch docstrings.
I would be very happy to contribute that. My suggestion would be to do this as a test that fails on a mismatch and an optional command "print fixes" or so that outputs the correct things.

I don't want to interfere with any one else cleaning up these things (@li-roy ?), but I'd be happy to have a go at fixing all the docs.

So I put a prototype regenerator/tester for torch/_torch_docs.py that could be a base for [test/test_docs.py](https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/blob/docstring_regeneration/test/test_docs.py).
It has two modes, one testing torch docstrings (but not with exitcodes yet) and one where it outputs a new torch/_torch_docs.py to stdout.
It uses astor and autopep8 as dependencies and probably runs best on python3.
The would be generated documentation is at [torch/_torch_docs.py](https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/blob/docstring_regeneration/torch/_torch_docs.py).
Can I take this up?
I will try my hand at it. Can I be assigned, this issue?
You just go ahead, but it'd be neat if you report back if you get stuck or anything.
Okay :)
Hi @t-vi @Jaisu-1 @zou3519 @gchanan @SsnL - is anyone working on this issue anymore ? Could I pick this up ?

issueDTO.title: Lazy discovering of available package managers
issueDTO.description:
In `tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py`: `_query_package_manager` and `_query_bootc_builder`.
I believe tmt can safely reorder the function calls to first sort package managers by their priority and then query their presence, stopping at first success.
This minor optimization is related to provisioning using virtualized environment, where package installation is handled differently, e.g. `mock`.
comments:
@mkoncek, in general sounds good, but more context would help a bit here. Just to clarify, isn't this already covered by the `probe_priority`?

https://github.com/teemtee/tmt/blob/32ca248bd0e14ef8b9fe00f3d0235dfc3c0c2e2e/tmt/package_managers/__init__.py#L226-L231

Ah, I guess now I see what you thought:

https://github.com/teemtee/tmt/blob/32ca248bd0e14ef8b9fe00f3d0235dfc3c0c2e2e/tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py#L589-L606

So you suggest not to discover all available plugins first, then sort and the pick the first one but just iterate through already sorted plugins and break after the first one is detected, right?

Sounds ok to me. @happz any concerns here?

> Sounds ok to me. [@happz](https://github.com/happz) any concerns here?

Only a minor one: it???s such an obvious optimization that I wonder why haven???t we done it from the beginning. But I think it???s because it was all added gradually, and through several iterations that we never realized the opportunity exists. So it???s probably no dark, undocumented magic.

My proof-of-concept provisioning works with the current code. I was afraid of the `execute` steps taking too long but I found a way around it.
So there is no pressure from me to implement this change, it is just something I thought could improve the performance.

issueDTO.title: Rename Evidences to Evidence
issueDTO.description: Singular and plural of evidence are the same.
comments:
Do we want to change Evidences to Evidence? If yes, we have to think about AssessEvidence() vs. AssessEvidences(). We could use one of the following: 
- AssessAllEvidences()
- AssessMultipleEvidences()
- AssessEvidenceStream()
- ...

Rename to AssessAllEvidence() for grammatical correctness.

issueDTO.title: Add enum for available operator values
issueDTO.description:
I just had the thought that we could use an enum for the available operator values. What do you think?

_Originally posted by @anatheka in https://github.com/clouditor/clouditor/pull/1695#discussion_r2071553478_
comments:
Although Operator could technically be modeled as a custom type (e.g., type Operator string), converting it into a full enum would require changes to GetOperator() and potentially other parts of the codebase. Additionally, you'd still need to use explicit conversions like string(OperatorEqual) in several places to satisfy existing interfaces or Protobuf-generated code, which reduces the benefit of added type safety. Overall, the gain in code clarity or efficiency would be minimal. A possible (but not significantly better) implementation could look like : ( in metrics_test.go after Line 55) 
 
type Operator string

const (
    OperatorEqual        Operator = "=="
    OperatorNotEqual     Operator = "!="
    OperatorGreaterThan  Operator = ">"
    OperatorLessThan     Operator = "<"
    OperatorGreaterEqual Operator = ">="
    OperatorLessEqual    Operator = "<="
)
then an example for the string conversion would be like : 
 
 var (
	ErrSomeError = errors.New("some error")
	// We need to define the following vars here because we could get import cycle errors in ./internal/testdata/testdata.go
	MockMetricConfiguration1 = &assessment.MetricConfiguration{
		MetricId:             testdata.MockMetricID1,
		TargetOfEvaluationId: testdata.MockTargetOfEvaluationID1,
		Operator:             string(OperatorEqual), // instead of Operator:    "=="
		TargetValue:          testdata.MockMetricConfigurationTargetValueString,
	}
Thanks @ezzeddinemtar, maybe then it is better to leave it as it is. What do you think @anatheka ?

repository.description: The Clouditor is a tool to support continuous cloud assurance. Developed by Fraunhofer AISEC.
repository.name: clouditor

summary.main: discussing the idea of using an enum for the available operator values
summary.validationOrRequirement: minimal gain in code clarity or efficiency, explicit conversions like string(OperatorEqual) in several places
summary.attemptedFixes: implementation could look like: type Operator string, explicit conversions like string(OperatorEqual) in several places
summary.otherNotes: enum for available operator values, existing interfaces or Protobuf-generated code, code clarity or efficiency would be minimal, possible implementation in metrics_test.go after Line 55

issueDTO.title: Command distribution retry interval needs to be configurable
issueDTO.description:
Command distribution is automatically retried in case it is not acknowledged in time. The interval between retries uses exponential backoff with hardcoded values. This makes incident response in cases where retry is looping very tricky because there's no way to disable the retry or make it at least slower.

`CommandRedistributor` should not use hardcoded values for `COMMAND_REDISTRIBUTION_INTERVAL` and `RETRY_MAX_BACKOFF_DURATION`. It should be configurable.

This came up in https://app.incident.io/camunda/incidents/2032.
comments: I thinking to bring this to @camunda/core-features-alpha mob-programming session. It is still useful to have configurable retry interval and backoff along with pausing the distribution. E.g. fine tuning re-distribution, allowing engine to slowly make progress without completely stopping the re-distribution or prevent immediate overload after resuming the re-distribution.

Considering [unified configuration](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OX60Ee0KDw4G9SpJdVMhSblYDojY3hHpS1uegDqM9MA/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.55u2rdkf6e8g), what would be a good configuration naming for this?

Something like this?
```yaml
camunda:
  processing:
    command-distribution:
      retry-interval: 10s # default
```

repository.description: Process Orchestration Framework
repository.name: camunda

summary.main: Command distribution retry interval needs to be configurable, with exponential backoff and pausing the distribution, to make incident response easier and allow for fine tuning re-distribution, allowing engine to slowly make progress without completely stopping the re-distribution or prevent immediate overload after resuming the re-distribution.
summary.validationOrRequirement: CommandRedistributor should not use hardcoded values for COMMAND_REDISTRIBUTION_INTERVAL and RETRY_MAX_BACKOFF_DURATION. It should be configurable.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned
summary.otherNotes: This came up in https://app.incident.io/camunda/incidents/2032, considering unified configuration, what would be a good configuration naming for this?

issueDTO.title: Update Note on Request Destination / CSP directive
issueDTO.description: https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-request-destination shows the CSP directive for a specific destination. I think that list needs to be updated to Content Security Policy Level 3. For example the destination `"script"` should now be `"script-src-elem"`. (ref https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-csp/#effective-directive-for-a-request)

Hi! 👋
Thanks for highlighting this ??? updating the Fetch spec???s destination mapping to align with CSP Level 3 makes perfect sense. The distinction between script-src and script-src-elem (and similar updates for style, img, etc.) is important for accuracy and consistency with modern browser behavior.

I???ve reviewed the referenced PR and would be happy to help test, review, or iterate on the changes if needed. Looking forward to supporting improvements to spec clarity and security guidance!

??? Bhumit Mittal

issueDTO.title: [MCP] Smoove
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview

Smoove is a marketing automation platform offering email/SMS marketing, landing pages, popups, and automation workflows.  
This integration enables AI agents and workflows to trigger on user events, manage subscribers and lists, and synchronize contact data automatically.

---

## ?????? Important Note for Contributors

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.


**Contributors based in India: please check your eligibility for receiving payments through your Stripe account before submitting, as this may affect your ability to get paid.**

---

## 🚨 Triggers

| **Trigger**                 | **Use Case** |
|-----------------------------|--------------|
| **New Form Created**        | Fires when a new form is created in the account. |
| **New Lead Submitted**      | Fires when a lead submits via form/popup/mobile campaign. |
| **New Subscriber**          | Fires when a new subscriber is added. |
| **New List Created**        | Fires when a new mailing list is created. |

---

## 🛠??? Write Actions

| **Action Item**                    | **Use Case** |
|-----------------------------------|--------------|
| **Create a List**                 | Create a new mailing list with settings and descriptions. |
| **Unsubscribe Subscriber**        | Move a contact to the "Unsubscribed" list. |
| **Add or Update Subscriber**      | Create or update subscriber data, and subscribe/unsubscribe from lists. |

---

## 🔍 Search Actions

| **Action Item**           | **Use Case** |
|---------------------------|--------------|
| **Find Subscriber**       | Search for a subscriber by unique identifiers (ID, email, phone, external ID). |

---

## 📚 API Reference

- [Smoove API Documentation](https://rest.smoove.io/#!/Account/Account_Get)

---

You can test Smoove APIs by creating a free account at [Smoove](https://www.smoove.io/) and generating API Keys under Settings ??? API Keys.

Activepieces is the open-source AI automation platform.  
Pieces are authored in TypeScript and, once merged, become available in both the visual builder and as MCPs.

issueDTO.title: [UI] Migrate Playwright models spec to use Playwright Page Object Model
issueDTO.description:
### Current Behavior
We are currently maintaining Playwright E2E tests with inline selectors and interactions. This results in test files that are tightly coupled to UI details. This issue will cover adding one page for the models spec test. https://github.com/meshery/meshery/blob/master/ui/tests/e2e/models.spec.js


### Desired Behavior
Refactor Playwright test suites to follow the Page Object Model (POM) design pattern. https://playwright.dev/docs/pom

### Implementation
Introduce a pages/ directory inside the Playwright test suite ( ./tests/pages/ ). The class should encapsulate locators and expose functions with relevant page interactions.

---

### Contributor [Guides](https://docs.meshery.io/project/contributing) and [Handbook](https://meshery.io/community#handbook)

- 🎨 Wireframes and [designs for Meshery UI](https://www.figma.com/file/SMP3zxOjZztdOLtgN4dS2W/Meshery-UI) in Figma [(open invite)](https://www.figma.com/team_invite/redeem/qJy1c95qirjgWQODApilR9)
- 🖥 [Contributing to Meshery UI](https://docs.meshery.io/project/contributing/contributing-ui)
- 🙋🏾🙋🏼 Questions: [Discussion Forum](https://meshery.io/community#community-forums) and [Community Slack](https://slack.meshery.io)

issueDTO.title: [Bug] Reenable Broken link found (404 response).
issueDTO.description:
# 🐞 Bug report

<!-- ?????? Describe the bug, including expected outcomes and actual results. -->

## Details

<!-- ?????? Please include any information that may help us repro your issue, such as `webhint` version number, OS, content of your `.hintrc` file, and the raw output generated by `webhint`. -->

Some unknown recent update seem to have broke a single test in `hint-no-broken-links` package and this is causing the PR CI pipeline  to fail. With the spirit of keeping the main branch green and stable I disabled the test and this bug should be used to track the work required to reenable it. Link to PR : https://github.com/webhintio/hint/pull/5753
```
{
        name: `This test should fail as it has an img with 404 src value(absolute)`,
        reports: [{
            message: `Broken link found (404 response).`,
            severity: Severity.error
        }],
        serverConfig: generateHTMLPage('', bodyWithBrokenImageSource),
        skip: true // temporary disabling to investigate
    },
```
comments: Hey @vidorteg  I would like to work on this issue? Can you assign this to me? Thanks!

Hi! 👋
Thanks for documenting the root cause and temporary skip for the failing test. I???ve reviewed the related PR and it seems like the test can now be safely re-enabled after accounting for recent updates in how 404s and rel="nofollow" are handled.

If helpful, I???d be happy to test the fix locally and submit a patch to re-enable the test and confirm it???s passing with updated behavior. Please let me know if this is still open for contribution!

??? Bhumit Mittal

issueDTO.title: Tab in the last text field in a tab should focus the next tab in the tabs of the entry editor.
issueDTO.description:
Follow up to https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/11886

Refs https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/11785
comments: Hi - I would like to be assigned to this issue please. Thank you!

### Guidance on Completing Issue

Hello,

I am currently working on this issue with @juliusalberto  and I'm a bit stuck. Specifically, I need help with the following:

1. **Finding where JabRef handles tab key events**:
   - I am not sure which part of the codebase is responsible for handling the tab key navigation within the Entry Editor. Could you provide guidance on where I should look for the relevant logic? (e.g., which file or class deals with tab key handling or keyboard navigation?)
   
2. **Implementing the tab key behavior**:
   - Once I locate the correct file, where would it be best to add the logic that moves focus to the next tab when pressing `Tab` in the last field of a tab? Should this be handled as part of an existing focus traversal policy, or would I need to implement a custom listener?

Any pointers or advice on these two points would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you for your help.
We do not know. Create a minimal JavaFX application with two tabs and check how it works there. Then port this knowledge to JabRef.

### JavaFX Key Handling and Focus Issue

Hello,

After exploring the codebase, I???ve learned how to check if a `TextField` in a `Tab` is the last one, and how to shift the focus to the next tab. However, I???ve encountered an issue with how JavaFX handles key events when a `TextField` is focused.

For example, if I create a listener for a `TextField` or even the `EntryEditor`, the listener won't execute while the `TextField` is in focus, as the `TextField` consumes the input before it reaches the listener/handler. This issue is currently evident with the `setupKeyBindings` function, which is intended to initialize shortcuts for navigating the entry editor. Only the "Ctrl + MINUS" key seems to work due to what I think is JavaFX handling key inputs before `setupKeyBindings` can.

I???ve tried using `addEventFilter` instead of `addEventHandler`, but the result is the same. I???ve also explored using JavaFX???s `tabIndex` and focus priority logic to control the order of focus between tabs and fields. So that pressing "tab" will cycle through all of the specified components in order. However, since the `Tab` class doesn???t have built-in `tabIndex` or `focusTraversal` properties, this has proven to be quite a challenge.

I???m unsure how to proceed or where I should be focusing my efforts. Any suggestions or guidance would be greatly appreciated thankyou.

> I???m unsure how to proceed or where I should be focusing my efforts. Any suggestions or guidance would be greatly appreciated thankyou.

1. Create a minimal JavaFX application showing the issue. Even smaller application than https://github.com/Siedlerchr/javafxreproducer.
2. Publish the JavaFX application in a repository on GitHub.
3. Ask question on [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/).
4. Post the link to the stackoverflow question here.

---

Your text did not include a link to `org.jabref.gui.fieldeditors.FieldEditorFX#establishBinding`. Did you see this method? 


```java
    if (keyBindingRepository.matches(e, {key-for-TAB})) {
```

We have no key binding configuration for tab-to-next field. Which is OK. Just hard-code TAB.

> Your text did not include a link to `org.jabref.gui.fieldeditors.FieldEditorFX#establishBinding`. Did you see this method?

Ah! Good to know. I implemented this feature by setting up a method in ` FieldEditorFX`  that moves the `TabPane` to the next tab if the user presses "Tab" while in the last `TextField` of the current tab. I created a method in `EntryEditor` that checks if the current `TextField` in focus is the last one by comparing its ID with the `Tab`'s  last `Field`'s name. Previously, each `TextField` didn???t have an ID set, so I updated this by setting each ID to the name of its original `Field`.

**Reasons for this approach:**
1. **EntryEditor context requirement:** We can't directly check if the current `Field` in focus is the last without `EntryEditor` context. Because of the way `TextFields` are created, we can???t directly locate the last `TextField` of a `Tab`, but we can easily identify the last `Field` in a tab. To bridge this gap, I assigned IDs to each `TextField` based on their original `Field` names, allowing for comparison.
2. **Adheres to Field creation policy:** This approach adapts to changes in the last `TextField` depending on the active `Tab`, as all `TextFields` are initially created as `Fields`. Because each `TextField` is linked to a corresponding `Field` (with its ID matching the field's name), and the last field in a tab can always be identified through the `shownFields` method, all `TextField`s can be checked as the last `TextField`.

**Alternative approach:** Another way to address this issue could be to modify the focus traversal list, so pressing "Tab" while a `TextField` is in focus cycles through the fields until reaching the last one, then moves to the next `Tab`. However, after spending a short while exploring this option it shows its challenges.

If you???re happy with this implementation, I can create a PR for you to review. Thank you!

Hello, 
I have created a PR [#12087](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/12087) for review. 
Thank you.
Hi! I would like to work on this issue. Can you please assign it to me? Thank you!

👋 Hey @AbhishekU19, looks like you???re eager to work on this issue???great! 🎉 It also looks like you skipped reading our [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md), which explains exactly how to participate. No worries, it happens to the best of us. Give it a read, and you???ll discover the ancient wisdom of assigning issues to yourself. Trust me, it???s worth it. 🚀

issueDTO.title: Migrate to use canonical TS parser for recipes
issueDTO.description:
# Idea ion one sentence

Currently it uses ad-hoc parser which is a bit outdated. Need to switch to updated (still work in progress https://github.com/cooklang/cooklang-ts/issues/31) Cooklang TS parser, so we can start fixing other issues.
comments: I was looking into this plugin a bit and saw this issue. I'm a little fuzzy on WASM, but will an Obsidian plugin be able to use it?
What exactly your concerns? Do you mean if it's allowed? I've seen some templates for Rust Obsidian plugins, f.e. https://github.com/rachtsingh/obsidian-rust-template. Seems like possible.

Yeah, like... I don't know exactly how wasm works, but it looks like it basically turns the Rust into a TS/JS that can be used? Either way if I can figure out what's supposed to be happening I might be able to help.

> Yeah, like... I don't know exactly how wasm works, but it looks like it basically turns the Rust into a TS/JS that can be used? Either way if I can figure out what's supposed to be happening I might be able to help.

Replied in the issue itself https://github.com/cooklang/cooklang-ts/issues/31

Okay, so just an idea _explicitly_ about this plugin. I'm looking at the current implementation, and I'm wondering if we can get away with fixing this _without_ waiting for an improvement to the TS parser. We just built that nifty [cooklang-reports](https://github.com/cooklang/cooklang-reports) PoC, and really, what this plugin seems to do is take a recipe as input and produce some structured output. Is it just me, or that a job for `cooklang-reports`?

That would obviate the need to do anything else here other than see about getting _that_ API into TS, and since it's basically just text-in and text-out, that would probably be easier.

It looks like the steps would be:

1. Add `wasm_bindgen` to `render_template` function in `cooklang-reports` (just for starters)
2. Create a template for it to render (could even be to .md, and then we can leverage [MarkdownRenderer](https://docs.obsidian.md/Reference/TypeScript+API/MarkdownRenderer/render)
3. Add calls to Obsidian plugin

That's brilliant! Yes, much easier way to get this working. There's even [cooklang-to-md](https://github.com/Zheoni/cooklang-chef/tree/main/cooklang-to-md) which we can probably use. The only problem is that looking at roadmap, features like shopping list creation would be problematic (with cooklang-to-md,, but with reports is okay).

FYI, a PR is available to benefit from cooklang-ts #47 .

It has the benefits of being less behind the current specs in comparison with  the currently used death_au/cooklang package.

I understand it's still not perfect, but I worked on this as an intermediary step forward while the WASM toolset is not available. I hope this will be seen as helpful.
Rebased @xcambar and try to merge it under #52

issueDTO.title: Add example sketches for all p5.Amplitude methods in p5.Sound reference
issueDTO.description:
### Increasing Access

 The p5.Sound reference pages currently lack live examples. This issue is specifically for the p5.Amplitude class. Without examples, it???s hard for users to see how each method behaves in a sketch.

 Add one or more simple example sketches demonstrating each of the following p5.Amplitude methods:

- [ ] `getLevel()`
- [ ] `setInput()`
- [ ] `smooth()`
- [ ] `toggleNormalize()`

You can consult the API details here for guidance:
https://p5js.org/reference/p5.sound/p5.Amplitude/

**_Feel free to add one example or multiple examples for any of these methods and submit a PR._**.



### Most appropriate sub-area of p5.js?

Reference

### Feature request details

issueDTO.title: Benchmark Sniffnet performance
issueDTO.description:
This issue wants to track the need for a benchmark to accurately measure the speed of the app, measured in packets per second (pps) that can be handled without dropping frames.

This is necessary to find out ways that can help improving the performance even further.

> Today I tried testing Sniffnet with `iperf` on a different machine and I could observe that the current packets per second limit is higher than 100k:
>
> ![Screenshot 2024-01-09 at 12 26 24](https://github.com/GyulyVGC/sniffnet/assets/100347457/d1c49afe-a65d-433b-a16b-522c118fc8b3)
>
> _Originally discussed in #373_
comments:
Since the introduction of PCAP files import in version 1.4, we now have a more reliable and stable way of assessing the app performance without relying on Internet connectivity and network adapter speed limits.
It's in fact enough to import a large PCAP file and divide the total number of parsed packets by the time it takes to parse the file to obtain an accurate packet per second rate.

An example of this is shown in [this blog post](https://sniffnet.net/news/v1.4/).

***

**_Update_**: and this is a video showing the same file of the blog post parsed by another computer of mine running a Debian distribution.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6fcb62fd-c68c-42cd-a7db-ea99af522e52

This mini PC is way faster than the PC I used for the blog post video.
PC details: [Beelink SER7 Mini-PC, Ryzen 7 7840HS (8C/16T, up to 5.1GHz) Mini Computer, AMD Radeon 780M, 32GB DDR5+1TB SSD Micro Desktop, Mini Gaming PC 4K Quad Displays HDMI+DP+Dual USB4, 2.5Gbps LAN, WiFi 6]

As you can see it processes 2.6 million packets in just about 6 seconds, reaching a mad rate of **more than 400k packets per second**!

issueDTO.title: Blob discovery & selective announcement
issueDTO.description:
We need to implement blob discovery via libp2p's `kad` implementation ([ref](https://docs.rs/libp2p/latest/libp2p/kad/index.html))

And consider if we intend to announce every blob or just ones that are deemed okay.

For example: documents shared in an app may be encrypted, we want to announce we have the encrypted one, so other peers in the context can retrieve them, but not the raw files.

We may perhaps consider introducing a syscall to the wasm environment to indicate to the node certain blob_id's are safe to announce.

Q: what if one context says it's safe and another, not.. what to do then?

repository.name: core

summary.main: Implement blob discovery via libp2p's `kad` implementation and decide on selective announcement of blobs.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Consider introducing a syscall to the wasm environment to indicate safe blob IDs.
summary.attemptedFixes: No attempted fixes mentioned in the description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: The issue involves implementing blob discovery via libp2p's `kad` implementation and considering selective announcement of blobs. For example, encrypted documents may be announced, but not the raw files. A syscall may be introduced to indicate safe blob IDs in the wasm environment.

issueDTO.title: [DevOps] Populate Meshery Catalog with Sample Apps using meshery UI
issueDTO.description:
## Current Situation
[Meshery Catalog](https://meshery.io/catalog) has a relatively small number of published designs.

## Desired Situation

Meshery Catalog is populated with a variety of published designs, representing any number of technologies in the designs and representing different categories of designs. 

## Difficultly Level: Beginner

This is a beginner-level issue designed to both help introduce you, the contributor, to additional Kubernetes concepts and DevOps practices, and to aid in creating a robust catalog full of cloud native design patterns and sample apps in the Meshery Catalog.

## Skills Needed

1. No coding skills needed.
2. Awareness of Kubernetes.

## Implementation

1. **Identify a Kubernetes sample app**
    1. Bring your own Kubernetes manifest or Helm Chart or Docker Compose file or...
    3. ...or identify a sample app from any available in public repos ([example 1](https://github.com/AdminTurnedDevOps/kubernetes-examples), [example 2](https://github.com/kubernetes/examples), [example 3](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes-engine-samples)).
    1. Attempt to identify resources that can benefit both newcomers and seasoned professionals.
1. **Import Kubernetes App**
    1. Import the sample application using import modal present in toolbar, [following this guide](https://docs.meshery.io/extensions/importing-a-design). 
1. **Publish Kubernetes App**
    1. Publish your sample app into the Meshery Catalog. Guides: Using Meshery UI or [Using MeshMap](https://docs.meshery.io/extensions/publishing-a-design).
1. **[Optional] Open App in Playground**
    1. Access [Meshery Playground](https://play.meshery.io) and open your app in [MeshMap](https://docs.meshery.io/extensions/meshmap).
1. **[Optional] Share your Kubernetes App**
    1. Be social and share your imported apps on twitter or linkedin and the Meshery project accounts will repost.
1. **Repeat**
    1. Import and publish five or more sample apps.

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Five or more new sample apps have been imported into Meshery and published into the Meshery Catalog.

---
### Contributor [Guides](https://docs.meshery.io/project/contributing) and [Handbook](https://layer5.io/community/handbook)
- 🛠 [Meshery Build & Release Strategy](https://docs.meshery.io/project/contributing/build-and-release)
- 📚 [Instructions for contributing to documentation](https://github.com/meshery/meshery/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#documentation-contribution-flow)
   - Meshery documentation [site](https://docs.meshery.io/) and [source](https://github.com/meshery/meshery/tree/master/docs)
- 🎨 Wireframes and designs for Meshery UI in [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/SMP3zxOjZztdOLtgN4dS2W/Meshery-UI)
- 🙋🏾🙋🏼 Questions: [Discussion Forum](http://discuss.meshery.io) and [Community Slack](https://slack.meshery.io)

with all values set to `null`.

issueDTO.title: BackendConfigPolicy assumes a string for anyOf value
issueDTO.description:
### kgateway version

v.2.1.0

### Kubernetes Version

1.31.4

### Describe the bug

Both `initialConnectionWindowSize` and `initialStreamWindowSize` are defined as _anyOf_ fields that can be either integers or strings, but the validation rules assume they're always strings and try to call quantity(self) on them. When the value is an integer, this fails.

### Expected Behavior


Something like this could fix it in the CRD, not sure if additional logic is expected in the controller
```
x-kubernetes-int-or-string: true
x-kubernetes-validations:
- message: InitialConnectionWindowSize must be between 65535 and 2147483647 bytes (inclusive)
  rule: (type(self) == int && int(self) >= 65535 && int(self) <= 2147483647) || (type(self) == string && quantity(self).isGreaterThan(quantity('65534')) && quantity(self).isLessThan(quantity('2147483648')))
```

### Steps to reproduce the bug

```yaml
apiVersion: gateway.kgateway.dev/v1alpha1
kind: BackendConfigPolicy
metadata:
  name: httpbin1-policy
  namespace: 
  labels:
    lab: connection-policy
spec:
  targetRefs:
    - name: httpbin1
      group: ""
      kind: Service
  http2ProtocolOptions:
    initialConnectionWindowSize: 65535
    initialStreamWindowSize: 2147483647
```

```shell
The BackendConfigPolicy "httpbin1-policy" is invalid:
* spec.http2ProtocolOptions.initialConnectionWindowSize: Invalid value: "": 'no such overload: quantity(int)': call arguments did not match a supported operator, function or macro signature for rule: InitialConnectionWindowSize must be between 65535 and 2147483647 bytes (inclusive)
* spec.http2ProtocolOptions.initialStreamWindowSize: Invalid value: "": 'no such overload: quantity(int)': call arguments did not match a supported operator, function or macro signature for rule: InitialStreamWindowSize must be between 65535 and 2147483647 bytes (inclusive)
```

### Additional Environment Detail

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments: the issue here is the CEL validation function `quantity` only accepts strings. Maybe adding an addition "string only" validation to the field would be better UX
/assign
@jmunozro @puertomontt I left a comment a few days ago. I???d appreciate it if you could share your thoughts on my approach. Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

The parameter can be string `"64Ki"` or integer `268435456 `. Forcing the user to do strings `"1000"` is not great UX:

```json
http2ProtocolOptions:
  maxConcurrentStreams: 1000
  initialStreamWindowSize: "1000" <------------ THIS LOOKS ODD
  overrideStreamErrorOnInvalidHttpMessage: true
```

I proposed a solution to have a conditional validation:
```
x-kubernetes-int-or-string: true
x-kubernetes-validations:
- message: InitialConnectionWindowSize must be between 65535 and 2147483647 bytes (inclusive)
  rule: (type(self) == int && int(self) >= 65535 && int(self) <= 2147483647) || (type(self) == string && quantity(self).isGreaterThan(quantity('65534')) && quantity(self).isLessThan(quantity('2147483648')))
```

So you confirm there is no way to have them both?
@devc007 try changing the CEL validation to what Jesus suggested. That way we can preserve compatibility with int or string

repository.description: The Cloud-Native API Gateway and AI Gateway
repository.name: kgateway

summary.main: BackendConfigPolicy assumes a string for anyOf value, both `initialConnectionWindowSize` and `initialStreamWindowSize` are defined as _anyOf_ fields that can be either integers or strings, but the validation rules assume they're always strings and try to call quantity(self) on them, when the value is an integer, this fails
summary.validationOrRequirement: x-kubernetes-int-or-string: true, x-kubernetes-validations: - message: InitialConnectionWindowSize must be between 65535 and 2147483647 bytes (inclusive), rule: (type(self) == int && int(self) >= 65535 && int(self) <= 2147483647) || (type(self) == string && quantity(self).isGreaterThan(quantity('65534')) && quantity(self).isLessThan(quantity('2147483648')))
summary.attemptedFixes: proposed a solution to use a custom implementation called QuantityString, CEL validation to what Jesus suggested
summary.otherNotes: CEL validation function `quantity` only accepts strings, adding an addition 'string only' validation to the field would be better UX, resource.Quantity is designed to accept both integer and string values, proposing a solution to use a custom implementation called QuantityString, forcing the user to do strings is not great UX, proposed a solution to have a conditional validation

issueDTO.title: Suverys missing validation
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

Discovered by @julietapasetti, alerts should be shown to users & admins who don't save dates in Survey forms. Currently saving dates and leaving them empty allows users to continue saving leaving the form with previous dates.

### To Reproduce

1. Login
2. Head to processes 
3. Find a process with surveys configured
4. Create a new survey 
5. Fill all the relevant fields and including the dates
6. Click save 
7. Edit the survey you just saved
8. Head to the dates and leave them empty
9. Click save
10. Head to edit again.
11. See the bug. Survey saved with the previous date.

### Expected behavior

Users and admins shouldn't be allowed to save surveys with empty dates.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Stacktrace

_No response_

### Extra data

- Device: Framework
- Device OS: UBUNTU 24.22
- Browser: FIREFOX
- Decidim Version: v0.30
- Decidim installation: beta.try.decidim.org


### Additional context

Looking at the model I think the `:starts_at` & `:ends_at` are missing `presence: true` validations. 

Adding these to `decidim-surveys/app/models/decidim/surveys/survey.rb` should fix the issue.

issueDTO.title: There is a problem with the number of node titles incrementing inside the copied iterative node
issueDTO.description: ### Self Checks - [x] I have read the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542). - [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general). - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report, otherwise it will be closed. - [x] ??????????????? & Non English User????????????????????????????????????????????? ?????? - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### Dify version 1.6.0 ### Cloud or Self Hosted Self Hosted (Docker) ### Steps to reproduce Step 1: Add an iteration node after the start node Step 2: Add an LLM node to the iteration node, and add a template conversion node after the LLM node Step 3: Add another template conversion node to the iteration start node, parallel to the LLM node in step 2 Step 4: ctrl+D to copy this iteration node and check the canvas display ### ?????? Expected Behavior The title of the node should be normal after copying +1 ### ??? Actual Behavior If there are parallel branches within an iteration, after the iteration is copied, the auto-increment numbers of some nodes' titles will be exactly the same.
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This issue happens because the logic for generating node titles during copy/paste is split: top-level nodes use a function that increments the number in the title (like "Node (1)", "Node (2)"), but child nodes inside iterations use a type-counting approach that doesn't always guarantee unique titles, especially with parallel branches. This can result in duplicate titles when copying complex iterative nodes.

To fix this, the unique title generation logic (such as the `genNewNodeTitleFromOld` function) needs to be applied recursively to all child nodes during the copy process, not just to the top-level node. You can find the relevant logic in the `handleNodeIterationChildrenCopy` function and related utilities in the workflow codebase. Adjusting this to ensure every copied node gets a unique, incremented title should resolve the duplicate title issue in copied iterations with parallel branches.  
More details and code references can be found [here](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/a4ef9009167ed7cf22b0b8bd3a903e8ba0a74567/web/app/components/workflow/hooks/use-nodes-interactions.ts) and [here](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/a4ef9009167ed7cf22b0b8bd3a903e8ba0a74567/web/app/components/workflow/nodes/iteration/use-interactions.ts).

As of now, there are no documented workarounds or upstream fixes, so updating the recursive copy logic is the recommended approach.

@dosu  So you don't think this is a bug?

<!-- Answer -->
Yes, this is a bug. The current logic for generating node titles during copy doesn't guarantee unique titles for all nodes, especially for parallel branches inside iteration nodes. This leads to duplicate titles, which is not the expected behavior for auto-incrementing node names. The root cause is that top-level nodes use a function that ensures uniqueness, but child nodes inside iterations use a different approach that can result in duplicates. Fixing this would require unifying the title generation logic so every copied node, including children, gets a unique title as expected. You can see the technical details in the code here: [use-nodes-interactions.ts](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/a4ef9009167ed7cf22b0b8bd3a903e8ba0a74567/web/app/components/workflow/hooks/use-nodes-interactions.ts) and [use-interactions.ts](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/a4ef9009167ed7cf22b0b8bd3a903e8ba0a74567/web/app/components/workflow/nodes/iteration/use-interactions.ts).

issueDTO.title: bug: Unlike other runtimes, WasmEdge does not output "funcref"
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

I executed the following test case with different runtimes like Wasmtime, Wasmer, WAMR, and WasmEdge. Wasmtime outputs `<null funcref>`, Wasmer outputs `funcref`, and WAMR outputs `func:ref.null`. But, WasmEdge's compiled and interpreter modes do not produce an output similar to "funcref".

Test case:

```
(module
  (type (;0;) (func))
  (type (;1;) (func (result funcref)))
  (export "main" (func 0))
  (export "to_test" (func 0))
  (func (;0;) (type 1) (result funcref)
    ref.null func
    ref.null func
    i32.const 213
    select (result funcref)
  )
)
```

### Current State

Does not output `funcref` or `<null funcref>`.

### Expected State

Should output "null funcref".

### Reproduction steps

1. Compiled: `wasmedge compile test.wasm test.so`; `wasmedge --enable-all run test.so to_test`
2. Interpreted: `wasmedge --enable-all run test.so to_test`

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Any logs you want to share for showing the specific issue

Can you please confirm if this looks like a bug? Thanks in advance.

### Components

CLI

### WasmEdge Version or Commit you used

0.14.1-271-ga89c176f

### Operating system information

Ubuntu 22.04

### Hardware Architecture

x86_64

### Compiler flags and options

_No response_
comments: Hi @teyahb8 Could you please also provide the version of wasmtime? When I try to reproduce this issue to check the output from other runtimes, I found the wasmtime produced nothing in the output like this: My wasmtime version: ``` wasmtime 31.0.0 (7a9be587f 2025-03-20) ```

Hi @hydai 

I am using `wasmtime 31.0.0 (e33c42695 2025-03-01)`. I am executing the test case with the following command on the wasmtime runtime:

```
$> wasmtime run -W all-proposals=y --invoke to_test select_1C~t_18830_0_17520168708384514.wasm
<null funcref>
```

Thanks, @teyahb8.  
I can now reproduce the same result.  

The root cause is that we have not yet supported non-trivial values as output: https://github.com/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/blob/master/lib/driver/runtimeTool.cpp#L183-L212.  

I will mark this as a good first issue for those who want to contribute.
Thanks for the confirmation, @hydai .

Hi @hydai !  I???ve set up the project locally and would love to work on this issue.
If possible, could you please assign it to me?
Otherwise, I???ll proceed and raise a PR soon.
Good to know. It's yours now.

issueDTO.title: Improved Policy Editor for Creating and Editing Policies
issueDTO.description:
**User Story**:
As a Policy Editor, I want to have a better user interface for creating and editing policies, so that I can work efficiently without being restricted by a small dialog or needing to use raw Markdown.

**Acceptance Criteria**:

1. The current policy editor is replaced with a dedicated page for creating and editing policies, providing a larger and more usable space.
2. The new editor should be user-friendly, with a rich-text or markdown-based interface suitable for non-technical users (e.g., MDXEditor).
3. The editor should provide basic formatting tools like headings, bullet points, links, and tables without requiring manual Markdown input.
4. A preview function allows the user to see how the policy will appear before publishing.
5. The editor should support the addition of policy metadata (e.g., version, responsible person, approval status).

**Notes**:

* The new editor should integrate well with the platform???s existing policy approval and publishing workflows.
* The solution should be flexible enough to accommodate different policy formats, including those with images or tables.

issueDTO.title: Feature Request: Support Plex "Skip Ads" function during playback
issueDTO.description:
### **Description:**
If you have the subscription/paid version of Plex Server, then during recording live TV, you can detect and offer during playback to skip ads.
The detect ads/commercials inside Plex Server has two modes of operation;
1. Detect commercials and mark for skip (safest in case of a detection error)
2. Detect and delete commercials (do not record the ad segment thereby a smaller saved recording)

I always use the detect and offer to skip.
plex-for-kodi doesn't offer the "Skip Ads" button during playback of a recorded TV show.
If I watch the same recorded TV show using the plex.tv web based browser client or the Apple TV 4K Plex client, then the offer to "Skip Ads" appears and with a single button push you skip the entire ad break segment. It's actually really good and rarely gets anything wrong.

Please support the "Skip Ads" feature for the paid version of Plex Server.

### **Details:**
Add-on version: 0.7.9
Kodi version: 21.1.0
OS Platform: CoreELEC 21.1.1
Hardware: Ugoos AM6B+

### **Reference & More Information:**
Plex Server URL about ad detect and skip: 
[Plex Server - Removing Commercials](https://support.plex.tv/articles/115003944134-removing-commercials/)

![Plex web client Skip Ads button](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/09a8c081-6e41-465b-b78c-2e605fbe2563)

### **Checklist**
- [X] No logs provided, but, very happy to add anything requested.
- [X] I don't seem to have the rights to be able to add appropriate GitHub labels, otherwise I would have...

Please let me know if this of assistance and I will get this prepared for you.

issueDTO.title: Quality/Bitrate of Transcode Enhancement
issueDTO.description: I like the recent changes to the transcode setting but 26Mbps as highest rate is a bit low for local network transcode. I was requesting more bitrates but thought about how about Instead of a fix numeric value, is it possible to do a % of the Original bitrate instead? Hope you consider this.
comments:
A dynamic bitrate is going to be hard to realize. I'll check.

It'd probably have to be a global setting, which results in "custom (bitratenumber)" in the bitrate dropdown right below original.
That is also an option if you can have a custom bitrate
It could be a custom global bitrate, and/or a custom global percentage.

Customisable % would be great. As fix numerical value could still lead to
transcode bitrate being higher than original like what original plex client
does where it auto sets it at 100Mbps even when original isn't that high maybe okay with x264 transcode but now with HEVC transcode it's not desirable

> ???

issueDTO.title: Test `NeoFSStateSyncExtensions` on large chains
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
`NeoFSStateSyncExtensions` are tested only on private network with low number of blocks (~200K).

## Describe the solution you'd like
Test `NeoFSStateSyncExtensions` on FS chains at 15M+ blocks and on N3 chains as far. Ensure state synchronisation works as expected in different scenarios: interruption in the middle of headers/blocks/MPT sync/statejump, problems with connection to NeoFS storage etc. Ensure state compatibility and node's DB completeness.

## Describe alternatives you've considered
Leave it to @532910.

## Additional context
Depends on #3898, #3825 and we don't yet have state data uploaded to NeoFS mainnet, so need to run uploaders firstly.

repository.name: neo-go

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to improve the database restore process by auto-detecting the need for incremental dumps and providing a clear message to the user about the requirement for the -n flag.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The -n flag is required for incremental dumps, and the user should be notified of this requirement.
summary.attemptedFixes: Ideally, auto-detect the need for incremental; second best, notify the user that the input is an incremental file and needs the -n flag; as a last resort, don't suggest the input file is empty when it is not.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to a problem with restoring a database, specifically with incremental dumps. The user forgot to include the -n flag, which results in a confusing message about having 0 blocks.

issueDTO.title: Support querying parts of node config (e.g SaveInvocations setting)
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I'm always frustrated when I can't identify if a node has the awesome `SaveInvocations` option enabled or not. The same could also hold for `KeepOnlyLatestState`, but my personal main concern is `SaveInvocations`.

## Describe the solution you'd like
I'd like a way to programmatically query the node to see if it meets my needs of having `SaveInvocations` enabled. This could be a RPC extension method

## Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->

## Additional context
Without this feature I cannot properly safe guard against using a node that does not provide the necessary data for indexing (Dora).
comments:
In general nodes shouldn't disclose their configurations to random people on the internet. At the same time many of these configuration parameters can be probed indirectly (like KOL, either you get a response or not).

Related to #3754.

I understand your point of not disclosing configurations, but at the same time I feel there's a set of settings that if disclosed aren't really dangerous data. And as you said they can likely be derived from side channels anyway. Having said that I'd much rather have a simple solution to the problem than fancy lookups that not everybody knows how to.

> there's a set of settings that if disclosed aren't really dangerous data

That's true, as I've said above many of them can be probed indirectly, so exposing them explicitly is not a problem. Still, each particular option should be considered on its own wrt this.

> I'd much rather have a simple solution to the problem than fancy lookups

Agree.

> Related to https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/issues/3754.

Vote up for this, let's make it a part of `getversion` response, it seems pretty natural. I doubt we need a separate fully-qualified RPC handler for this.

repository.description: Go Node and SDK for the Neo blockchain
repository.name: neo-go

summary.main: The main goal is to support querying parts of the node's configuration, such as the 'SaveInvocations' setting, programmatically.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The author wants to query parts of the node's configuration, specifically the 'SaveInvocations' setting, and possibly other settings that are not dangerous data.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author suggests a RPC extension method to query the node's configuration, and some comments agree with this approach.
summary.otherNotes: The author is concerned about not being able to identify if a node has the 'SaveInvocations' option enabled, and would like a way to programmatically query the node for this information. The author believes that certain configuration parameters are not dangerous data and can be probed indirectly. Some comments suggest considering each option individually and making it a part of the 'getversion' response.

issueDTO.title: Consider removing compatibility code from Neo's `registerCandidate`

## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/pull/3700 introduces a workaround to native Neo's `registerCandidate` callback to ensure state processing compatibility before Echidna:
https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/blob/e80e08da5f1183643d3cdc51d8f45c1094145057/pkg/core/native/native_neo.go#L827-L834
See also https://github.com/neo-project/neo/pull/3597#discussion_r1870187913.

This compatibility code may be dropped after transition to Echidna, but we need to check public networks for compatibility before this change.

## Describe the solution you'd like
Drop the code, process N3 mainnet/testnet, ensure states are not affected by this change.

issueDTO.title: Cover example contracts with tests
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Some of our example contracts are not tested although they are complicated. In fact, only NNS contract has some unit-tests.

## Describe the solution you'd like
At least complicated contracts like `nft-nd` and `nft-d` must be covered with neotest unit tests. Ideally, all of them must be covered with tests. First of all, these contracts are *examples* for other SC developers. Secondly, when we extend these contracts, we need to have a way to check that extension works properly, e.g. for situations like in https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/pull/3560.

## Describe alternatives you've considered
No alternatives, tests are must-have.
comments: Ping to this issue, there's a demand from user side to see how `neotest` works, and currently we can only provide NNS tests as an example. It's always good when we can provide more examples on how to use neotest.

issueDTO.title: Provide library functions to convert numbers into BE-ordered byte strings
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I'm always frustrated when contracts have to write code to deal with simple problems. BE-serialized integers are useful because of their ordering characteristics, but default int->bytes conversion is LE in the VM.

## Describe the solution you'd like
Provide methods to obtain fixed-width byte string from integer in BE format.

## Additional context
https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neofs-contract/pull/438
comments: Fixed LE can be useful as well. Consider doing this in `convert` package.
Bytes -> Uint would also be nice for https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neofs-contract/pull/494.

repository.name: neo-go

summary.main: The main goal is to provide library functions to convert numbers into BE-ordered byte strings, which would be useful for ordering characteristics.
summary.validationOrRequirement: No specific validations or requirements mentioned, but the author mentions that LE can be useful as well and suggests considering this in the `convert` package.
summary.attemptedFixes: No attempted fixes mentioned in the description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to a problem with default int->bytes conversion being in Little Endian (LE) format in the VM, and the author wants to provide methods to obtain fixed-width byte string from integer in Big Endian (BE) format.

issueDTO.title: CLI usage text unification
issueDTO.description:
Sometimes we have `-o file [-s start]`  and sometimes it `--wif <wif> [--name <account_name>]`.
https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/pull/3495#issuecomment-2213301628
comments: I vote for option with `<>` since it allows to clearly identify flag example and multi-words flags look more recognizable with `<>`.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/basedefs/V1_chap12.html

Also
```
       SYNOPSIS      A brief summary of the command or function's interface.

Brackets ([]) surround optional arguments, vertical bars (|) separate choices, and ellipses (...) can be repeated.  For functions, it shows any required data declarations

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Typing opening square bracket in node search box causes regex error
issueDTO.description: ### Custom Node Testing - [x] I have tried disabling custom nodes and the issue persists (see [how to disable custom nodes](https://docs.comfy.org/troubleshooting/custom-node-issues#step-1%3A-test-with-all-custom-nodes-disabled) if you need help) ### Frontend Version 1.24.1 (latest) ### Expected Behavior When typing an opening square bracket `[` in the node search box, the search should either: - Escape the special character properly in the regex - Continue to work without throwing an error ### Actual Behavior When typing `[` in the node search box popover component, the application throws a JavaScript error and the search functionality breaks. Error: ``` vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5 SyntaxError: Invalid regular expression: /([)/gi: Unterminated character class (at formatUtil.ts:42:17) at new RegExp () at highlightQuery (formatUtil.ts:42:17) at Proxy. (NodeSearchItem.vue:81:15) ``` ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open ComfyUI frontend 2. Right-click on the canvas to open the node search box 3. Type `[` (opening square bracket) in the search input 4. Observe the JavaScript error in the browser console ### Debug Logs N/A - Frontend only issue ### Browser Logs ``` vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5 SyntaxError: Invalid regular expression: /([)/gi: Unterminated character class (at formatUtil.ts:42:17) at new RegExp () at highlightQuery (formatUtil.ts:42:17) at Proxy. (NodeSearchItem.vue:81:15) at iJ (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:63907) at ek.a [as fn] (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:53813) at ek.run (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:7130) at H (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:54179) at U (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:52411) at V (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:52226) at x (vue.esm-browser.prod.js:5:49179) ``` ### Setting JSON Default settings (issue occurs with fresh installation) ### What browsers do you use to access the UI ? Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox ### Other Information The issue is in `src/utils/formatUtil.ts` at line 42 in the `highlightQuery` function: ```typescript export function highlightQuery(text: string, query: string) { if (\!query) return text const regex = new RegExp(`(${query})`, 'gi') // This line fails when query contains special regex characters return text.replace(regex, '$1') } ``` The function needs to escape special regex characters in the query string before creating the RegExp. Other special characters like `]`, `(`, `)`, `{`, `}`, `*`, `+`, `?`, `.`, `^`, `$`, ` < /dev/null | `, and `\\` would likely cause similar issues. This might be related to FuseJS smart search syntax features being enabled, but the root cause is that the `highlightQuery` function doesn't escape regex special characters. ???Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-4466-Bug-Typing-opening-square-bracket-in-node-search-box-causes-regex-error-2336d73d365081b5b6c8c5d575a3835a) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)
comments: Hi @christian-byrne, I???d love to work on this issue. The regex escape problem is clear, and I can implement the safe escape and test it properly. Can I go ahead?

summary.otherNotes: The issue is in src/utils/formatUtil.ts at line 42 in the highlightQuery function. The function needs to escape special regex characters in the query string before creating the RegExp. This might be related to FuseJS smart search syntax features being enabled, but the root cause is that the highlightQuery function doesn't escape regex special characters.

According to the documentation of trivy, first, we need to generate the SBOM file in the desired format. To do that I will make a container using dagger and make that JSON file and export it from that container to local using the below command :
```
trivy image --format cyclonedx -o sbom.cdx.json <IMAGE>
```

Then, once we have got the SBOM file in the desired format, we need to replace this command in the below [file](https://github.com/goharbor/harbor-cli/blob/7f439409d79d9cb16bfed51ba7d25292a6da52c2/dagger/main.go#L365) with `attest` instead of `sign` to run this below command. This attest command attaches the SBOM to the image.
```
cosign attest --key /path/to/cosign.key --type cyclonedx --predicate sbom.cdx.json <IMAGE>
```

I believe the required changes will only need to be made in this [file](https://github.com/goharbor/harbor-cli/blob/main/dagger/main.go) in this particular [function](https://github.com/goharbor/harbor-cli/blob/7f439409d79d9cb16bfed51ba7d25292a6da52c2/dagger/main.go#L336C1-L371C2)
